en: And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and Jehovah his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
hmr: Chun, David naupa Solomon chu a rama chun sukdet a ni tah a, LALPA a Pathien chu a kuomah a um a, ama chu nasatakin a chawimawi a.

en: And Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every prince in all Israel, the heads of the fathers’ houses.
hmr: Solomon chun, Israel mi po pohai le, sipai za khat pâwl le sâng khat pâwl hotuhai kuoma le, rorêltuhai kuoma le, Israel rama lalhai po po kuoma le, pahnam luhai kuoma chun thu a hril a.

en: So Solomon, and all the assembly with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tent of meeting of God, which Moses the servant of Jehovah had made in the wilderness.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon le a kuoma mipui inkhâwmhai po po chu Gibeona bâwlhmuna chun an hang fe tah a; LALPA siehlaw Mosien thla- lêra Pathien ta dinga intuokna in a siem chu chutaka chun a um sih a.

en: But the ark of God had David brought up from Kiriath-jearim to the place that David had prepared for it; for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien bâwm chu David chun Kiriath-jearima in- thawk khan a hung lâk a, Davidin a siena dinga a buotsai hmuna khan a lo sie tah a; Jerusalema khan, chu hmun ding chun puon in a lo zâr ta sih a.

en: Moreover the brazen altar, that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, was there before the tabernacle of Jehovah: and Solomon and the assembly sought unto it.
hmr: Chunawa khawm, dârsen mâi- châm Hur naupa, Uri naupa Bezalel- in a lo siem ta chu LALPA biekbûk hmaa chun a um bawk a; Solomon le mipui chun an va pan a.

en: And Solomon went up thither to the brazen altar before Jehovah, which was at the tent of meeting, and offered a thousand burnt-offerings upon it.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu LALPA hmaa dârsen mâichâm intuokna ina uma chun a hang feh a, a chunga chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân sâng khat lai ân hlân a.

en: In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
hmr: Chu zân chun Solomon kuomah LALPA chu a hung inlâr a, a kuomah, “Ieng am a na ka pêk ding che, mi hni rawh,” a ta.

en: And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast showed great lovingkindness unto David my father, and hast made me king in his stead.
hmr: Solomon chun Pathien kuoma chun, “Ka pa David kuoma chun lung- insietna nasatak i lo inentir tah a, ama aia chun tuhin lalah i mi siem tah a.

en: Now, O Jehovah God, let thy promise unto David my father be established; for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
hmr: Tuhin, Aw LALPA Pathien, ka pa David kuoma i thutiem chu suk- puitling ni raw se; tam tienga hnuoia pilvut zât rau ang mipui chunga hin lalah i mi siem ta sih a.

en: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this thy people, that is so great?
hmr: Hi mipuihai hmaa hin ka lûta ka suok theina dingin tuhin varna le hrietthiem theina nangin mi pe la; chuong naw chun, hi i mihai hieng zât lâwm lâwm hi tuin am ro rêlpêk thei an ta?” a ta.

en: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thy heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honor, nor the life of them that hate thee, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:
hmr: Pathien chun Solomon kuomah, “Hi hi i lungrilah a um a, hausak- nahai, neinungnahai le inzaumnahai amanih, nangma theidatuhai che hringna amanih, i hni nawh a, dam sâwtna khawm i hni bawk nawh a, amiruokchu, ka mihai, an chunga lala ka siemnahai che chu ro i rêl- pêk theina dinga nangma ta dinga varna le hrietthiem theina i hni lem leiin;

en: wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honor, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee; neither shall there any after thee have the like.
hmr: varna le hrietthiem theina chu i kuoma pêk a ni tah a; i hmaa lalhai tukhawma an nei dêr lo le, nangma hnunga tukhawma chuong anga an nei dêr lo ding hausaknahai le, nei- nungnahai le, inzâkaina pêng ka ti che,” a ta.

en: So Solomon came from the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the tent of meeting, unto Jerusalem; and he reigned over Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chu a vân zinna Gibeona bâwlhmun, in- tuokna puon in hmaa inthawk chun Jerusalema chun a hung tah a; chuongchun, Israel chunga chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun sakawr tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai chu a kei khâwm a, sakawr tawlailîr sâng khat le za li le, sakawr chung chuong mi sîng khat le sâng hni a nei a; chuong chu sakawr tawlailîr khawpuiahai le lal kuomah Jerusalema chun a sieh a.

en: And the king made silver and gold to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore-trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
hmr: Chun, lal chun tangka le râng- kachak chu Jerusalema chun lung ang el le, Sidar thing chu phai rama theichang kûng ang ela tama intiengin a sieh a.

en: And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; the king’s merchants received them in droves, each drove at a price.
hmr: Chun, Solomonin sakawr a neihai chu Aigupta rama inthawka inchâwk suok vawng an nih; lal sumdâwng mihai chun a ruol ruolin an lo khâr hlak a, a ruola inchâwk pei a nih;

en: And they fetched up and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.
hmr: chuongchun, an hung lâk a, Aiguptaa inthawkin sakawr tawlailîr chu tangkaruo shekel za ruk peiin an intlungtir bawk a; chun, sakawrhai chu Hit mi lalhai le Suria lalhai ta ding khawmin an suktlungpêk hlak a; sakawrhai chu tangkaruo shekel za le sâwmnga peiin an intlungtir a nih.

en: And Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.
hmr: Rehoboam chu Sekema chun a feh a; Israelhai po po chu ama chu lala siem dingin Sekema chun an hung sih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of king Solomon), that Jeroboam returned out of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam chun chu chu a lo hriet chun, (Solomon hmaa inthawka a tlân- hmangna Aigupta rama chun a la um a ni sih a.) Jeroboam chu Aigupta rama inthawk chun a hung kîr tah a.

en: And they sent and called him; and Jeroboam and all Israel came, and they spake to Rehoboam, saying,
hmr: Chun, mi an tir a, ama chu an ko tah a; chuongchun, Jeroboam le Israelhai po po chu an hung a, Rehoboam kuoma chun an hril a,

en: Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy father, and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.
hmr: “I pa khan kan rîngkawl chu riktakin a lo siem tah a; chuleiin, tuhin i pa rawngbâwlna riktak le, kan chunga rîngkawl rik ân nghat hi mi sukzâng pêk la, chuongchun, i rawngbâwl kan tih,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, Come again unto me after three days. And the people departed.
hmr: Anni kuoma chun, “Ni thum hnungah ka kuomah hung nâwk ro,” a lo tih a, chuongchun, mipui chu an fe tah a.

en: And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chun mi upa- hai, a pa Solomon damlaia a hmaa ngîr hlakhai chu, “Hi mipuihai hi dawn kirna dingin ieng thurâwn am in mi pêk a,” tiin, a râwn a.

en: And they spake unto him, saying, If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Hi mipui chunga hin za i ngai a, anni hi i suklungawi a, an kuomah thu ṭha i hril chun kumkhuoin i siehlawhai nîng an tih,” an ta.

en: But he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him, and took counsel with the young men that were grown up with him, that stood before him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, upahai thurâwn ama an pêk ta chu a nghatsan a, ama hmaa ngîr hlak, ama ruolpuihai tlangvâlhai chu a rawn tah a.

en: And he said unto them, What counsel give ye, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke that thy father did put upon us lighter?
hmr: An kuoma chun, “Hieng mipui, ‘I pain kan chunga rîngkawl a innghat hi mi sukzângpêk rawh,’ tituhai hi ieng dawnna am ei inkîr thei ding ieng am thurâwn in nei a?” a ta.

en: And the young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou say unto the people that spake unto thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus shalt thou say unto them, My little finger is thicker than my father’s loins.
hmr: Tlangvâlhai, ama ruolpuihai chun an hril a, a kuomah, “ ‘I pain kan rîngkawl a sukrik êm a, nangin keini mi sukzângpêk rawh,’ i kuoma tituhai mipui kuoma chun hieng ang hin ti la, hieng ang hin an kuoma chun hril rawh, ‘Ka kutte chu ka pa kâwng- bâwr nêkin a lien lem a.

en: And now whereas my father did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
hmr: Tuhin ka pain rîngkawl rik a lo inphurtir ta cheu a; kei chun in rîng- kawl chu belsâng ka tih; ka pain vuoknain a lo hrem cheu a ni chun, kei chun ainuvêtin hrem ka ti cheu,’ tiin,” an tih a.

en: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king bade, saying, Come to me again the third day.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeroboam le mi- puihai po po chu ni thum ni chun lalin, Ni thum niah ka kuomah hung nâwk ro, tia a lo inthla ang khan a kuomah an hung tah a.

en: And the king answered them roughly; and king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,
hmr: Lal chun vîntakin a lo dawn a; lal Rehoboam chun mi upahai thurâwn chu a nghatsan a,

en: and spake to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add thereto: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
hmr: tlangvâlhai thurâwn angin, “Ka pa chun in rîngkawl chu a lo sukrik hle tah a, keiin chu chu belsâng ka ta; ka pain vuoknain a lo hrem cheu a ni chun, kei chun chu ainuvêtin hrem ka ti cheu,” tiin a lo hril a.

en: So the king hearkened not unto the people; for it was brought about of God, that Jehovah might establish his word, which he spake by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun mipuihai thu chu a ngai nawh a; Silon mi Ahija hmanga Nebat naupa Jeroboam kuoma a thu lo hril tah, a thu chu LALPAIN ân tlungtir theina ding- in, Pathienin a hung intlungtir a ni sih a.

en: And when all Israel saw that the king hearkened not unto them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to your tents, O Israel: now see to thine own house, David. So all Israel departed unto their tents.
hmr: Chuonga Israel po po chun lal chun an thu a ngai nawh ti an hriet chun mipuihai chun an dawn a, “David a hin chanvo ieng am ei nei hrim luoh a? Jesai naupaa hin rochan ieng khawm ei nei bawk nawh; mi tin mâni puon in sengah fe ro, Aw Israel- hai: David, tuhin nangma insûng ngei chu inngaituo ta,” tiin.

en: But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai po po chu an puon inhaia chun an ṭin tâwl tah a. Amiruokchu, Judai ram khaw- puihaia umhai Israel thlahai chunga khan chu Rehoboam chun ro a rêl zing a.

en: Then king Rehoboam sent Hadoram, who was over the men subject to taskwork; and the children of Israel stoned him to death with stones. And king Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, lal Rehoboam chun Hadoram, leiman hotu chu a tir a, Israel thlahai chun ama chu lungin an lo dêng a, a thi tah a. Chun, lal Rehoboam chu a sakawr tawlailîrah a chuong a, inhmâwtakin Jerusalemah a tlânse tah a.

en: So Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel sûngkuo chu David sûngkuo chunga chun, vawisûn ni chen hin an hel tah a.

en: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, a hundred and fourscore thousand chosen men, that were warriors, to fight against Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
hmr: Rehoboam chu Jerusalem a hung tlung chun Benjamin le Juda sûngkuo, nuoi khat le sîng riet, thlang ṭhieu, Israelhai do dinga indo mi, Rehoboam ta dinga ram chu hung la kîr nâwk dingin a ko khâwm tawl a.

en: But the word of Jehovah came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien mi Semaia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung a,

en: Speak unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
hmr: “Judai ram lal Solomon naupa Rehoboam le, Judai rama Benjamin mihai le Israel mi po pohai kuoma chun thu hril la,

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house; for this thing is of me. So they hearkened unto the words of Jehovah, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
hmr: LALPAIN hieng hin a tih ti rawh, ‘Hang fe nâwng in ta, in unauhai chu indopui bawk nâwng in tih: mi tin chu mâni in sengah kîr nâwk el ro: hi thil hi keima thaw a ni sih a,’ tiin,” a ta. Chuongchun, LALPA thu chu an zâwm a, Jeroboam hang do tumnaa inthawk chun an kîr tah a.

en: And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defence in Judah.
hmr: Rehoboam chu Jerusalema chun a um a, Judai rama inhumhimna dingin khawpuihai a bâwl a.

en: He built Beth-lehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
hmr: Bethlehem dâm, Etam dâm, Tekoa dâm,

en: And Beth-zur, and Soco, and Adullam,
hmr: Beth-zur dâm, Soko dâm, Adullam dâm,

en: and Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
hmr: Gath dâm, Maresah dâm, Ziph dâm,

en: and Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
hmr: Adoraim dâm, Lakis dâm, Azeka dâm,

en: and Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin, fortified cities.
hmr: Zora dâm, Aijalon dâm, Hebron dâm, chuong chu Judai rama umhai le, Benjamin rama khawpui kul neihai a nih.

en: And he fortified the strongholds, and put captains in them, and stores of victuals, and oil and wine.
hmr: Chun, kul dettakhai chu a sukdet nâwk zuol a, chuonga chun hotuhai a sieh a, fâk ding le hriek le uoin dâm ân khâwl bawk a.

en: And in every city he put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong. And Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
hmr: Khaw tin hmun tamtaka chun feihai, phâwhai a sieh a, nasatak- in a sukhrât a. Judai hnam le Benjamin hnam chu ama tieng an ṭhang a.

en: And the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel resorted to him out of all their border.
hmr: Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu an umna sûnga inthawk chun ama kuomah Israel ram sûng po poa chun an hung pakai a.

en: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons cast them off, that they should not execute the priest’s office unto Jehovah;
hmr: Levi mihai chun an ram le an khuohai chu an mâksan a, Jerusalem le Judai rama chun an hung a; Jeroboam le a naupasalhai chun anni chu LALPA ta dinga thiempu sinhai chu thaw lo dingin an hnawt suok sih a,

en: and he appointed him priests for the high places, and for the he-goats, and for the calves which he had made.
hmr: chuongchun, ama siem bâwng- têhai, kêlchalhai le bâwlhmunhaia ding chun thiempuhai a ruot fâwm tah a.

en: And after them, out of all the tribes of Israel, such as set their hearts to seek Jehovah, the God of Israel, came to Jerusalem to sacrifice unto Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Chun, an hnunga khawm chun, Israel hnamhai lai po poa mi, Israel Pathien LALPA chu lungrila zawng- tuhai chun an zui a; an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA kuoma inthâwi ding chun Jerusalemah an hung hlak a.

en: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong, three years; for they walked three years in the way of David and Solomon.
hmr: Chuongchun, kum thum sûng chun Judai lalram chu an sukdet tiel tiel a, Solomon naupa Rehoboam chu ân sukdet hle el tah a; kum thum sûng chu David le Solomon lampui chu an hraw sih a.

en: And Rehoboam took him a wife, Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David, and of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chun David naupa Jerimoth le Jesai naupa Eliab naunu Abihail naunu Mahalath chu nuhmeiah a nei a;

en: and she bare him sons: Jeush, and Shemariah, and Zaham.
hmr: amanu chun naupasalhai a neipêk a; Jeus le Semaria le Zaham.

en: And after her he took Maacah the daughter of Absalom; and she bare him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.
hmr: Ama hnunga chun Absalom naunu Maaka chu a nei a; ama chun Abija, Attai, Ziza le Selomith a nei- pêk a.

en: And Rehoboam loved Maacah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines (for he took eighteen wives, and threescore concubines, and begat twenty and eight sons and threescore daughters).
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chun a nu- hmeihai le a thaikêmhai po po nêkin Absalom naunu Maaka chu a hmangai lem a, (nuhmei chu sâwm- pariet a nei a, thaikêm sâwmruk leh; chun, naupasal sâwmhni pariet le naunuhmei sâwmruk a nei bawk sih a).

en: And Rehoboam appointed Abijah the son of Maacah to be chief, even the prince among his brethren; for he was minded to make him king.
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chun Maaka naupa Abija chu lalah, a unauhai laia hotutakah a ruot a; ama chu lala siem a lungril sih a.

en: And he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his sons throughout all the lands of Judah and Benjamin, unto every fortified city: and he gave them victuals in abundance. And he sought for them many wives.
hmr: Chun, vartakin a thawh a, Juda le Benjamin ram po poa chun a nau- pasalhai chu a semdar rak a, khaw- pui kul neihai po poa chun; fâk ding khawm tam tâwk takin a pêk bawk a. An ta dingin nuhmeihai khawm tamtak a zawngpêk bawk a.

en: And it came to pass, when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established, and he was strong, that he forsook the law of Jehovah, and all Israel with him.
hmr: Rehoboam ram chu sukdet a hung na, a hung hrât phing chun, LALPA dân chu a nghatsan tah a, Israelhai po po khawm chun ama an zui veh a.

en: And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had trespassed against Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam inlal kum nganaa chun Aigupta rama lal Sisak chun Jerusalem a hung rûn a, LALPA chungah an lo bawsiet ta leiin;

en: with twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen. And the people were without number that came with him out of Egypt: the Lubim, the Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians.
hmr: sakawr tawlailîr sâng le za hni le sakawr chung chuong mi sîng ruk leh; Aigupta rama inthawka ama hung zuitu Lubim mihai, Sukkiim mihai, Ethiopia mihai le chu tiem sêng ruol lo an nih.

en: And he took the fortified cities which pertained to Judah, and came unto Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Judai rama khawpui kul neihai chu a lâk a, chuongchun, Jerusalema chun a hung pei a.

en: Now Shemaiah the prophet came to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah, that were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, Ye have forsaken me, therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Semaia chu Rehoboam le hotu, Judai ram Sisak leia Jerusalema hung khâwmhai kuoma chun a hung a, an kuoma chun, “LALPA chun hieng ang hin a tih, ‘Kei in mi nghatsan tah, kei khawma Sisak kutah ka mâksan ding cheu a nih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: Then the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves; and they said, Jehovah is righteous.
hmr: Chun, lal tak le Israel upahai chu an insukhnuoi a, “LALPA chu a fel a nih,” an tih a.

en: And when Jehovah saw that they humbled themselves, the word of Jehovah came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves: I will not destroy them; but I will grant them some deliverance, and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
hmr: LALPA chun anni chu an insuk- hnuoi ti a hmu phing chun, Semaia kuoma chun LALPA thu chu a hung tlung tah a, “Anni le anni chu an insukhnuoi a, anni chu sukbohmang vawng naw ning a, amiruokchu, ṭhenkhat sansuokna chu phalpêk ka ta, Sisak kuta hin, Jerusalem chunga ka lungsenna chu bunthlâk ni naw ni.

en: Nevertheless they shall be his servants, that they may know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.
hmr: Amiruokchu, a siehlawhai hung nîng an ta, hieng ramhaia lalram rawngbâwlna le ka rawngbâwlna chu an hriet theina dingin,” tiin.

en: So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of Jehovah, and the treasures of the king’s house: he took all away: he took away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
hmr: Chuongchun, Aigupta lal Sisak chun Jerusalem chu a hung rûn a, lal in rothilhai le LALPA in rothilhai chu a lâk hmang a; chuong chu a lâk hmang vawng a, Solomonin rângka- chak phaw a siemhai khawm kha a lâk hmang vawng a.

en: And king Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, that kept the door of the king’s house.
hmr: Chun, lal Rehoboam chun chuong aia chun dârsen phâwhai a siem a, lal in kawtkhâr vêngtu, vêng- tu pâwl hotu kuoma chun ân kawl- tir a.

en: And it was so, that, as oft as the king entered into the house of Jehovah, the guard came and bare them, and brought them back into the guard-chamber.
hmr: LALPA ina chun lal chu a lût po leh, vêngtu chu a hung a, chuong phâwhai chu a chawi hlak a; chun, vêngtu pindana chun a sie kîr nâwk hlak a nih.

en: And when he humbled himself, the wrath of Jehovah turned from him, so as not to destroy him altogether: and moreover in Judah there were good things found.
hmr: Chun, ama chu ân sukhnuoi tâk lei chun LALPA lunginsenna chu ama sukbohmang let dêr lo dingin lâk- kieng a lo ni tah a; chunawa khawm, Judai ram chu a la ṭha zing bawk a.

en: So king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem, and reigned: for Rehoboam was forty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Jehovah had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there: and his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Rehoboam chu Jerusalema chun ân sukdet a, ro a rêl tah a, ro a rêl ṭan tir chun Rehoboam chu kum sâwmli le kum khat a ni tah a, chun, Jerusalemah, Israel hnam po po laia inthawka a hming um zingna dinga LALPAIN a thlang suok khaw- puia chun kum sâwmpasari a rêl bawk a; a nu hming chu Ammon mi Naama a nih.

en: And he did that which was evil, because he set not his heart to seek Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chu zawng dinga a lungril a hmang naw leiin thil ṭha naw chu a thaw tah a.

en: Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the histories of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer, after the manner of genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
hmr: Chuongchun, Rehoboam thil- thawhai, a hmasa le nuhnunghai khawm, thla thu sui dân ang peiin zâwlnei Iddo le zâwlnei Semaia chanchinbuhaia chun ziek an ni naw am a nih? Chun, Rehoboam le Jero- boam inkâra hin indonahai a um zing zing bawk a.

en: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David: and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Rehoboam chu a thla- tuhai kuomah a in tah a, David khawpuia chun phûmin a um a; chun, a naupa Abija chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: In the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam began Abijah to reign over Judah.
hmr: Jeroboam inlal kum sâwm- parietnaa chun Abija chun Juda rama chun ro a rêl ṭan a.

en: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Micaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
hmr: Ama chun kum thum lai Jerusalemah ro a rêl a; a nu hming chu Mikaia, Gibea mi, Uriel naunu kha a nih. Chun, Jeroboam le Abija inkâra khawm chun indona a um a.

en: And Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: and Jeroboam set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, who were mighty men of valor.
hmr: Abija chun indonaa mi hrât ruol sipai pâwl thlang ṭhieu nuoi li lai chun indonaa chun a hang thaw a; Jeroboam khawm chun mi hrât khawkhêng thlang ṭhieu nuoi riet leh indonaa chun ama chu a hung ep ve bawk a.

en: And Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in the hill-country of Ephraim, and said, Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel:
hmr: Abija chu Ephraim tlâng rama Zemaraim tlâng chunga chun a ngîr a. “Aw Jeroboam le Israel mi po pohai, mi lo ngai ta u;

en: Ought ye not to know that Jehovah, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David for ever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
hmr: LALPA Israelhai Pathienin David le a thlahai kuomah Israel ram chu kumkhuoa dingin machi thuthlung hmangin a pêk a nih, ti in hriet naw am a ni?

en: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up, and rebelled against his lord.
hmr: David naupa Solomon siehlaw, Nebat naupa Jeroboam hi thoin, a pu chungah a lo hel el hi.

en: And there were gathered unto him worthless men, base fellows, that strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tender-hearted, and could not withstand them.
hmr: Chun, ama kuoma chun mi teplohai, mi hmangna bohai chu an inkhâwm a, Rehoboam chu a la nau- panga, lungril dâwng a ni lai khan, anni chu Solomon naupa Rehoboam kalin an insukhrât a, ama chun a lo dang zo ta naw kha a na.

en: And now ye think to withstand the kingdom of Jehovah in the hand of the sons of David; and ye are a great multitude, and there are with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made you for gods.
hmr: Chun, tuhin David naupasalhai kuta LALPA ram chu do thei dingin in inngaituoh a, mipui nasatak in na, in kuoma chun in pathienhai dinga Jeroboamin a siem rângkachak bâwngtehai chu an um bawk a.

en: Have ye not driven out the priests of Jehovah, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and made you priests after the manner of the peoples of other lands? so that whosoever cometh to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them that are no gods.
hmr: LALPA thiempuhai Aron nau- pasalhai le Levi mihai chu in hnawtsuokin, ram dang mihai dân angin thiempuhai in insiem fâwm a ni naw am a nih? chuleichun, mi tukhawm berâm pasari le bâwngchal tuoia ama inpumpêk dinga hung taphawt chu pathien ni lohai thiempuhai chu an ni thei pei a.

en: But as for us, Jehovah is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and we have priests ministering unto Jehovah, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites in their work:
hmr: Amiruokchu, keini chu LALPA chu kan Pathien a na, ama chu kan nghatsan nawh a; LALPA ta dinga rawngbâwltu thiempu kan neihai chu Aron naupasalhai an na, Levi chihaiin an ṭhangpui a;

en: and they burn unto Jehovah every morning and every evening burnt-offerings and sweet incense: the showbread also set they in order upon the pure table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamps thereof, to burn every evening: for we keep the charge of Jehovah our God; but ye have forsaken him.
hmr: riminhnik thilinhlânhai le pum- rawhmang thilinhlânhai chu zîng tin le zân tin LALPA kuoma chun an rawh a; entirna bei khawm chu dawkân inthieng chunga chun indawt thliein an sieh a; chun, rângkachak sathâu khâwnvar siena khawm, chutaka a khâwnvarhai zân tina sit ding leh; LALPA kan Pathien thupêk ang chu kan kawl zing a; amiruokchu, nangni chun in nghatsan a ni hi.

en: And, behold, God is with us at our head, and his priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against Jehovah, the God of your fathers; for ye shall not prosper.
hmr: Chun, en ta u, Pathien chu kan hma tieng keini lai a um a; in chunga inlâuna sukri dingin suklauna taw- tawrâwthai le thiempuhai chu an um bawk a; Aw Israel thlahai, in thla- tuhai Pathien LALPA chu do naw ro khai; in hlawtling naw ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: But Jeroboam caused an ambushment to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambushment was behind them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jeroboam chun an hnung tienga hung dingin lambun pâwl a siem a; chuongchun, Juda hmaa chun an um a, lambun pâwl chu an hnunga chun an um bawk a.

en: And when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind them; and they cried unto Jehovah, and the priests sounded with the trumpets.
hmr: Chun, Juda mihai chu an hei nghakîr chun, ngai ta, râl chu an hma le hnunga chun an um tah a; LALPA chu an ko a, thiempuhai chun taw- tawrâwthai chu an mût tah a.

en: Then the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
hmr: Chun, Juda mihai chu an khêk a; chuonga Juda mihai an khêk chun, Pathienin Israelhai po po le Jeroboam chu Abija le Juda mihai hmaa chun a hung suktlâwm tah a.

en: And the children of Israel fled before Judah; and God delivered them into their hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juda mihai hmaa inthawk chun Israel mihai chu an tlânseh a; chun, Pathienin an kuta chun anni chu a pêk tah a.

en: And Abijah and his people slew them with a great slaughter: so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
hmr: Abija le a mihai chun nasatakin anni chu an that tah a, chuongchun, thlang ṭhieu Israel mi nuoi nga chu thatin an tlu tah a.

en: Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu huna chun Israel thlahai chu sukhnuoiin an um tah a, Juda thlahai ruok chun an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu an ringsan leiin an hne tah a.

en: And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Beth-el with the towns thereof, and Jeshanah with the towns thereof, and Ephron with the towns thereof.
hmr: Abija chun Jeroboam chu a hnawt pei a, amaa inthawk chun khawpuihai a lâk a; Bethel le chutaka a khawperhai leh, Jesana le chutaka a khawperhai leh, Ephron le chutaka a khawperhai leh.

en: Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah: and Jehovah smote him, and he died.
hmr: Abija dam sûng chun Jeroboam chu a hrât suok nâwk ta ngai nawh a; LALPA chun a hrem a, ama chu a thi tah a.

en: But Abijah waxed mighty, and took unto himself fourteen wives, and begat twenty and two sons, and sixteen daughters.
hmr: Chun, Abija chun thil a hung thawthei deu deu a, nuhmei sâwm pali a nei a, naupasal sâwmhni pahni le naunuhmei sâwmparuk a nei a.

en: And the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways, and his sayings, are written in the commentary of the prophet Iddo.
hmr: Abija thilthaw danghai, a thaw- dânhai le a thuhrilhai chu zâwl- nei Iddo hrilfiena bua chun ziek an nih.

en: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
hmr: Chuongchun, Abija chu a thlatuhai kuoma chun a in tah a, ama chu David khawpuia chun an phûm a, a naupa Asa chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a; ama inlal sûng chun kum sâwm sûng chu ram chu râlmuongin a um a.

en: And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Jehovah his God:
hmr: Chun, Asa chun a Pathien, LALPA mithmuah thil indik le ṭhahai chu a thawh a;

en: for he took away the foreign altars, and the high places, and brake down the pillars, and hewed down the Asherim,
hmr: bâwlhmunhai le mâichâm dang- lamhai chu a lâk hmang a, lungphun- hai chu a sukthliek a, Asera chu a phûr thlûk bawk a;

en: and commanded Judah to seek Jehovah, the God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
hmr: chun, Juda mihai chu an thla- tuhai Pathien LALPA chu zawnga thupêk le dânhai chu thaw pei dingin thu a pêk bawk a.

en: Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the sun-images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
hmr: Juda ram sûng khawpui po pohaia inthawk chun bâwlhmunhai le nisa limhai chu a lâk hmang vawng a; ram chu ama hmaa chun a re ṭawk ṭawk a.

en: And he built fortified cities in Judah; for the land was quiet, and he had no war in those years, because Jehovah had given him rest.
hmr: Juda rama chun khawpui kul neihai chu a bâwl a, LALPAIN ama chu châwlna a pêk leiin, ram chu a re ṭawk ṭawk a, chuong kumahai chun indona a nei si nawh a.

en: For he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars; the land is yet before us, because we have sought Jehovah our God; we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, Juda mihai kuoma chun, “Hieng khawpuihai hi bâwl ei tiu a, a banghai, a kulbîng insânghai, a dai kawtkhârhai le a kalna thîrhai siem ei tiu; ei Pathien LALPA chu ei zawng leiin ram chu ei hnuoiah a um a nih; ama chu ei zawng leiin kil tinah ama chun châwl a mi pêk a ni hi,” a ta. Chuongchun, an bâwl a, hlaw khawm an hlawtling pei tah a.

en: And Asa had an army that bare bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.
hmr: Chun, Asa chun Juda hnama inthawkin âwmphâw le fei chawi mi sipai nuoi thum a nei a; Benjamin hnama inthawkin phaw chawia thal- ngul kuoi mi nuoi hni le sîng riet a nei bawk a: hieng mihai po po hi mi hrât khawkhêng ruok an nih.

en: And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an army of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and he came unto Mareshah.
hmr: Chun, Ethiopia mi Zera chun sipai maktaduoi khat le sakawr tawlailîr za thum leh anni chu a hung thawh a; ama chu Maresa chenin a hung a.

en: Then Asa went out to meet him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.
hmr: Chun, Asa chu ama tuok ding chun a suok a, Maresaa Zephatha ruoma chun indo ding chun an inep tah a.

en: And Asa cried unto Jehovah his God, and said, Jehovah, there is none besides thee to help, between the mighty and him that hath no strength: help us, O Jehovah our God; for we rely on thee, and in thy name are we come against this multitude. O Jehovah, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.
hmr: Asa chu a Pathien LALPA kuoma chun a khêk a, “LALPA chau naw chu, hrâtna nei lo mihai ta dinga, mi thilthawtheia inthawka ṭhangpui ding mi dang tukhawm an um nawh a; Aw LALPA kan Pathien, mi ṭhang- pui la; nangmaah kan innghat sih a, hi mipui hi i hming leiin kan hung do a ni hi. Aw LALPA nang chu kan Pathien i na, nangma chu tukhawma hne naw raw se che,” tiin.

en: So Jehovah smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Asa hmaa le Juda mihai hmaa chun Ethiopia mihai chu a hung thawh a; Ethiopia mihai chu an tlânse tah a.

en: And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before Jehovah, and before his host; and they carried away very much booty.
hmr: Asa le a kuoma mipui umhai chun anni chu Gerar chenin an hnawt a; Ethiopia mihai chu nasatakin an thi a, ṭhang an khaw thei ta nawh a; LALPA le a sipaihai hmaa chun sukbohmangin an um a; anni chun râllâk sum tamtak an lâk a.

en: And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of Jehovah came upon them: and they despoiled all the cities; for there was much spoil in them.
hmr: Chun, Gerar vêla khuohai po po chu a thaw vawng a, LALPA ṭitna chu an chunga chun a hung tlung tâwl sih a, khawpuihai po po chu an suksiet a, chuonga hai chun râllâk thil tam- takhai chu a um sih a.

en: They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep in abundance, and camels, and returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Ran ruol bûkhai chu an rûn pei a, berâm tamtakhai le sanghâwngsei leh an lâk ṭeu a, Jerusalemah an kîr tah a.

en: And the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Oded:
hmr: Chun, Oded naupa Azaria chunga chun Pathien thlarau a hung a;

en: and he went out to meet Asa, and said unto him, Hear ye me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin: Jehovah is with you, while ye are with him; and if ye seek him, he will be found of you; but if ye forsake him, he will forsake you.
hmr: Asa chu tuok dingin a va fe suok a, a kuoma chun, “Nangni Asa le Benjamin le Juda ram po pohai, mi lo ngai ta u; a kuoma in um sûng po chun LALPA chu in kuomah a um a; chun, ama chu in zawng chun in ihmuin um a ta; amiruokchu, ama chu in nghatsan chun nghatsan vêng a ti cheu.

en: Now for a long season Israel was without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law:
hmr: Chuongchun, hun sâwttak el chu Israel ram chu Pathien indiktak bo, inchûktirtu thiempu le dân boin an lo um tah a;

en: but when in their distress they turned unto Jehovah, the God of Israel, and sought him, he was found of them.
hmr: amiruokchu, an rimsiknaa chun Israel Pathien LALPA kuom tieng chun an kîr nâwk a, ama chu an zawng a, an hmu a ni kha.

en: And in those times there was no peace to him that went out, nor to him that came in; but great vexations were upon all the inhabitants of the lands.
hmr: Chuong lai hunahai chun mi hung lût ta ding le a suok ta ding khawm chun muongna hrim hrim a um nawh a, ram po pohai hluotuhai chunga chun lunginzîngna nasatak a um lem a.

en: And they were broken in pieces, nation against nation, and city against city; for God did vex them with all adversity.
hmr: A tum tumin an insukdar vawng a, hnam chungah hnam dang, khaw- pui chungah khawpui dang; inhmêl- mâkna tinrêngin Pathienin anni chu a suklungsen tâwl sih a.

en: But be ye strong, and let not your hands be slack; for your work shall be rewarded.
hmr: Amiruokchu, insukhrât unla; in- thlada naw ro, in sinthaw chu lâwmman pêk in ni ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: And when Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominations out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from the hill-country of Ephraim; and he renewed the altar of Jehovah, that was before the porch of Jehovah.
hmr: Asa chun hieng thu le, zâwlnei Oded thuhrilhai chu a hriet chun, ân sukhuoi a, Juda le Benjamin ram po poa le Ephraim tlâng rama khawpui a lâkhaia inthawka tirdakumnahai po po chu a sie hmang tah a; LALPA mâichâm LALPA tuolpûk hmaa um chu a siem thar bawk a.

en: And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and them that sojourned with them out of Ephraim and Manasseh, and out of Simeon: for they fell to him out of Israel in abundance, when they saw that Jehovah his God was with him.
hmr: Juda le Benjamin rama mi po po le, Ephraim le Manasse le Simeona inthawka chutaka hung inpêm lûthai chu a ko khâwm vawng a; LALPA a Pathien chu a kuomah a um ti an hmu chun Israel rama inthawkin mi tamtak chu ama kuoma chun an lo kai ta sih a.

en: So they gathered themselves together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu Asa rorêl kum sâwmpanga kum thla thumnaa chun Jerusalema chun an hung inkhâwm tâwl a.

en: And they sacrificed unto Jehovah in that day, of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.
hmr: Chu ni chun râllâk thila an hung lâk, bâwngchal za sari le berâm sâng sariin LALPA kuomah an inthâwi a.

en: And they entered into the covenant to seek Jehovah, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and with all their soul;
hmr: Chun, an lungvar po po le an lungril po po an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu zawng dingin thuthlung an siem a.

en: and that whosoever would not seek Jehovah, the God of Israel, should be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
hmr: chuongchun, mi tukhawm Israel Pathien LALPA zawng lo chu mi lien amanih, mi chîn amanih, pasal amanih nuhmei amani khawm ni sienla sukhlum ding a nih.

en: And they sware unto Jehovah with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.
hmr: Chun, rawsemhai, tawtawrâwt- hai le khêkriin, râwl inringtakin LALPA kuoma chun ṭawng an inkhâm a.

en: And all Judah rejoiced at the oath; for they had sworn with all their heart, and sought him with their whole desire; and he was found of them: and Jehovah gave them rest round about.
hmr: Juda mihai po po chu thutiem chun an hlim hle a, an lungril po poin an inkhâm a, an châkna po poa ama chu an zawng leiin, ama chu an ihmua chun a um hrim a; chuong- chun, a vêlin anni chu LALPA chun muongna a pêk tah a.

en: And also Maacah, the mother of Asa the king, he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and made dust of it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
hmr: Lal Asa chun a nu Maaka khawm chu Asera ta dingin lim tirdakum chu a siem leiin lalnu a ninaa inthawk chun a bân bawk a; chun, Asa chun a milim chu a phûr thlûk a, a suknâwi vawng a, Kidron vadungtêa chun a raw tah a.

en: But the high places were not taken away out of Israel: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel rama inthawk chun bâwlhmunhai chu lâk hmang a ni nawh a, amiruokchu, a dam sûng po po Asa lungril chu ngiltakin a um a.

en: And he brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.
hmr: A pain a lo inhlân tahai le amain ân hlân tahai, tangkaruo dâm, râng- kachak dâm, bûr le bêlhai leh Pathien ina chun a hung lâk a.

en: And there was no more war unto the five and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa.
hmr: Asa rorêl a kum sâwmthum pangana chen chun indona hrim hrim a um ta nawh a.

en: In the six and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any one to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
hmr: Asa rorêl a kum sâwmthum paruk kum chun, Israel ram lal Baasa chun Juda ram a hang rûn a, Juda ram lal Asa kuoma mi a hung amanih, a suok amanih a phal naw- na dingin Rama khuo chu a siem tah a.

en: Then Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of Jehovah and of the king’s house, and sent to Ben-hadad king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
hmr: Chun, Asa chun lal in le LALPA ina ro sie khâwmna ina rângkachak le tangkaruo chu a lâk suok a; Damaskaa um, Suria lal Benhadad kuoma chun ân phur a,

en: There is a league between me and thee, as there was between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent thee silver and gold; go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
hmr: “Kei le nanga kâra hin inthu- ruolna a um a, i pa le ka pa inkâra khawm a lo um tah ang khan; ngai ta, tangkaruo le rângkachak ka hung thawn che hi; fe la, Israel ram lal Baasa le in inkâra inthuruolna chu ṭhiek rawh, keimaa inthawka a fe hmang theina dingin,” a ta.

en: And Ben-hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel; and they smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel-maim, and all the store-cities of Naphtali.
hmr: Chun, Benhadad chun lal Asa thu chu a pawm a; Israel ram khaw- puihai chunga chun a sipaihai chu a tir tah a; chuongchun, Ijon le Dan le Abel-maim le Naphtali rama sie- khâwmna khawpuihai po po chu an rûn a.

en: And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building Ramah, and let his work cease.
hmr: Chun, Baasa chun chu chu a lo hriet chun Rama khuo a siem lai chu a châwlsan a, a sin chu a suktâwp tah a.

en: Then Asa the king took all Judah; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and he built therewith Geba and Mizpah.
hmr: Chun, Juda lal Asa chun Juda rama mi po po chu a ṭhuoi a; Ramaa lunghai le chutaka thinghai Baasain in bâwlna dinga a hmanghai chu an phur hmang vawng a; chu chun Geba le Mizpa khuo a siem a.

en: And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said unto him, Because thou hast relied on the king of Syria, and hast not relied on Jehovah thy God, therefore is the host of the king of Syria escaped out of thy hand.
hmr: Chu hun lai chun zâwlnei Hanani chu Juda ram lal Asa kuoma chun a hung a, a kuomah, “LALPA i Pathien chu ring loin Suria lal chu i ring a, chuleiin, Suria lal sipaihai chu i kuta chun an suokthleng ding a nih.

en: Were not the Ethiopians and the Lubim a huge host, with chariots and horsemen exceeding many? yet, because thou didst rely on Jehovah, he delivered them into thy hand.
hmr: Lubim mihai le Ethiopia mihai chu sakawr tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai leh tam nasatak an ni naw am a nih? amiruokchu, LALPAA chun în nghat leiin i kut- ah anni chu a pêk suok che an ni kha.

en: For the eyes of Jehovah run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to show himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein thou hast done foolishly; for from henceforth thou shalt have wars.
hmr: Ama tienga lungril ṭha famkim puttuhai chunga a hrâtzie insuklang dingin LALPA mit chun hnuoi chung po poa kil le kap a en vêl ruoi hlak. Hitaka hin nang chun invêtthlâktak el chun i lo thaw tah a, chuleiin, tuta chin chu indonahai khawm nei zing tâng i tih,” a ta.

en: Then Asa was wroth with the seer, and put him in the prison-house; for he was in a rage with him because of this thing. And Asa oppressed some of the people at the same time.
hmr: Chun, Asa chu zâwlnei chunga chun a lunginsen a, lung ina chun ama chu a khum tah a; hi thil lei hin ama chunga chun a lunginsen sih a. Chun, Asa chun chuong lai chun mi ṭhenkhathai chu a lo nêksawr hle bawk a.

en: And, behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
hmr: Asa thilthawhai, a hmasa le a nuhnunghai khawm, en ta, Juda le Israel ram lalhai lekhabua chun ziek a ni naw am a nih?

en: And in the thirty and ninth year of his reign Asa was diseased in his feet; his disease was exceeding great: yet in his disease he sought not to Jehovah, but to the physicians.
hmr: A rorêl a kum sâwmthum pakuo kuma chun Asa chu a ke a hung na tah a; a natna chu a nasa hle el a, a natnaa khawm chun LALPA chu a la zawng naw rawp a, damdawi thiem mihai a ruoi lem a.

en: And Asa slept with his fathers, and died in the one and fortieth year of his reign.
hmr: Chuongchun, Asa chu a thlatu hai kuoma chun a in tah a, a rorêl kum sâwmli pakhat kuma chun a thi tah a.

en: And they buried him in his own sepulchres, which he had hewn out for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odors and divers kinds of spices prepared by the perfumers’ art: and they made a very great burning for him.
hmr: Ama thlân in David khuoa a siem ngeia chun an phûm tah a; chun, riminhnik le chawkpawl thiem mi- haiin an buotsai riminhnik tinrênga sip khuma chun an inzâltir a; ama ta ding chun meichawk nasatak chu an siem tah a.

en: And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead, and strengthened himself against Israel.
hmr: A naupa Jehosaphat chun ama aia chun ro a hung rêl a, Israel chunga chun do dingin ân sukdet hle tah a.

en: And he placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
hmr: Juda rama khawpui kul neihai taphawta chun sipaihai a sieh a, Juda rama le Ephraim rama khawpui a pa Asain a lo lâk tahaia khan sipai pâwl lienhai chu a sie bawk a.

en: And Jehovah was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and sought not unto the Baalim,
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu Jehosaphat kuoma chun a um a, a thlatu David lampui hmasahai chu a hraw lei le Baal chu zawng loa,

en: but sought to the God of his father, and walked in his commandments, and not after the doings of Israel.
hmr: a thlatuhai Pathien chu zawnga, a thupêkhai chu Israel mihai thaw ang ni loa, a zâwm leiin.

en: Therefore Jehovah established the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat tribute; and he had riches and honor in abundance.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chun a kuta chun ram chu a tungding a; Juda ram po po chun Jehosaphat kuoma chun thilpêkhai an hung chawi a; chuongchun, hausaknahai le inzâkaina chu nasatakin a nei tah a.

en: And his heart was lifted up in the ways of Jehovah: and furthermore he took away the high places and the Asherim out of Judah.
hmr: Chun, LALPA kawngahai chun a lungril chu a thle a; chu nawa khawm Juda rama Asera le bâwlhmunhai po po chu a lâk hmang a.

en: Also in the third year of his reign he sent his princes, even Ben-hail, and Obadiah, and Zechariah, and Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;
hmr: Chun, ân lal a kum thum kuma chun a hotuhai Benhail, Obadia, Zekaria, Nethanel le Mikaia chu Juda ram khawpuihaia inchûktir dingin a tir tâwl a;

en: and with them the Levites, even Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tob-adonijah, the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests.
hmr: anni lai chun Levi mi Semaia, Nethania, Zebadia, Asahel, Semira- moth, Jehonathan, Adonija, Tobija, Tob-adonija le Levi mihai chu an ṭhang a; anni laia chun thiempu Elisama le Jehoram chu an ṭhang ve bawk a.

en: And they taught in Judah, having the book of the law of Jehovah with them; and they went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught among the people.
hmr: LALPA dân lekhabu chu chawiin, Juda rama chun an inchûktir tah a; chuongchun, Juda ram khawpuiahai po po chun an fe lâwn a, mipuihai chu an inchûktir tah a.

en: And the fear of Jehovah fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
hmr: Chun, Judai ram vêla ramhaia lalram po poahai chun LALPA ṭina chu a um tah a; chuongchun, Jeho- saphat chu an do ngam nawh a.

en: And some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and silver for tribute; the Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred he-goats.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mi ṭhenkhathai chu Jehosaphat kuoma chun thil- pêkhai le, siechawi dingin tangkaruo an hung pêk a; chun, Arabia mihai khawma ran ruol, berâmchal sâng sari le za sari le, kêlchal sâng sari le za sari an hung kei a.

en: And Jehoshaphat waxed great exceedingly; and he built in Judah castles and cities of store.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehosaphat chu nasatakin a hung lien tah a; Juda rama chun kulhai le siekhâwmna khawpuihai a siem tah a.

en: And he had many works in the cities of Judah; and men of war, mighty men of valor, in Jerusalem.
hmr: Juda rama khuohaia chun sin tamtak el a nei a, chun, Jerusalema chun indo mi, mi hrât khawkhênghai a nei bawk a.

en: And this was the numbering of them according to their fathers’ houses: Of Judah, the captains of thousands: Adnah the captain, and with him mighty men of valor three hundred thousand;
hmr: Chun, hi hi an pahnam ang peia intiemna chu a nih: Juda hnama chun sâng chunga hotuhai chu: hotu Adna, ama hnuoia chun mi hrât ṭhieu nuoi thum an um a;

en: and next to him Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred and fourscore thousand;
hmr: ama dawta chun hotu Jeho- hanan, ama hnuoia chun nuoi hni le sîng riet an um a;

en: and next to him Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself unto Jehovah; and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valor.
hmr: ama dawta chun Zikri naupa Amasia, LALPA kuoma inphaltaka inpetu chu; ama hnuoia chun mi hrât khawkhêng nuoi hni an um bawk a;

en: And of Benjamin: Eliada a mighty man of valor, and with him two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;
hmr: Benjamin hnama mi chu: mi hrât khawkhêng Eliada, ama hnuoia chun mi phâw le thalngula inthuom nuoi hni an um a;

en: and next to him Jehozabad, and with him a hundred and fourscore thousand ready prepared for war.
hmr: chun, ama dawta chun Jeho- zabad a na, ama hnuoia chun indo dinga inpeisa mi nuoi khat le sîng riet an um bawk a.

en: These were they that waited on the king, besides those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.
hmr: Juda ram po poa khawpui kul neihai lalin a siehai ti loa chun hienghai hi lal vêngtuhai chu an nih.

en: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance; and he joined affinity with Ahab.
hmr: Jehosaphat chun hausaknahai le inzâkaina chu nasatakin a nei a, chun, Ahab le chun inpum- khatna chu a siem tah a.

en: And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. And Ahab killed sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the people that were with him, and moved him to go up with him to Ramoth-gilead.
hmr: Kum ieng zât amani hnunga chun Ahab kuomah Samaria chun a zu fe thla a. Chun, Ahab chun ama le ama hung zuituhai ta dingin bâwng- chalhai le berâmhai tamtak a thatpêk a; chuongchun, ama le Ramoth- gileada hang fe dingin a fiel tah a.

en: And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth-gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people; and we will be with thee in the war.
hmr: Israel ram lal Ahab chun Juda ram lal Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “Ramoth-gileadah ei hang fe ding?” a ta. Ama chun, “Kei le nang ka mihai le i mihai pumkhat ei na; indonaa chun, nangni leh ṭhang hmunkhat kan tih,” a ta.

en: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Inquire first, I pray thee, for the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Jehosaphat chun Israel ram lal kuoma chun, “Vawisûn hin LALPA thu chu indawn raw khai, ka hni che hi,” a ta.

en: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And they said, Go up; for God will deliver it into the hand of the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel ram lal chun zâwlnei za li lai chu a ko khâwm a, an kuomah, “Ramoth-gileada chun indo dingin kan hang fe ding am, an- nawleh ka tosan el ding?” a ta. Anni chun, “Hang fe ro, Pathien chun lal kutah a pêk suok ding a ni sih a,” an ta.

en: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of Jehovah besides, that we may inquire of him?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jehosaphat chun, “Hienghai naw hi ei râwn thei ding LALPA zâwlnei dang hrim an um naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Jehovah: but I hate him; for he never prophesieth good concerning me, but always evil: the same is Micaiah the son of Imla. And Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
hmr: Israel lal chun Jehosaphat kûoma chun, “Mi pakhat LALPA thu ei indawn theina ding chu a la um a, amiruokchu, ama chu ka theidaa, ka chungthua hin thu a hril ṭha ngai hrim hrim nawh a, thil ṭha naw chau naw chu; chu mi chu Imla naupa Mikaia a nih,” a ta. Jehosaphat chun, “Lal chun chuong chun ti naw phawt raw se,” a ta.

en: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Fetch quickly Micaiah the son of Imla.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun hotu pakhat a ko a, “Imla naupa Mikaia chu inhmâwtakin hung ṭhuoi rawh,” a ta.

en: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, and they were sitting in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
hmr: Chun, Israel ram lal le Juda ram lal Jehosaphat chu, an lal puona inthuomin an lal ṭhungpha ve vea chun an ṭhung a; Samaria lûtna dai kawtkhâr bula tuollaia chun an ṭhung a, chuongchun, zâwlneihai po po chun an hmaa chun thu an hril ruol duol duol a.

en: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron and said, Thus saith Jehovah, With these shalt thou push the Syrians, until they be consumed.
hmr: Chun, Kenaan naupa Zedekia chun thîrin saki ân siem fâwm a, “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Suk- bohmang an ni vawng hmakhat chu hienghai le hin Suria mihai chu i sik ding a nih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramoth-gilead, and prosper; for Jehovah will deliver it into the hand of the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, zâwlneihai po po chun, chuong ang seng chun an hril tah a, “Ramoth-gileada chun hang fe la, hang hlawtling rawh, LALPA chun lal kuta chun a pêk suok ngei ding a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth: let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.
hmr: Chun, thangko Mikaia ko ding- a fe khan a kuomah thu a hril a, “Ngai ta, thu bau khat angin zâwl- neihai thu chun lal ta dinga ṭha chu an hril seng a; chuleiin, ka hni che hi, nanga thu khawm chu anni hril ang bawk chu ni sienla, thu ṭha hril rawh,” tiin.

en: And Micaiah said, As Jehovah liveth, what my God saith, that will I speak.
hmr: Mikaia chun, “LALPA chu a hring zing a, ka Pathienin a hril chu, chu chu ngei chu hril ka tih,” a ta.

en: And when he was come to the king, the king said unto him, Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper; and they shall be delivered into your hand.
hmr: Chun, lal kuom a hung tlung chun lal chun a kuomah, “Mikaia, Ramoth-gileada chun indo dingin kan hang fe ding am, annawleh ka tosan el ding?” a ta. Ama chun, “Hang fe la, hang hlawtling rawh, i kutah pêk suok an ni ding a nih,” a ta.

en: And the king said to him, How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak unto me nothing but the truth in the name of Jehovah?
hmr: Chun, lal chun a kuoma, “LALPA hmingin thudik chau naw chu iengkhawm ka kâwlah i hril ngai nawh ti hi vawi iengzât rau am ka sukdetpui ding che a na?” a ta.

en: And he said, I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and Jehovah said, These have no master; let them return every man to his house in peace.
hmr: Ama chun, “Israel mihai po po chu, berâm a vêngtu boa, an invâk hmang angin tlângahai chun indarin ka hmuh a; chun, LALPA chun, ‘Hienghai hin vêngtu an nei nawh a, mi tin chu mâni in sengah thla- muongtakin inkîrtir seng ro,’ a tih,” tiin.

en: And the king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?
hmr: Chun, Israel ram lal chun Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “Keima chungthua chun a se tieng chau naw chu a ṭha tieng chun thu hril naw ni ti ka hril hrim che a ni naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: And Micaiah said, Therefore hear ye the word of Jehovah: I saw Jehovah sitting upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun a hril a, “Chuleichun, LALPA thu chu ngai rawh. LALPA chu a lalṭhungphaa chun ṭhung a, vân sipaihai po po chu a changtieng le a vawitienga ngîr ka hmu a nih.

en: And Jehovah said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead? And one spake saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, ‘Israel ram lal Ahab chu Ramoth-gileada chun a hang fe a, chutaka chun a hang thi theina dingin tuin am thlêm a ta?’ a ta. Chun, mi pakhat chun chuong ang chun a hril a, mi dang khawmin chuong ang bawk chun an hung hril pei a.

en: And there came forth a spirit, and stood before Jehovah, and said, I will entice him. And Jehovah said unto him, Wherewith?
hmr: Chun, thlarau pakhat chu a hung suok a, LALPA hmaa chun a ngîr a, ‘Keiin hang thlêm ka tih,’ a ta. Chun, LALPA chun, ‘Iengtinam ie?’ a ta.

en: And he said, I will go forth, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And he said, Thou shalt entice him, and shalt prevail also: go forth, and do so.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘Hang fêng ka ta, a zâwlnei po pohai baua chun thlarau inkhêl hang nîng ka tih,’ a ta. Chun, ama chun, ‘Ama chu thlêm ngei i ta, hlaw khawm hang hlawtling ngei i tih; fe suok la, chuong ang tak chun hang thaw rawh,’ a ta.

en: Now therefore, behold, Jehovah hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of these thy prophets; and Jehovah hath spoken evil concerning thee.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin ngai ta, hieng i zâwlneihai baua hin khêl hrilna thla- rau a sie tah a; chuleichun, LALPA chun i chungthua chun thil ṭha naw chu a hril tah a nih,” tiin.

en: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah upon the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of Jehovah from me to speak unto thee?
hmr: Chun, Kenaan naupa Zedekia chu a hung hnai a, “Keimaa inthawk- in i kuoma thu hril dingin LALPA thlarau chu khaw tieng am a fe leh?” tiin, Mikaia chu a bienga chun a ben tah a.

en: And Micaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see on that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun, “Ngai ta, pindan sûngrila inbihmang dinga i fe pha, chu ni ngei chun la hrieng i tih,” a ta.

en: And the king of Israel said, Take ye Micaiah, and carry him back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son;
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun, “Mikaia hi man unla, khawpui enkawltu Amon kuoma chun ṭhuoi nâwk ro; lal naupa Joas kuoma le chun;

en: and say, Thus saith the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
hmr: chun, ‘Hi mipa hi lunginah sie unla, thlamuongtaka ka hung nâwk hmakhat chun rimsikna tui le rim- sikna beiin ama hi châwm ro,’ lalin a tih, ti ro,” a ta.

en: And Micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, Jehovah hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hear, ye peoples, all of you.
hmr: Chun, Mikaia chun, “Thla- muongtaka i hung nâwk hrim hrim chun, LALPAIN kei mi hmangin thu a hril naw nîng a tih,” a ta. Chun, “Mipuihai, nangni po poin lo hre ta u,” a ta.

en: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel ram lal le Juda ram lal Jehosaphat chu Ramoth- gileada chun an hang fe tah a.

en: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but put thou on thy robes. So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went into the battle.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal chun Jehosa- phat kuoma chun, “Insukdanglam ka ta, indonaah hang fêng ka tih; amiruokchu, nang chu i lal puon sil zing la,” a ta. Chuongchun, Israel lal chu ân sukdanglam a, indonaa chun an hang fe tah a.

en: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Suria lal chun sakawr tawlailîrhai hotuhai kuoma chun, “Israel lal ngat naw chu mi lien amanih, mi chîn amani khawm chu va do naw ro,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of Israel. Therefore they turned about to fight against him: but Jehoshaphat cried out, and Jehovah helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.
hmr: Chun, sakawr tawlailîr hotuhai chun Jehosaphat chu an hmu chun, “Israel lal a nih a,” an ta. Chuleiin, ama chu do dingin an inhuol tah a; amiruokchu, Jehosaphat chu a khêk a, LALPA chun ama chu a ṭhangpui tah a; chuongchun, amaa inthawka inkieng dingin Pathien chun a hung thaw tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.
hmr: Chun, sakawr tawlailîr hotuhai chun Israel lal a ni nawh ti an hmu chun, ama an hnawt lai chu an kîrsan tah a.

en: And a certain man drew his bow at a venture, and smote the king of Israel between the joints of the armor: wherefore he said to the driver of the chariot, Turn thy hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am sore wounded.
hmr: Chun, mi tuin amanih tum bîk nei loin a thalngul chu a kuoi a, Israel lal chu a râlthuom inzawmna kâr taka chun a kâp tah a; chuleichun, a tawlailîr khaltu kuoma chun, “Kei her la, sipaihai laia inthawk hi mi fe suokpui raw khai, ka hliem nasa êm el,” a ta.

en: And the battle increased that day: howbeit the king of Israel stayed himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the even; and about the time of the going down of the sun he died.
hmr: Chu ni chun indona chu a zuol pei a, ngai ta, Israel lal chu Suriahai chu doin a tawlailîra chun zântieng chenin a ṭhang zing a; chun, ama chu nisa tlâk hun lai taka hin a thi tah a.

en: And Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.
hmr: Juda ram lal Jehosaphat chu thlamuongtakin Jerusalema a ina chun a kîr tah a.

en: And Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him, and said to king Jehoshaphat, Shouldest thou help the wicked, and love them that hate Jehovah? for this thing wrath is upon thee from before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Hanani naupa zâwlnei Jehu chu ama tuok dingin a lo va fe suok a, lal Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “Mi rilo chu ṭhangpuiin, LALPA theidatu chu i hmangai ding a ni maw? Hi thil lei hin LALPA lungsen- na chu i chungah a um a nih.

en: Nevertheless there are good things found in thee, in that thou hast put away the Asheroth out of the land, and hast set thy heart to seek God.
hmr: Amiruokchu, nangmaa hin thil ṭha hmusuok a ni ve bawk a, hi rama inthawka Asera chu sie hmang a, Pathien chu zawng dinga i lungril chu i siem ta leiin,” a ta.

en: And Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem: and he went out again among the people from Beer-sheba to the hill-country of Ephraim, and brought them back unto Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema chun Jehosa- phat chu a um a; Beer-sebaa inthawk- a Ephraim tlâng ram chenin mi- puihai laia chun a fe suok a; an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA kuom tienga chun anni chu a hung ṭhuoi kîr nâwk tâwl a.

en: And he set judges in the land throughout all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city,
hmr: Chun, Juda khawpui kul neihai po poa khaw tinah, ram sûnga chun rorêltuhai a sie tâwl a,

en: and said to the judges, Consider what ye do: for ye judge not for man, but for Jehovah; and he is with you in the judgment.
hmr: rorêltuhai kuoma chun, “In thaw chu ngaituo hlak unla, mihriem ta dinga ro rêl in ni nawh a, LALPA ta ding lem a nih; chun, ama chu in rorêlnaah in kuomah a um a nih.

en: Now therefore let the fear of Jehovah be upon you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with Jehovah our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of bribes.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, LALPA ṭina chu in chungah um sienla, chu chu pawisa hle unla, thaw khawm thaw bawk ro; ei Pathien LALPAA chun khawhlona hrim a um nawh a; mi inza bîkna khawm a um nawh a, thamna lâkna khawm a um bawk nawh,” a ta.

en: Moreover in Jerusalem did Jehoshaphat set of the Levites and the priests, and of the heads of the fathers’ houses of Israel, for the judgment of Jehovah, and for controversies. And they returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chunawa khawm chun Jehosa- phat chun Jerusalema chun Levi mihai le thiempuhai le, Israel pa- hnam ṭhuoituhai chu thubuoiahai le LALPA ta dinga rorêl dingin a sie bawk a. Chun, Jerusalema chun an kîr tah a.

en: And he charged them, saying, Thus shall ye do in the fear of Jehovah, faithfully, and with a perfect heart.
hmr: Chun, anni ân fui a, “LALPA ṭi pumin, ringumtakin, lungril ṭha fam- kimin in thaw ding a nih.

en: And whensoever any controversy shall come to you from your brethren that dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, ye shall warn them, that they be not guilty towards Jehovah, and so wrath come upon you and upon your brethren: this do, and ye shall not be guilty.
hmr: Chun, in unau an khawpuihaia chênghaia inthawka thisen le thisen inkâra manih, dân le thupêkhai in- kâra manih, thuruot le rorêlhai inkâra maniha thubuoihaiin in kuomah an hung inkhing chun, LALPA chungah an suksuol a, nangni le in unauhai chunga lunginsenna chu a hung tlung nawna dingin anni chu in kâwk ding a nih: hi hi thaw hlak unla, suksuol naw ti niu.

en: And, behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of Jehovah; and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, in all the king’s matters: also the Levites shall be officers before you. Deal courageously, and Jehovah be with the good.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta u, thiempu lal tak Amaria chu LALPA thu chungchâng po poa chun nangni hotu a na; Juda sûngkaw chunga rorêltu Ismael naupa Zebadia chu lal thu chung- chânga po po chun a ni bawk a; Levi mihai khawm chu in hmaa chun hotuhai ni bawk an tih. Huoitakin thaw unla, mi ṭha kuoma chun LALPA chu um ngei a tih,” tiin.

en: Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the name of Jehovah, and a house for his kingdom.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun LALPA hmingin in le, ama lalram ta dingin in bâwl a lo tum tah a.

en: And Solomon counted out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand men that were hewers in the mountains, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun phurrik phur mi sîng sari le thing sak mi sîng riet le, anni chu enkawltu dingin mi sâng thum le za ruk chu a ruot tah a.

en: And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him a house to dwell therein, even so deal with me.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Tura lal Huram kuoma chun mi a tir a, “Ka pa David kha i lo ngaisak a, a umna dinga in bâwlna dingin sidar thinghai i lo thawn ang bawk khan, kei khawm mi hung thawn ve rawh.

en: Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of Jehovah my God, to dedicate it to him, and to burn before him incense of sweet spices, and for the continual showbread, and for the burnt-offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the set feasts of Jehovah our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel.
hmr: Ngai ta, LALPA ka Pathien hmingin ama kuoma inhlân ding le, riminhnikhai a hmaa râwna ding le, entirna bei sie zingna ding le, zîng le zâna le, châwlnia le, thla tharhaia le, LALPA kan Pathien ruoiṭhe hun- bihaia pumrawhmang thilinhlânna dingin in ka bâwl a. Hi hi Israel kuoma kumkhaw thuthlung a ni hrim a.

en: And the house which I build is great; for great is our God above all gods.
hmr: Chu in ka bâwl chu a ropui hle a, kan Pathien chu pathien danghai po po nêkin a ropui lem hrim a.

en: But who is able to build him a house, seeing heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who am I then, that I should build him a house, save only to burn incense before him?
hmr: Amiruokchu, vân le vânhai vân khawm chun ama chu a dâwl nawh ti hmuin tuin am ama ta ding chun in bâwl thei a ta? Ama hmaa riminhnik rawna ding ti chau naw chu, ama ta dingin in ka hang bâwlpêk chu, a tu ang am ka ni hrim a?

en: Now therefore send me a man skilful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that knoweth how to grave all manner of gravings, to be with the skilful men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin rângkachak sina themthiem mi, tangkaruo le, dârsen le thîra thiem, a senêm le a senduk le, a dumpâwla thiem, ker dân kawng chi tinrênga thiem, ka pa Davidin a lo ruoi tah, Jerusalem le Juda rama mi thiemhai le thaw ding hin mi them- thiem mi hungtir pêk rawh.

en: Send me also cedar-trees, fir-trees, and algum-trees, out of Lebanon; for I know that thy servants know how to cut timber in Lebanon. And, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,
hmr: Sidar thinghai, fâr thinghai, al- gum thinghai Lebanona inthawk khan mi hung inphur bawk la; i mihai chu Lebanona thingphûr an thiem ti ka hriet si a; chun, ngai ta, i sie- hlawhai chu ka siehlawhai leh um an ta;

en: even to prepare me timber in abundance; for the house which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.
hmr: thing tamtak el mi buotsaipêk dingin, hi in ka bâwl ding hi nasataka ropui a ni ding a ni sih a.

en: And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
hmr: Chun, i mi thing âttuhai kuoma chun bupui tekhâwng sîng hni le, buṭei tekhâwng sîng hni le, hriek bath sîng hni le uoin bath sîng hni pêng ka tih,” tiin.

en: Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because Jehovah loveth his people, he hath made thee king over them.
hmr: Tura lal Huram chun ziekin a dawn a, chu chu Solomon kuomah a thawn a, “LALPA chun a mihai a lunginsiet leiin an chunga lalah a siem che a nih,” tiin.

en: Huram said moreover, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the king a wise son, endued with discretion and understanding, that should build a house for Jehovah, and a house for his kingdom.
hmr: Huram bawk chun, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien, hnuoi le vân siem- tu lal David kuoma naupasal vartak hrietthiemna le thlierthiemna nei mi, LALPA ta ding le a lal ram ta dinga in bâwltu ding petu chu inpâkin um raw se.

en: And now I have sent a skilful man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father’s,
hmr: Chun, tuhin hi mi themthiem, hrietthiemna nei mi, a hming Huramabi ka hung tir,

en: the son of a woman of the daughters of Dan; and his father was a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson, also to grave any manner of graving, and to devise any device; that there may be a place appointed unto him with thy skilful men, and with the skilful men of my lord David thy father.
hmr: ama chu Dan naunuhmeihai thlaa mi a na, ama pa chu Tura mi hrim, rângkachak sina le tangkaruoa le, dârsena le thîra le lunga le, thinga le, a senêma le, a dumpâwla le, puon zai inhmia le a senduka thiem a na, ker dân chi tinrênga ker ding le, thaw dân kawng ruot ang thaw ding mi thiem a na; i themthiemhai le ka pu David i pa, mi thiemhai leh ama chun sin thâwng a ta.

en: Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants:
hmr: Tuhin bupui le buṭei le hriek le, uoin ka puin a hril ta kha, a siehlawhai kuoma hin hung thawn sienla,

en: and we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need; and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem.
hmr: pawimaw ding ang zât zât chu Lebanona inthawkin thing chu hung sât kan ta, tuipuiah Joppa chen hung tawl kan ta, chutaka inthawk chun Jerusalemah nangin lâng i ta,” tiin.

en: And Solomon numbered all the sojourners that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found a hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Israel rama mikhuol um po pohai chu a tiem a, a pa Davidin a tiem hnunghai kha, chuongchun, nuoi khat sîng nga sâng thum le za ruk an tling a.

en: And he set threescore and ten thousand of them to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand that were hewers in the mountains, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people at work.
hmr: Chun, anni laia sîng sari chu thil phur mi dingin a ruot a; chun, sîng riet chu tlânga thing sak mi dingin; chun, sâng thum le za ruk chu mipuihai sin inthawtirtu dingin.

en: And it came to pass after this, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them some of the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
hmr: Hi hnunga Moab thlahai le Ammon thlahai chu, Meunim mi ṭhenkhathai le chun Jehosaphat chu do dingin an hung thaw tah a.

en: Then there came some that told Jehoshaphat, saying, There cometh a great multitude against thee from beyond the sea from Syria; and, behold, they are in Hazazon-tamar (the same is En-gedi).
hmr: Chun, mi tuhai amanih an hung a, Jehosaphat kuoma chun, “Suria rama tuipui râla inthawkin mipui nasatak nangma rûn ding chein an hung a, ngai ta, Hazazon-tamarah an um,” tiin an hril a, (chu chu Engedi leh angkhat a nih).

en: And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek unto Jehovah; and he proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehosaphat chu a ṭi tah a; LALPA chu a zawng a, Juda ram po poa bunghei a rawt tah a.

en: And Judah gathered themselves together, to seek help of Jehovah: even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Juda mihai chu LALPA ṭhangpuina zawng dingin an in- khâwm a; Juda ram khawpui po poa inthawkin LALPA chu zawng dingin an hung tâwl a.

en: And Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of Jehovah, before the new court;
hmr: Jehosaphat chu LALPA inah, tuollai thar hmaa Juda le Jerusalem mipui pungkhâwmhai laia chun a ngîr a;

en: and he said, O Jehovah, the God of our fathers, art not thou God in heaven? and art not thou ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations? and in thy hand is power and might, so that none is able to withstand thee.
hmr: A hril a, “Aw LALPA, kan thlatu- hai Pathien, nang chu vân Pathien i ni naw am a nih? Hnamhai lalram po pohai chunga rorêltu chu nang i ni naw am a nih? I kuta chun hrâtna le thilthawtheina a um a, chuleiin, tukhawma dang thei naw ni hai che.

en: Didst not thou, O our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel, and give it to the seed of Abraham thy friend for ever?
hmr: Aw kan Pathien, i mi Israelhai hmaah hi ram hluotuhai hi i hnawt suokin, i ruolpa Abraham thlahai kuomah kumkhuoa dingin i pêk a ni naw am a nih?

en: And they dwelt therein, and have built thee a sanctuary therein for thy name, saying,
hmr: Chuongchun, chutaka chun an um a, i ta dingin i hmingin hmun inthieng chutaka chun an bâwlpêk che a,

en: If evil come upon us, the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we will stand before this house, and before thee (for thy name is in this house), and cry unto thee in our affliction, and thou wilt hear and save.
hmr: ‘Thil ṭha naw dâm, kâwlhnâm dâm, rorêlna dâm, hri amanih, ṭâm amanih kan chungah a hung tlung chun nangma hmaa le hi in hmaa hin ngîr kan ta, (i hming chu hi ina hin a um sih a,) kan rimsiknaa chun nang hung ko kan ti cheh a, nang chun mi lo sandam i tih,’ tiin.

en: And now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and mount Seir, whom thou wouldest not let Israel invade, when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned aside from them, and destroyed them not;
hmr: Tuhin, ngai ta, Ammon le Moab thlahai le Seir tlâng Aigupta rama inthawka an hung suok laia nangin Israel mihai inrûntir lo le, insuk- siettir lo a i în umtirhai khan,

en: behold, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession, which thou hast given us to inherit.
hmr: ngai ta, nangin hluo dinga i mi pêk, i chana inthawka hunga mi hnawt suok dinga an mi hung thaw- zie hi lo hre la.

en: O our God, wilt thou not judge them? for we have no might against this great company that cometh against us; neither know we what to do: but our eyes are upon thee.
hmr: Aw kan Pathien, nangin an chungah ro i rêl ding a ni naw am a nih? Hieng keini mi hung thaw tum pâwl nasatak el chunga hin hrâtna kan nei si nawh a; ieng am thaw ding a na ti khawm kan hriet bawk nawh; nangma tieng kan hung ngha a nih,” tiin.
