en: And all Judah stood before Jehovah, with their little ones, their wives, and their children.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juda mihai po po chu LALPA hmaa chun an nauhai leh an nuhmeihai le an nautêhai rawi le chun an ngîr a.

en: Then upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite, of the sons of Asaph, came the Spirit of Jehovah in the midst of the assembly;
hmr: Chun, Asaph naupasalhai Levi mi, Mattania naupa, Jeiel naupa, Benaia naupa, Zekaria naupa, Jaha- ziel chunga chun mipui inkhâwmhai laia chun LALPA thlarau a hung tlung a;

en: and he said, Hearken ye, all Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, and thou king Jehoshaphat: Thus saith Jehovah unto you, Fear not ye, neither be dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
hmr: ama chun a hril a, “Nangni Juda mi po pohai, Jerusalem hluotu po pohai le nang lal Jehosaphat, lo ngai ta u, LALPA chun hieng ang hin in kuomah a ti a nih, ‘Hi mipui tamtak lei hin beidawng naw unla, ṭit khawm ṭi bawk naw ro; indona chu in ta a ni nawh a, Pathien ta a ni lem sih a.

en: To-morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the ascent of Ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the valley, before the wilderness of Jeruel.
hmr: Zînga hin anni chu zuk thaw unla, ngai ta u, Ziz lam tunga khan an hung a nih; Jeruel thlalêr tlung hmaa phairuom tâwpa khan anni chu hmûng in tih.

en: Ye shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of Jehovah with you, O Judah and Jerusalem; fear not, nor be dismayed: to-morrow go out against them; for Jehovah is with you.
hmr: Hi indonaa hin in do ngai kher naw nih, intlar phawt unla, ngîr ṭawk ṭawk ro; LALPA sandamna chu en zing el ro; aw Juda mihai le Jerusalem mihai, ṭi naw unla, beidawng bawk naw ro; zingah anni chu hang thaw unla, LALPA chu in kuomah a um sih a,’” tiin.

en: And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground; and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before Jehovah, worshipping Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat chu a hmaia hnuoi sikin a lu a kûn a, chun, Juda mi po po le Jerusalema chêngtuhai chu LALPA hmaa chun an bawkkhup a, LALPA chibai an bûk a.

en: And the Levites, of the children of the Kohathites and of the children of the Korahites, stood up to praise Jehovah, the God of Israel, with an exceeding loud voice.
hmr: Chun, Kohath thlahai le Kora thla Levi mihai chu râwl nasataka inringa Israel Pathien LALPA chu inpâk dingin an ngir tah a.

en: And they rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, O Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem: believe in Jehovah your God, so shall ye be established; believe his prophets, so shall ye prosper.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr inhmatakin an tho a, Tekoa thlalêra chun an hang feh a, chun, chuonga an fe suok lai chun Jehosaphat chu a ngîr a, “Aw Juda le Jerusalema chêngtuhai, mi lo ngai ta u; LALPA in Pathien chu ring unla, chuongchun, sukdetin um in tih; a zâwlneihai chu ring unla, chuongchun, hlawtling in tih,” a ta.

en: And when he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed them that should sing unto Jehovah, and give praise in holy array, as they went out before the army, and say, Give thanks unto Jehovah; for his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu ân fui zo hnung chun, sipaihai hmaa an fe suok phaa inthieng mawina chu inpâka LALPA kuoma hla sak dingin mi a ruot a: “LALPA kuomah lâwmthu hril ro, a zângaina chu kumkhuoin a um zing sih a, ti ro” a ta.

en: And when they began to sing and to praise, Jehovah set liers-in-wait against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, that were come against Judah; and they were smitten.
hmr: Chun, an inpâk a, hla an hang sak ṭan phing chun Juda ram hung rûntuhai Seir tlâng le, Moab le Ammon thlahai chunga chun inchân rutuhai LALPA chun ân chân tir tah a; chuongchun, hnein an um tah a.

en: For the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of mount Seir, utterly to slay and destroy them: and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, every one helped to destroy another.
hmr: Moab le Ammon thlahai chu Seir tlâng khuo deltuhai chu that vawng a, anni sukbohmang dingin an hung tho tah a; chun, Seir tlâng hluotuhai an hung sukrêm hnunga khawm chun, mi tin chu mi dang dang insukbohmangtuo an tum seng tah a.

en: And when Judah came to the watch-tower of the wilderness, they looked upon the multitude; and, behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth, and there were none that escaped.
hmr: Chun, Juda mihai chu thlalêra vêngna in insânga an hang tlung chun; mipuihai chu an hei en a; chun, ngai ta, mithi ruong hnuoia tluhai chu an hmu a; tukhawm a damsuok hrim an um dêr nawh a.

en: And when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both riches and dead bodies, and precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away: and they were three days in taking the spoil, it was so much.
hmr: Chun, Jehosaphat le a mihai chu an thuom hlîppêk dinga an hung chun lunghluhai, silfênhai, hausakna nasatak elhai chu anni lai chun an hmusuok a, chuonghai chu an phur sêng lo rauin an lâk a; chuong ang lâwm chun a tam a, ni thum sûng zet chu râllâk thilhai chu an lâk a.

en: And on the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Beracah; for there they blessed Jehovah: therefore the name of that place was called The valley of Beracah unto this day.
hmr: Chun, a ni li ni chun anni chu Beraka ruoma chun an inkhâwm a, chutaka chun LALPA chu an chawi- mawi a, chuleiin, a hmun hming chu tu chen hin “Malsâwmna ruom” ti a ni tah a.

en: Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, and Jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy; for Jehovah had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
hmr: Chun, Juda rama mi po po le Jerusalema mihai chu an kîr nâwk tah a; Jehosaphat chu anni rawi hmaa chun hlimtakin Jerusalema fe ding chun a kîr tah a; LALPA chun an hmêlmahai chunga hlim dingin anni chu a lo siem ta sih a.

en: And they came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets unto the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema chun LALPA inah perkhuonghai, ṭingṭanghai, taw- tawrâwthai leh an hung lût a.

en: And the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of the countries, when they heard that Jehovah fought against the enemies of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai hmêlmahai chu LALPA chun a dopui ti an hriet chun chuong ramhaia lalramhai po po chunga chun LALPA ṭina chu a um a.

en: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet; for his God gave him rest round about.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehosaphat ram huop sûng chu a re ṭawk ṭawk a; a Pathien chun a vêl po poa chun râl- muongna a pêk sih a.

en: And Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah: he was thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
hmr: Jehosaphat chun Juda ram chunga chun ro a rêl a, a rorêl ṭan chun kum sâwmthum panga a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmhni panga a rêl a; a nu hming chu Azuba, Silhi naunu kha a nih.

en: And he walked in the way of Asa his father, and turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah.
hmr: A pa Asa lampui kha a hraw a, LALPA mithmua ân dik chu thawin a pêtsan ngai nawh a.

en: Howbeit the high places were not taken away; neither as yet had the people set their hearts unto the God of their fathers.
hmr: Amiruokchu, bâwlhmunhai chu lâk hmang a ni nawh a; mihai khawm chun an thlatuhai Pathien tienga chun an lungrilhai an lân nghat chie nawh a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is inserted in the book of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Jehosaphat thilthaw, a hmasa le a nuhnunghai chu, ngai ta, Hanani naupa Jehu chanchin bu, Israel lalhai lekhabua chun ziek a nih.

en: And after this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel; the same did very wickedly:
hmr: Chun, hi hnunga hin Juda ram lal Jehosaphat chu Israel ram lal Ahazia le chun an inzawm a; ama chun khawhlotakin a thawh a;

en: and he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish; and they made the ships in Ezion-geber.
hmr: lawnghai siema, Tarsisa fe dingin ama chu ân zawmpui a; chuong chun, Ezion-gebera chun lawnghai chu an siem tah a.

en: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because thou hast joined thyself with Ahaziah, Jehovah hath destroyed thy works. And the ships were broken, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
hmr: Chun, Maresaa Dodavahu naupa Eliezer chun Jehosaphat chunga chun a hrillâwk a, “Ahazia chu în zawmpui leiin, LALPA chun i sinthawhai chu a suksiet tah,” a ta. Chuongchun, lawnghai chu an kawiseh a, Tarsisa chun an fe thei ta nawh a.

en: And Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Jehosaphat chu a thlatuhai kuoma chun a in tah a; David khawpuiah a thlatuhai kuoma chun phûmin a um tah a; a naupa Jehoram chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a;

en: And he had brethren, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah; all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
hmr: chun, unauhai, Jehosaphat nau- pasalhai a nei a: Azaria, Jehiel, Zekaria, Azaria, Mikael, Sephatia; hienghai po po hi Israel ram lal Jehosaphat naupasalhai an nih.

en: And their father gave them great gifts, of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram, because he was the first-born.
hmr: Chun, an pa chun an kuoma chun thilpêk nasatak elhai, tangka dâm, rângkachak dâm, thil hlutakhai dâm le Juda rama khawpui kul nei- hai leh a pêk a; amiruokchu, Jehoram chu nau lutîr a ni leiin lalram chu a pêk a.

en: Now when Jehoram was risen up over the kingdom of his father, and had strengthened himself, he slew all his brethren with the sword, and divers also of the princes of Israel.
hmr: Chuonga Jehoram chu a pa ram chunga chun a hung inlal a, a hung insukhrât phing chun a unauhai po po le Israel rama lal tamtak chu kâwlhnâmin a that tâwl tah a.

en: Jehoram was thirty and two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
hmr: Rorêl a ṭan chun Jehoram chu kum sâwmthum pahni a na; Jerusa- lema chun kum riet sûng ro a rêl a.

en: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did the house of Ahab; for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
hmr: Ama chun Ahab sûngkuoin an thaw ang khan, Israel ram lalhai lampuia bawk khan a feh a; Ahab naunu nuhmeiah a nei a; LALPA mithmua thil ṭha lo chu a thawh a.

en: Howbeit Jehovah would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a lamp to him and to his children alway.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun David sûngkuo chu a sukbohmang nawh a, David kuoma thuthlung a lo siem ta lei le, ama le a thlahai kuoma khâwnvar pêk zing zing dinga a lo tiem ta leiin.

en: In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and made a king over themselves.
hmr: Ama hun laia chun Edom ram chu Judahai chunga chun an hel a, anni chunga chun lal an siem tah a.

en: Then Jehoram passed over with his captains, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and smote the Edomites that compassed him about, and the captains of the chariots.
hmr: Chun, Jehoram chu ama le a sakawr tawlailîr po pohai le a hotuhai le chun ân thawk a, zân lai a hang ṭhâwng a, sakawr tawlailîr hotuhai le ama inhuoltu Edom mihai chu a thaw tah a.

en: So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah unto this day: then did Libnah revolt at the same time from under his hand, because he had forsaken Jehovah, the God of his fathers.
hmr: Chuongchun, vawisûn ni chen hin Edom mihai chu Judahai chunga chun an hel ta zing a; chu huna bawk chun Libna khuo khawm chu an lo hel veh a; a thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu a lo nghatsan tâk leiin.

en: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and made the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot, and led Judah astray.
hmr: Chunawa khawm chun Juda ram tlângahai chun bâwlhmunhai a siem a, Jerusalema umhai chu ân uirettir a, chuongchun, Juda ram chu an lo ṭhuoi hmang tah a.

en: And there came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of David thy father, Because thou hast not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat thy father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,
hmr: Chun, a kuoma chun zâwlnei Elija kuoma inthawkin lekha ziek a hung a, “I pu David Pathien LALPA chun hieng ang hin a ti a nih, ‘I pa Jehosaphat lampuihai chu i hraw nawh a, Juda ram lal Asa lampuihai khawm chu i hraw bawk nawh a;

en: but hast walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot, like as the house of Ahab did, and also hast slain thy brethren of thy father’s house, who were better than thyself:
hmr: Israel lalhai lampuihai chu i hraw lem a. Ahab sûngkuoin an lo thaw ta angin, Jerusalema umhai le Juda rama mihai chu i lo inuirettir tah a; chun, i pahnama mi i unauhai nanga nêka ṭha lemhai chu i that bawk a,

en: behold, Jehovah will smite with a great plague thy people, and thy children, and thy wives, and all thy substance;
hmr: ngai ta, LALPA chun i mihai, i nauhai, i nuhmeihai le i thilnei po pohai chu hripuiin nasatakin a hrem ding a nih;

en: and thou shalt have great sickness by disease of thy bowels, until thy bowels fall out by reason of the sickness, day by day.
hmr: i phîng natna leiin nang khawma natna nasatak nei i ta; ni tin tinin, chu natna leia i rîlhai a suok zo vawng hmakhat chun nei i tih,’” tiin.

en: And Jehovah stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians that are beside the Ethiopians:
hmr: Chun, Ethiopia mihai kâwla um Arabia le Philistin mihai lungril chu Jehoram chunga chun LALPAIN a chawktho a;

en: and they came up against Judah, and brake into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the king’s house, and his sons also, and his wives; so that there was never a son left him, save Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
hmr: Juda ram chu an hung rûn a, an hung lût a; lal ina thil hmua umhai po po an lâk vawng a; a naupasalhai le naunuhmeihai leh, chuongchun, a naupasalhai laia a naupang tak Jehoahaz ti chau naw chu a naupa- sal hrim hrim mâksanpêk a ni nawh a.

en: And after all this Jehovah smote him in his bowels with an incurable disease.
hmr: chun, hieng thilhai po po hnunga hin LALPA chun a phîngah natna dam thei loin a hrem a.

en: And it came to pass, in process of time, at the end of two years, that his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness, and he died of sore diseases. And his people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.
hmr: Chuong anga kum hni ân vawi hnung chun, a natna lei chun a rîl chu a suok a, natna natakin a thi tah a. Chun, a mihai chun a thlatuhai chawimawinaa meipui an sêm ang khan, ama ta dingin meichawk an siempêk nawh a.

en: Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years: and he departed without being desired; and they buried him in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the kings.
hmr: Rorêl a ṭan chun kum sâwm- thum pahni mi a na, Jerusalema chun kum riet ro a rêl a; ama chu ngainatna um loin a thi tah a; David khawpuia chun an phûm a, lalhai thlân ina khan ni loin.

en: And the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his stead; for the band of men that came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah reigned.
hmr: Jerusalema chênghai chun a naupa naupang tak Ahazia chu ama aia chun lalin an siem a; Arabia mihai le pâwl ruol bûka hunghai khan a upahai po chu an that vawng ta sih a. Chuongchun, Judai ram lal Jehoram naupa Ahazia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Forty and two years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign; and he reigned one year in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Athaliah the daughter of Omri.
hmr: Ro a rêl ṭan chun Ahazia chu kum sâwmli pahni mi a na, Jerusalema chun kum khat sûng ro a rêl a, a nu hming chu Athalia, Omri naunu a nih.

en: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab; for his mother was his counsellor to do wickedly.
hmr: Ama khawma Ahab sûngkaw lampuihai kha a hraw ve a; a nu chu khawhlotaka khawsa dinga a thu rawtpuitu a ni sih a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as did the house of Ahab; for they were his counsellors after the death of his father, to his destruction.
hmr: Ahab sûngkuoin an thaw ang khan LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha naw chu a thaw a; a pa a thi hnung chun anni chu a sietna ding chena a thu rawtpuituhai an ni sih a.

en: He walked also after their counsel, and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth-gilead: and the Syrians wounded Joram.
hmr: An thu rawt ang pei chun a fe a, Suria ram lal Hazael chu do dingin Ramoth-gileada chun Israel ram lal Ahab naupa Jehoram le chun a hang fe veh a; Suria mihai chun Joram chu an lo inhliem a.

en: And he returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which they had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. And Azariah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.
hmr: Chun, Suria ram lal Hazael a donaa Ramaa ama an inhliemnahai chu insukdam dingin Jezreela chun a kîr tah a. Chun, Judai ram lal Jeho- ram naupa Azaria chu, Ahab naupa Jehoram chu a damnaw leia Jezreela en dingin a zu feh a.

en: Now the destruction of Ahaziah was of God, in that he went unto Joram: for when he was come, he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom Jehovah had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahazia bohmangna chu Pathiena inthawk a na, Joram kuoma a hang fe lei tak chu a nih; chuonga a hung lai chun, Ahab sûng- kuo chu sât thlatu dinga LALPAIN hriek a lo nâl tah Nimsi naupa Jehu chu do dingin Joram le khan a hang fe ve sih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Jehu was executing judgment upon the house of Ahab, that he found the princes of Judah, and the sons of the brethren of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah, and slew them.
hmr: Chun, Jehu chun thupêk Ahab sûngkaw ta dinga a pêk suok lai chun Juda ram lalhai le Ahazia unauhai naupasalhai chu Ahazia rawngbâwl- in a hmuh a, anni chu a that tâwl tah a.

en: And he sought Ahaziah, and they caught him (now he was hiding in Samaria), and they brought him to Jehu, and slew him; and they buried him, for they said, He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought Jehovah with all his heart. And the house of Ahaziah had no power to hold the kingdom.
hmr: Chun, Ahazia chu a zawng a, an man a, (Samariaa chun a lo in bihmang a na) Jehu kuoma chun an hung ṭhuoi a, an that tah a; chun, an phûm a, “A lungril po poa LALPA zawngtu Jehosaphat naupa chu a ni ngei,” an tih a. Chuongchun, Ahazia sûngkuoa chun lalram chunga rorêl thei ding mi pakhat khawm an um ta nawh a.

en: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal of the house of Judah.
hmr: Chun, Ahazia nu Athalia chun a naupa chu a thi tah ti a hriet chun, a tho a, Juda sûngkuo lal chi po chu a rawt ta vawng a.

en: But Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king’s sons that were slain, and put him and his nurse in the bedchamber. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah, so that she slew him not.
hmr: Amiruokchu, lal naunu Jehosa- beath chun Ahazia naupa Joas chu a lâk a, lal nauhai thata umhai laia inthawk chun ân rûkhmang a, khum pindanah ama dawntu le chun a sie tah a. Chuongchun, lal Jehoram nau- nu Jehosabeath, thiempu Jehoiada nuhmei chun (ama chu Ahazia farnu a ni sih a,) Athaliaa inthawk chun a thuphmang a, chuongchun, a suk- hlum ve nawh a.

en: And he was with them hid in the house of God six years: and Athaliah reigned over the land.
hmr: Pathien ina chun anni leh kum ruk sûng thupin a um a, chun, Athalia chun ram chunga chun ro a rêl a.

en: And in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself, and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, and Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, and Azariah the son of Obed, and Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri, into covenant with him.
hmr: Chun, a kum sari kum chun Jehoiada chu ân sukhrât a, sipai za pâwl chunga hotuhai, Jeho- ram naupa Azaria hai, Jehohanan naupa Ismael hai, Obed naupa Azaria hai, Adaia naupa Maaseia hai, Zikri naupa Elisaphat hai le chun thu a thlung a.

en: And they went about in Judah, and gathered the Levites out of all the cities of Judah, and the heads of fathers’ houses of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram sûnga chun a fe vêl a, Juda khawpui po poa inthawk chu Levi mihai le, Israel pahnam ṭhuoituhai le chun a lâk khâwm a, Jerusalema chun an fe tah a.

en: And all the assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. And he said unto them, Behold, the king’s son shall reign, as Jehovah hath spoken concerning the sons of David.
hmr: Chun, mipui inkhâwmhai po po chun Pathien ina chun lal le thutiem an siem tah a. Chun, an kuomah a hril a, “David naupasalhai chungthu LALPAIN a hril ta angin, en ta u lal naupa hin ro a rêl ding a na.

en: This is the thing that ye shall do: a third part of you, that come in on the sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the thresholds;
hmr: Hi hi thil in thaw ding chu hung nîng a tih: Châwlnia hung hlak, thiempuhai le Levi mihai hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu kawtkhâr vêngtuhai nîng in ta;

en: and a third part shall be at the king’s house; and a third part at the gate of the foundation: and all the people shall be in the courts of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: a hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat dang chu lal inah um an ta, a hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat dang chu lungphûmna dai kawtkhâr bulah um an ta; chun, mipui po po chu LALPA in inhuonna tuol sûnglaia chun um an tih.

en: But let none come into the house of Jehovah, save the priests, and they that minister of the Levites; they shall come in, for they are holy: but all the people shall keep the charge of Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, thiempuhai ti chau naw chu mi tukhawm LALPA ina chun fe naw raw hai se; Levi mi rawngbâwltuhai le chau chun anni chu hung lût an tih, an inthieng sih a; amiruokchu, mipuihai po po chun LALPA chu an nghâk seng ding a nih.

en: And the Levites shall compass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand; and whosoever cometh into the house, let him be slain: and be ye with the king when he cometh in, and when he goeth out.
hmr: Levi mihai chun, mi tin an râlthuomhai chawi sengin lal chu ngîr huol an ta; amiruokchu, mi tukhawm LALPA ina hung lût chu that ni raw se; nangni chu lal a hung lût le a fe suok huna chun a kâwla chun um zing in tih,” tiin.

en: So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took every man his men, those that were to come in on the sabbath, with those that were to go out on the sabbath; for Jehoiada the priest dismissed not the courses.
hmr: Chuongchun, Levi mihai le Juda mihai po po chun thiempu Jehoiadain thu a pêk ang tak chun an thaw tah a; mi tin chun anni mihai châwlnia fe suok dinghai le hung lût dinghai chu an ṭhuoi vêl a; thiempu Jehoiada chun a ṭîn ding pâwlhai chu ân thlengtir si nawh a.

en: And Jehoiada the priest delivered to the captains of hundreds the spears, and bucklers, and shields, that had been king David’s, which were in the house of God.
hmr: Thiempu Jehoiada chun Pathien ina um, lal David ta phawthai dâm, feihai dâm, âwmphâwhai dâm chu sipai za pâwl hotuhai kuoma chun a pêk suok tâwl a.

en: And he set all the people, every man with his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the king round about.
hmr: Mipuihai po po, mi tin el chu a râlthuom a kutah chawiin, lal sîrvêla le, in mâichâm sirvêl po poa chun, in sîr changtieng panga inthawka in sîr vawitieng panga chen chun ân umtir a.

en: Then they brought out the king’s son, and put the crown upon him, and gave him the testimony, and made him king: and Jehoiada and his sons anointed him; and they said, Long live the king.
hmr: Chun, lal naupa chu an hung ṭhuoi suok a, lallukhum an inkhumtir a, thuinhriettir chu an pêk a; chuong- chun, lalah an siem tah a; chun, Jehoiada le a naupasalhai chun ama chu hriek an nâl a, “Lal hi Pathienin sandam raw se,” an tih a.

en: And when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came to the people into the house of Jehovah:
hmr: Chun, Athalia chun mipui tlân vêl ri le lal an chawimawi ri chu a hrietin, LALPA ina chun mipuihai kuoma chun a va feh tah a;

en: and she looked, and, behold, the king stood by his pillar at the entrance, and the captains and the trumpets by the king; and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew trumpets; the singers also played on instruments of music, and led the singing of praise. Then Athaliah rent her clothes, and said, Treason! treason!
hmr: chun, a hei en a, lûtna bula chun lal chu a sûtpui kâwla chun a ngîr a, sipai hotuhai le tawtawrâwt puhai khawm chu lal kâwla chun an um a. Chuongchun, ram sûng mi po po chu an hlim bêk bêk a, tawtawrâwthai an mût a; hla saktuhai khawm chun hla sakna thuomhnawhai chu sutin, chawimawina hla chu an sak tah a. Chun, Athalia chun a puonhai chu a keithlêr a, “Phierrûkna, phierrûkna,” tiin a khêk a.

en: And Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds that were set over the host, and said unto them, Have her forth between the ranks; and whoso followeth her, let him be slain with the sword: for the priest said, Slay her not in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Jehoiada chun sipai pâwl chunga siea um, za pâwl hotuhai chu a hung ṭhuoi suok a, an kuomah, “Sipai tlarhai kâra khan insuoktir ro; tukhawm ama zui taphawt chu kâwlhnâma that nîng an tih, thiempu chun, ‘LALPA ina chun ama chu that naw ro,’ a ti sih a,” a ta.

en: So they made way for her; and she went to the entrance of the horse gate to the king’s house: and they slew her there.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama ta ding chun lampui chu an inken a, lal ina sakawr kawtkhâr lûtna tieng chun a feh a; chutaka chun an that tah a.

en: And Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, and all the people, and the king, that they should be Jehovah’s people.
hmr: Chun, Jehoiada chun ama le mipuihai po po le, lal inkâra chun LALPA mihai chu an ni ding a nih, tiin thuthlung a siem tah a.

en: And all the people went to the house of Baal, and brake it down, and brake his altars and his images in pieces, and slew Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po chu Baal ina chun an va feh a, an suksiet a, a mâichâmhai le a limhai chu an suk- nâwi vawng a; Baal thiempu Mattan chu mâichâm hmaa chun an that tah a.

en: And Jehoiada appointed the officers of the house of Jehovah under the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of Jehovah, to offer the burnt-offerings of Jehovah, as it is written in the law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, according to the order of David.
hmr: Chun, Jehoiada chun LALPA ina sinthawnahai chu thiempu Levi mihai kuta chun a ruot tah a; chuonghai chu Mosie dâna ziek anga LALPA kuoma pumrawhmang thilin- hlânhai, David thu lo pêk ta anga hlimtak le hla sak puma inhlân dinga LALPA ina Davidin a lo semdar tahai chu an nih.

en: And he set the porters at the gates of the house of Jehovah, that none that was unclean in anything should enter in.
hmr: Chun, LALPA in dâi kawtkhâra chun kawtkhâr vêngtuhai chu a sieh a, mi tukhawm, ieng thila khawm inthieng nawna nei chu an lût nawna dingin.

en: And he took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the king from the house of Jehovah: and they came through the upper gate unto the king’s house, and set the king upon the throne of the kingdom.
hmr: Chun, za pâwl hotuhai, mi ṭhahai, mipui rorêltuhai le chu rama mi po pohai chu a ṭhuoi a, LALPA ina inthawk chun lal chu a hung ṭhuoi thlâk tah a; chun, dâi kawtkhâr sakhnungah hungin lal ina chun an hung a, lal chu lalram lalṭhungphaa chun an inṭhungtir tah a.

en: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. And Athaliah they had slain with the sword.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu rama mipui- hai po po chu an hlim êm êm a, khaw- pui chu râlmuongin a um a, Athalia chu kâwlhnâmin an that tah a.

en: Joash was seven years old when he began to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Zibiah, of Beer-sheba.
hmr: Joas chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sari mi chau a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmli sûng ro a rêl a; a nu chu Beer-sebaa mi, a hming Zibia a nih.

en: And Joash did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
hmr: Thiempu Jehoiada dam sûng po poa chun Joas chun Pathien mit- hmuah thil indikhai chu a thaw a.

en: And Jehoiada took for him two wives; and he begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Jehoiada chun nuhmei pahni ân neitir a; naupasalhai le naunu- hmeihai a nei a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that Joash was minded to restore the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Joas chun LALPA in chu siem ṭhat a lungril tah a.

en: And he gathered together the priests and the Levites, and said to them, Go out unto the cities of Judah, and gather of all Israel money to repair the house of your God from year to year; and see that ye hasten the matter. Howbeit the Levites hastened it not.
hmr: Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu a ko khâwm a, an kuomah, “Juda ram khawpuiahai chun fe suok unla, kum tinin in Pathien in siem ṭhatna dingin Israel mihai po poa inthawk chun tangka dâwl unla; hi thil hi hung inhmaw hle dingin ngaituo ro,” a ta. Amiruokchu, Levi mihai chu an inhmaw naw hle el a.

en: And the king called for Jehoiada the chief, and said unto him, Why hast thou not required of the Levites to bring in out of Judah and out of Jerusalem the tax of Moses the servant of Jehovah, and of the assembly of Israel, for the tent of the testimony?
hmr: Chun, lal chun thiempu laltak Jehoiada chu a ko a, a kuomah, “Thuthlungna puon ina dingin, Israel mipuihai le LALPA siehlaw Mosie ruot leiman chu Jerusalem le Juda rama inthawka hung la dingin ieng dinga Levi mihai hi i tir naw am a na?

en: For the sons of Athaliah, that wicked woman, had broken up the house of God; and also all the dedicated things of the house of Jehovah did they bestow upon the Baalim.
hmr: Kha nuhmei rilo Athalia naupa- salhai khan Pathien in chu an lo suksiet a; LALPA in ta dinga thilin- hlânhai po po kha Baal kuomah an lo pêk vawng ta sih a,” a ta.

en: So the king commanded, and they made a chest, and set it without at the gate of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal chun thu a pêk a, thingrem an siem a, LALPA in dâi kawtkhâr puoa chun an in- ṭhut a.

en: And they made a proclamation through Judah and Jerusalem, to bring in for Jehovah the tax that Moses the servant of God laid upon Israel in the wilderness.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema le Juda ram po poa chun, thlalêra Pathien siehlaw Mosien Israel mihai po po chunga thawbi a lo siem ta chu LALPA ta dinga hung chawi dingin thuphuong- na an siem tah a.

en: And all the princes and all the people rejoiced, and brought in, and cast into the chest, until they had made an end.
hmr: Chuongchun, lalhai po po le mipuihai po po chu an hlim hle a, an tangkahai an hung chawi a, thing- rema chun an dâwl zo hmakhat chun an thlâk ta zing hlak a.

en: And it was so, that, at what time the chest was brought unto the king’s officers by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw that there was much money, the king’s scribe and the chief priest’s officer came and emptied the chest, and took it, and carried it to its place again. Thus they did day by day, and gathered money in abundance.
hmr: Chun, thingrem chu lal hotuhai hmaa Levi mihai chun an hung lâk po leh, tangka tamtak a um ti an hmu chun lal lekhaziektu le thiempu laltak hotu chu an hung a, thingrem chu an sukruok a, an lâk a, a hmuna bawk chun an va sie nâwk hlak a, chuong ang chun ni tin an thaw a, tangka tamtak an inkhâwl a.

en: And the king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Jehovah; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Jehovah, and also such as wrought iron and brass to repair the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, chu chu LALPA in rawng- bâwlna sin thaw ang pei chun Jehoiada le lal chun an pêk suok tah a; in bâwlthiemhai le, thing sak- thiemhai LALPA in siem ṭha ding chun an ruoi a, LALPA in bâwl ṭha dinga dârsen le thîra sinthawtuhai khawm chu.

en: So the workmen wrought, and the work of repairing went forward in their hands, and they set up the house of God in its state, and strengthened it.
hmr: Chuongchun, sinthawtuhai chun sin an thawh a; sin chu anni thaw zo famkim a ni tah a, Pathien in chu a ngai ang bawk chun an bâwl ṭhah a, an sukdet tah a.

en: And when they had made an end, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, whereof were made vessels for the house of Jehovah, even vessels wherewith to minister and to offer, and spoons, and vessels of gold and silver. And they offered burnt-offerings in the house of Jehovah continually all the days of Jehoiada.
hmr: Chun, an zo pha chun, tangka danghai chu lal le Jehoiada kuoma chun an hung chawi a; chuonghai chun LALPA ina bûr le bêlhai, rawng- bâwlna le inhlânna bûr le bêlhai, haihawhai, rângkachak le tangkaraw bûr le bêlhai chu siem a na. Chun, Jehoiada dam sûng po po chun ni tin hin LALPA ina chun pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai chu an inhlân zing zing hlak a.

en: But Jehoiada waxed old and was full of days, and he died; a hundred and thirty years old was he when he died.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jehoiada chu a hung upa a, a hung tar tah a, a thi tah a; a thi chun kum za le sâwmthum mi a nih.

en: And they buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel, and toward God and his house.
hmr: Ama chu David khawpuiah lalhai laia chun an phûm a, Pathien le a in chunga le, Israel ram sûnga chun thil ṭha a thaw hlak leiin.

en: Now after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah, and made obeisance to the king. Then the king hearkened unto them.
hmr: Jehoiada a thi hnung chun Juda ram lalhai chu an hung a, lal kuoma chun devânkaina an hung siem a. Chun, lal khawm chun an thu chu a lo ngai a.

en: And they forsook the house of Jehovah, the God of their fathers, and served the Asherim and the idols: and wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their guiltiness.
hmr: An thlatuhai Pathien LALPA in chu an nghatsan a; milimhai le Asera rawng chu an bâwl tah a; chuong- chun, hi an rîtlona lei hin Jerusalem le Juda ram chunga chun lungsenna a hung tlung tah a.

en: Yet he sent prophets to them, to bring them again unto Jehovah; and they testified against them: but they would not give ear.
hmr: LALPA kuoma hung ṭhuoi nâwk dingin an kuoma chun zâwlneihai a tir a; anni chu an lo ngâwk a, na an lo daw nuom nawh a.

en: And the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest; and he stood above the people, and said unto them, Thus saith God, Why transgress ye the commandments of Jehovah, so that ye cannot prosper? because ye have forsaken Jehovah, he hath also forsaken you.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Jehoiada naupa Zekaria kuoma chun Pathien thlarau a hung tlung a, mipuihai chunga chun a ngîr a, an kuomah, “Pathien chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Hlawtling thei nâwna pha el dinga iengdinga LALPA thupêkhai chu in bawsiet am a na? LALPA chu in nghatsan leiin ama khawma a nghatsan cheu a ni hi,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: And they conspired against him, and stoned him with stones at the commandment of the king in the court of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, ama chu an phierrûk tah a, LALPA in inhuon tuolsûnga chun lal thupêkin an dêng hlum tah a.

en: Thus Joash the king remembered not the kindness which Jehoiada his father had done to him, but slew his son. And when he died, he said, Jehovah look upon it, and require it.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Joas chun ama chunga a pa Jehoiada ngilneizie kha a hriet zing ta nawh a, a naupa chu a that tah a. Chun, a thi chun, “LALPAIN hung en sienla, phuba la raw se,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass at the end of the year, that the army of the Syrians came up against him: and they came to Judah and Jerusalem, and destroyed all the princes of the people from among the people, and sent all the spoil of them unto the king of Damascus.
hmr: Chun, kum tâwpa chun Suria sipaihai chun ama chu an hung rûn tah a; chuongchun, Juda ram le Jeru- salema khawm chun an hung lût a; an mi lienhai po po chu an sukbohmang vawng a, annia râllâk sum po po chu Damaska lal kuomah an inphur vawng a.

en: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men; and Jehovah delivered a very great host into their hand, because they had forsaken Jehovah, the God of their fathers. So they executed judgment upon Joash.
hmr: Suria sipai pâwlhai chu mi tlâwmte chau hi an hung a, ami- ruokchu, LALPA chun sipai pâwl lientak chu an kutah a pêk sih a; an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu an nghatsan leiin. Chuongchun, Joas chunga chun hremna chu an in- tlungtir tah a.

en: And when they were departed from him (for they left him very sick), his own servants conspired against him for the blood of the sons of Jehoiada the priest, and slew him on his bed, and he died; and they buried him in the city of David, but they buried him not in the sepulchres of the kings.
hmr: Chun, ama chu an mâksan chun (na inrimtakin ama chu an mâksan sih a), thiempu Jehoiada naupasalhai thisen lei khan ama siehlaw ngeiin ama chu a phierrûk tah a; a khum chunga ngei chun a that a, a thi tah a; David khawpuia chun an phûm a, nisienlakhawm, lalhai thlân ina khan chu an phûm nawh.

en: And these are they that conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
hmr: Hienghai hi ama phierrutuhai chu an nih: Ammon nu Simeath naupa Zabad hai, Moab nu Simrith naupa Jehozabad hai hi.

en: Now concerning his sons, and the greatness of the burdens laid upon him, and the rebuilding of the house of God, behold, they are written in the commentary of the book of the kings. And Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, a naupasalhai chungthu le, ama chunga phurrik nasatak innghat le, Pathien in bâwl thu chu, ngai ta, lalhai chanchin ziekna bua chun an ziek a. Chun, a naupa Amazia chun ama aiin ro a rêl tah a.

en: Amaziah was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jehoaddan, of Jerusalem.
hmr: Amazia chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pangaa upa a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmhni pakuo ro a rêl a, a nu hming chu Jehoaddan, Jerusalem mi a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, but not with a perfect heart.
hmr: LALPA mithmuah thil indik chu a thawh a; amiruokchu, lungril ṭha famkim leh ni loin.

en: Now it came to pass, when the kingdom was established unto him, that he slew his servants that had killed the king his father.
hmr: Lalram chu ama ta dinga sukdet a ni phing chun, a pa lal thattu a siehlawhai kha a that tâwl a.

en: But he put not their children to death, but did according to that which is written in the law in the book of Moses, as Jehovah commanded, saying, The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers; but every man shall die for his own sin.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, an nauhai chu a that nawh a, LALPA thupêk ang a, Mosie lekhabua dâna ziek angin a thaw lem tah a; “Nauhai ta dingin pahai chu thi naw ni hai a, nauhai chu pahai ta dingin thi bawk naw ni hai; amiruokchu, mi tin mâni suolna senga ding chun thi lem an tih,” tiin.

en: Moreover Amaziah gathered Judah together, and ordered them according to their fathers’ houses, under captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, even all Judah and Benjamin: and he numbered them from twenty years old and upward, and found them three hundred thousand chosen men, able to go forth to war, that could handle spear and shield.
hmr: Chunawa khawm Amazia chun Juda mihai chu a ko khâwm a, Juda le Benjamin chia mi po pohai chu za pâwl hotu hnuoia dâm, sâng pâwl hotu hnuoia dâm an pahnam ang peiin an inumtir a; kum sâwmhni le a chungtienga mi po chu a tiem a, phâw le fei hmang thei, indo dinga fe suok thei ṭhieu le thlangsuok ṭhieu mi nuoi thum an um a.

en: He hired also a hundred thousand mighty men of valor out of Israel for a hundred talents of silver.
hmr: Chun, tangka talent za khatin Israel rama inthawkin mi huoisen nuoi khat a ruoi bawk a.

en: But there came a man of God to him, saying, O king, let not the army of Israel go with thee; for Jehovah is not with Israel, to wit, with all the children of Ephraim.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien mi a kuomah a hung a, “Aw lalpa, Israel sipaihai hi nanga ruolin fe ve naw raw hai se, Israelhai kuoma chun LALPA chu a um si nawh a; anih, Ephraim thlahai po po huomin.

en: But if thou wilt go, do valiantly, be strong for the battle: God will cast thee down before the enemy; for God hath power to help, and to cast down.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, in fe suok a ni hrim hrim chun, huoitakin thaw la, indonaa chun va hrât rawh, hmêl- mahai hmaa chun Pathien chun suktlâwm a ti che; Pathien chun ṭhangpui ding le pei thla dingin thilthawtheina a nei sih a,” a ta.

en: And Amaziah said to the man of God, But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel? And the man of God answered, Jehovah is able to give thee much more than this.
hmr: Amazia chun Pathien mi kuoma chun, “Anleh, Israel sipaihai kuoma tangka talent za ka lo pêk ta chu ieng tin am thâwng ei ti leh?” a ta. Pathien mi chun, “Hi nêka tam khawm hi pe ding chein LALPA chu a thei a nih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: Then Amaziah separated them, to wit, the army that was come to him out of Ephraim, to go home again: wherefore their anger was greatly kindled against Judah, and they returned home in fierce anger.
hmr: Amazia chun, Ephraima in- thawka a kuoma sipai hunghai kha an in tienga fe nâwk el dingin a ṭhe thlâk tah a; chuongchun, Judahai chunga chun an lungsen chu nasa- takin a chawk tah a, lunginsen ṭium- tak chun in an inlawi nâwk tah a.

en: And Amaziah took courage, and led forth his people, and went to the Valley of Salt, and smote of the children of Seir ten thousand.
hmr: Chun, Amazia chu ân sukhuoi a, a mihai chu a ṭhuoi suok a, Chi Ruoma chun a fe tah a; Seir thlahai sîng khat rau chu a hang hne tah a.

en: And other ten thousand did the children of Judah carry away alive, and brought them unto the top of the rock, and cast them down from the top of the rock, so that they were all broken in pieces.
hmr: Chun, mi dang sîng khat bawk chu Juda thlahai chun a hringin an ṭhuoi a, lungpui sîpa chun an hung ṭhuoi a, chuongchun, lungpui sîpa inthawk chun an pei thlâk a, an rêng chun an inphit vawng tâwl tah a.

en: But the men of the army whom Amaziah sent back, that they should not go with him to battle, fell upon the cities of Judah, from Samaria even unto Beth-horon, and smote of them three thousand, and took much spoil.
hmr: Chun, sipai pâwla mihai chu, indo dinga ama le fe lo dinga Amazia chun a tirkirhai khan Samaria inthawk Beth-horon chenin Juda ram khawpuihai chu an hang rûn a, mi sâng thum an that a, râllâk sum tamtak an lâk bawk a.

en: Now it came to pass, after that Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense unto them.
hmr: Chun, Amazia chu Edom mihai that a hung kîr hnung chun, Seir thlahai pathien chu a hung lâk a, a pathienhai ni dingin a sieh a, an hmaa chun a kûn a, an kuoma chun riminhnikhai a raw tah a.

en: Wherefore the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Amaziah, and he sent unto him a prophet, who said unto him, Why hast thou sought after the gods of the people, which have not delivered their own people out of thy hand?
hmr: Chuleichun, LALPA lunginsen chu Amazia chunga chun a hung ṭal tah a, a kuoma chun zâwlnei a tir a, a kuomah, “I kuta inthawka an mihai ngei khawm sanhim thei si lo, mipuihai pathienhai chu iengdinga i zawng am a na?” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, as he talked with him, that the king said unto him, Have we made thee of the king’s counsel? forbear; why shouldest thou be smitten? Then the prophet forbare, and said, I know that God hath determined to destroy thee, because thou hast done this, and hast not hearkened unto my counsel.
hmr: Chun, ama le an inbiek zing lai chun lal chun a kuomah, “Lal thurawnpuituah kan siem che am a nih? Fîmkhur rawh; iengdingin am thatin um i ta?” a ta. Chuongchun, zâwlnei chun, “Ka thurâwn chu i pawisa nawh a, hi thil hi i thaw leiin, Pathien chun suksiet a tum che a nih ti ka hriet a nih,” a ta, a to tah a.

en: Then Amaziah king of Judah took advice, and sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look one another in the face.
hmr: Chun, Juda ram lal Amazia chun thurawn a lâk a, Israel lal Jehu naupa Jehoahaz naupa Joas kuomah mi a tir a, “Hung ta, hmai le hmaisan ngeiah hang inen ei tih,” tiin.

en: And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon, and trod down the thistle.
hmr: Chun, Israel ram lal Joas chun Juda ram lal Amazia kuoma chun mi a tir a, “Lebanona hlingbukin Leba- nona Sidar thing kâwlah mi tirin, ‘I naunu kha ka naupa nuhmei dingin pe rawh,’ tiin; chun, Lebanona ram- sahai chu an hung a, hlingbuk chu an chîl thlûk tah a.

en: Thou sayest, Lo, thou hast smitten Edom; and thy heart lifteth thee up to boast: abide now at home; why shouldest thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee?
hmr: A ni luo, ‘Edom chu ka hang hneh a’ i ta, i lungrilin uong dingin a dawm sâng che a ni hi; i inah um ṭawk ṭawk el rawh, i sietna ding chu chawksuok ṭâl dîm nîng a ti; nang tlûng i ta, nang ngei chu, chun nang le chun Juda ram chu tlu bawk a tih,” a ta.

en: But Amaziah would not hear; for it was of God, that he might deliver them into the hand of their enemies, because they had sought after the gods of Edom.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Amazia chun a ngai chuong nawh a, an hmêlmahai kuta a pêk theina dinga Pathien ithaw a nih, Edom pathienhai an lo zawng ta lei khan.

en: So Joash king of Israel went up; and he and Amaziah king of Judah looked one another in the face at Beth-shemesh, which belongeth to Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel ram lal Joas chu a hang feh a; Juda rama Beth-semesa chun ama le Juda ram lal Amazia chu hmaisan ngeia chun an inen tah a.

en: And Judah was put to the worse before Israel; and they fled every man to his tent.
hmr: Israel hmaa chun Juda chan chu a se nâwkzuol tah a; mi tin chu mâni puon ina seng an tlânse tah a.

en: And Joash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth-shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim unto the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
hmr: Chun, Israel ram lal Joas chun Jehoahaz naupa Joas naupa Juda ram lal Amazia chu Beth-semesa chun a man a, Jerusalema chun a hung ṭhuoi a, Ephraim tienga dâi kawtkhâra inthawka a kia dâi kawtkhâr chen, tawng za li zet Jerusalem kul chu a vuok chim a.

en: And he took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obed-edom, and the treasures of the king’s house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.
hmr: Chun, Obed-edom le Pathien ina rângkachak le tangkaruo le bûr le bêlhai po po, lal ina ro thilhluhai le, hrên ding salhai le chun a lâk a, Samaria chun a kîr tah a.

en: And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal Jehoahaz nau- pa Joas thi hnung chun Juda lal Joas naupa Amazia chu kum sâwmpanga a la dam a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, behold, are they not written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?
hmr: Chun, Amazia thilthaw dang- hai, a hmasa le nuhnunghai khawm chu, ngai ta, Israel le Juda lalhai lekhabua chun ziek a ni naw am a nih?

en: Now from the time that Amaziah did turn away from following Jehovah they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem; and he fled to Lachish: but they sent after him to Lachish, and slew him there.
hmr: Chun, Amazia chu LALPA zuinaa inthawka ân herhmang china khan chu Jerusalema chun ama chunga phierrûkna an siem a, Lakis tieng chen a tlânseh a, amiruokchu, Lakis tieng chun mi an tir pei a, chutaka chun an that tah a.

en: And they brought him upon horses, and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.
hmr: Chun, a ruong chu sakawr chungah an hung lâk a, a thlatuhai laiah David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a.

en: And all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
hmr: Chun, Juda mihai po po chun Uzzia chu an ṭhuoi a, ama chu kum sâwm paruka upa a na, a pa Amazia hmuna chun lalah an siem tah a.

en: He built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
hmr: Eloth chu a bâwl a, Juda rama chun a pêk nâwk a; chu hnunga chun lal chu a thlatuhai lai chun a in ve tah a.

en: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.
hmr: Uzzia chun ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmparuka upa a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmnga pahni sûng ro a rêl a, a nu hming khawm Jerusalema mi Jekolia a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
hmr: Ama khawm chun a pa Amazia lo thaw ta ang tak khan LALPA mithmuah thil indik chu a thawh a.

en: And he set himself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the vision of God: and as long as he sought Jehovah, God made him to prosper.
hmr: Pathiena thil hmulâwk hriet- thiemna nei Zekaria dam sûng po chun Pathien chu zawng dingin ân siem a; LALPA chu a zawng sûng po chu, Pathien chun ân hlawtlingtir bawk a.

en: And he went forth and warred against the Philistines, and brake down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod; and he built cities in the country of Ashdod, and among the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, a fe suok a, Philistin mihai ân dopui a; Gath kul le, Jabne kul le Asdod kul chu a suk- siet a; chun, Philistin mihai laia le Asdod biela chun khuohai a siem bawk a.

en: And God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gur-baal, and the Meunim.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai le Arabia mihai Gur-baal le Meunima umhai laia chun Pathien chun a ṭhangpui a.

en: And the Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for he waxed exceeding strong.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ammon mihai chun Uzzia kuomah sie an hung chawi a, a hming chu Aigupta ram lûtna chen rauin a hung inthang tah a; a hung hrât êm êm el ta sih a.

en: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.
hmr: Chunawa khawm, Uzzia chun a Kil dâi Kawtkhâr bula dâm, Ruom dâi Kawtkhâra dâm, chun, kul hung kâwina hmuna dâm khan vêngna in insânghai a bâwl a, sipaihai a sie sip a.

en: And he built towers in the wilderness, and hewed out many cisterns, for he had much cattle; in the lowland also, and in the plain: and he had husbandmen and vinedressers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields; for he loved husbandry.
hmr: Thlalêra dâm khawm vêngna in insânghai a bâwl a, tuisunsuohai tamtak a cho bawk a, ran ruol tamtak a nei sih a, tlângṭhuta le phaizâwla dâm khawm chun; lo hmun ṭhahai le tlâng rama dâm chun huon puhai le grêp hrui enkawltuhai a nei a, huon siem vêl hi a châk zâwngtak a ni sih a.

en: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men, that went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king’s captains.
hmr: Chunawa khawm Uzzia chun indo mi, sipai pâwl, Hanania kut hnuoi, hotu Maaseia le lekhaziektu Jeielin anni tiema an nizât ang peia, a pâwl peia indoa fe suok hlakhai chu a nei bawk a.

en: The whole number of the heads of fathers’ houses, even the mighty men of valor, was two thousand and six hundred.
hmr: Pahnamhai laia ṭhuoituhai, mi hrât khawkhênghai an rênga an nizât chu sâng hni le za ruk an nih.

en: And under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.
hmr: Anni kut hnuoi a chun sipai inchûkthiem sa, hmêlma chunga lal chu ṭhangpui dinga, thilthawtheina nasatak le va do thei mihai chu nuoi thum, sâng sari le za nga an nih.

en: And Uzziah prepared for them, even for all the host, shields, and spears, and helmets, and coats of mail, and bows, and stones for slinging.
hmr: Chun, Uzzia chun an ta dingin, sipai po pohai ta ding chun, phâwhai, feihai, thîr lukhumhai, indona zakuo- hai, thalngulhai, dêngvira dinga lunghai leh a siemrêl vawng a.

en: And he made in Jerusalem engines, invented by skilful men, to be on the towers and upon the battlements, wherewith to shoot arrows and great stones. And his name spread far abroad; for he was marvellously helped, till he was strong.
hmr: Jerusalema chun mi them- thiemhai hmusuokin, khâwl lihai, vêngna in insânghaia um ding le, a kia vêngna in insânga ding chun, lunghai le thalhai chu kâp thei dingin, a siem bawk a. Chuongchun, a hming chu nasatakin ân dar a, a suksuol hma po khan chu maktaka ṭhangpuiin a um sih a.

en: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up, so that he did corruptly, and he trespassed against Jehovah his God; for he went into the temple of Jehovah to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a hung hrât chun, a lungril a hung uong a, khawhlotakin a thaw tah a, a Pathien LALPA chunga chun a bawsiet tah a; riminhnik rawna mâichâm chunga riminhnik raw dingin LALPA biek ina chun a fe ve ta a.

en: And Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore priests of Jehovah, that were valiant men:
hmr: Ama hnunga chun thiempu Azaria chu, LALPA thiempu sâwm- riet, mi thil thawtheitak takhai le chun a va lût veh a;

en: and they withstood Uzziah the king, and said unto him, It pertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto Jehovah, but to the priests the sons of Aaron, that are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honor from Jehovah God.
hmr: lal Uzzia chu an sawisêl a, a kuoma chun, “Uzzia, LALPA kuoma riminhnik raw hi nanga chan a ni nawh a, Aron naupasalhai thiem- puhai, riminhnik raw dinga suk- thienga umhai chan a ni lem; hmun inthienga inthawk hin fe suok rawh; i bawsiet a ni ta sih a; LALPA Pathiena inthawka inza i kaina khawm ni chuong bawk naw nih,” an ta.

en: Then Uzziah was wroth; and he had a censer in his hand to burn incense; and while he was wroth with the priests, the leprosy brake forth in his forehead before the priests in the house of Jehovah, beside the altar of incense.
hmr: Uzzia chu a lunginsen a; rimin- hnik chu raw dingin riminhnik râwna mei lâkna chu a kuta chun a um zing a; chun, thiempuhai chunga a lungin- sen lai chun, riminhnik râwna mâichâm sîra, LALPA ina thiempu- hai hmaa chun a bâwka hin inphârna hri a hung suok tah a.

en: And Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked upon him, and, behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out quickly from thence; yea, himself hasted also to go out, because Jehovah had smitten him.
hmr: Chun, thiempu laltak Azaria le thiempu danghai po po chun ama chu an en zing a, chun, ngai ta, a bâwka chun a hung inphâr tah a, chutaka inthawk chun inrangtakin an hnawt- suok tah a; anih, LALPA chun ama chu a hrem tâk lei chun ama ngei khawm chun fe suok chu ân hmaw tah a.

en: And Uzziah the king was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a separate house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of Jehovah: and Jotham his son was over the king’s house, judging the people of the land.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Uzzia chu a thi ni chen chun inphâr a ni tah a; in hranah a um a, inphâr a na; LALPA ina inthawk chun sât thlâk a ni ta sih a; a naupa Jotham chu lal in enkawl- tu, ram sûnga mipuihai rorêltu a hung ni tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.
hmr: Chun, Uzzia thilthaw, a hmasa le a nuhnunghai khawm Amoz naupa Zâwlnei Isai chun a ziek a.

en: So Uzziah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the field of burial which belonged to the kings; for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Uzzia chu a thla- tuhai laia chun a in tah a; inphûmna thlân muol lalhai taa chun a thla- tuhai lai chun an phûm tah a, “Inphâr a ni annâwm,” an ti sih a; chun, a naupa Jotham chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Jotham was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.
hmr: Jotham chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pangaa upa a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmpa- ruk sûng ro a rêl a, a nu hming chu Jerusa, Zadok naunu a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Uzziah had done: howbeit he entered not into the temple of Jehovah. And the people did yet corruptly.
hmr: A pa Uzziain a lo thaw ta po po ang tak khan, LALPA mithmuah thil indik chu a thawh a; amiruokchu, LALPA biekina chun a lût ve nawh a. Mipuihai chun khawhlotakin thil an thawh a.

en: He built the upper gate of the house of Jehovah, and on the wall of Ophel he built much.
hmr: LALPA in dâi kawtkhâr sak- hnung lem kha a siem a, Ophel kula chun in tamtak a siem bawk a.

en: Moreover he built cities in the hill-country of Judah, and in the forests he built castles and towers.
hmr: Chunawa khawm Juda tlâng rama chun khawpuihai a bâwl a; ramhnuoiahai khawm chun kul- bînghai le vêngna inhai dâm a bâwl bawk a.

en: He fought also with the king of the children of Ammon, and prevailed against them. And the children of Ammon gave him the same year a hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. So much did the children of Ammon render unto him, in the second year also, and in the third.
hmr: Ammon thlahai chu ân dopui a, anni a hne tah a. Chun, Ammon thla- hai chun chu kum vêk chun tangka talent za, bu phur sîng khat le buṭei phur sîng khat leh an pêk a. Chuong ang lâwma tam chu Ammon thlahai chun ama chu an pêk a, a kum hnina le a kum thumnaa khawm.

en: So Jotham became mighty, because he ordered his ways before Jehovah his God.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jotham chu thil a hung thaw thei êm êm a, a lampuihai a Pathien LALPA chu ân kawltir hlak leiin.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars, and his ways, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jotham thil thaw danghai, ân donahai po po, a lam- puihai po po, ngai ta, Juda le Israel lalhai lekhabua chun ziek an nih.

en: He was five and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
hmr: Rorêl a ṭan chun ama chu kum sâwmhni pangaa upa a na; kum sâwmparuk Jerusalemah ro a rêl a.

en: And Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jotham chu a thlatuhai lai chun a in tah a; ama chu David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a; a naupa Ahaz chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and he did not that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, like David his father;
hmr: Ahaz chun ro a rêl ṭanin kum sâwmhnia upa a na; Jerusa- lema chun kum sâwmparuk sûng ro a rêl a; a thlatu David ang khan LALPA mithmuah thil indik chu a thaw ve nawh a;

en: but he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and made also molten images for the Baalim.
hmr: amiruokchu, Israel lalhai lampui chu a hrawh a, Baal ta ding chun milim a sunga sunghai chu a siem bawk a.

en: Moreover he burnt incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and burnt his children in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out before the children of Israel.
hmr: Chunawa khawm chun Hinnom naupa ruoma chun riminhnik a rawh a; Israel thlahai hmaa LALPAIN a hnawtsuok khawhri be mihai tirdak- umna ang tak chun a nauhai chu meiah ân lûttir bawk a.

en: And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
hmr: Thing hring tin hnuoia le muol haia le, bâwlhmunhaia chun rimin- hnik a rawh a, ân thâwi bawk a.

en: Wherefore Jehovah his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria; and they smote him, and carried away of his a great multitude of captives, and brought them to Damascus. And he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who smote him with a great slaughter.
hmr: Chuleichun, LALPA a Pathien chun Suria lal kuta chun ama chu a pêk tah a, ama chu an hung thawh a, a mi tamtakhai chu salah an ṭhuoi a, Damaskaa chun an hung ṭhuoi tâwl tah a. Nasataka thata hnetu Israel lal kuta chun ama khawm chu pêk a ni tah a.

en: For Pekah the son of Remaliah slew in Judah a hundred and twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant men; because they had forsaken Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Remalia naupa Peka chun Judai ramah, mi hrât khawkhêng ṭhieu nuoi khat le sîng hni ni khat sûngin a that a; an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu an nghatsan leiin.

en: And Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, slew Maaseiah the king’s son, and Azrikam the ruler of the house, and Elkanah that was next to the king.
hmr: Chun, Ephraima mi thil thaw- theitak Zikri chun lal naupa Maaseia le insûng rorêltu Azrikam le lal dawttu Elkana chu a that bawk a.

en: And the children of Israel carried away captive of their brethren two hundred thousand, women, sons, and daughters, and took also away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chun an unauhai chu sal nuoi hni, nuhmei le naunuhmeihai le naupasalhai leh an ṭhuoi hmang a; chun, râllâk sum tamtak an lâk bawk a; chu râllâk sum chu Samariaa chun an hung lâk a.

en: But a prophet of Jehovah was there, whose name was Oded: and he went out to meet the host that came to Samaria, and said unto them, Behold, because Jehovah, the God of your fathers, was wroth with Judah, he hath delivered them into your hand, and ye have slain them in a rage which hath reached up unto heaven.
hmr: Amiruokchu, LALPA zâwlnei chutaka chun a lo um a, a hming chu Oded a nih; ama chu sipai ruol Samariaa hung lût dinghai chu tuok dingin a feh a, an kuoma chun, “Ngai ta u, in thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu Juda ram chunga chun a lunginsen leiin anni chu an kutah a pêk tah a, chun, anni chu lunginsenin in that a, chu chu vânah a hang tlung tah a nih.

en: And now ye purpose to keep under the children of Judah and Jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen unto you: but are there not even with you trespasses of your own against Jehovah your God?
hmr: Tuhin Juda thlahai le Jerusa- lema mihai chu suoknuhai, suokpa- haia siem in lungril a na; amiruokchu, in Pathien LALPA chunga nangni ngei bawsietna chu nangnia ngei khawm hin a um ve a ni naw am a nih?

en: Now hear me therefore, and send back the captives, that ye have taken captive of your brethren; for the fierce wrath of Jehovah is upon you.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin mi lo ngai unla, in unauhai ngei sala in hung ṭhuoi- hai, salhai chu tirkîr nâwk vawng ro, LALPA lunginsenna ṭiumtak chu in chungah a um sih a,” a ta.

en: Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, and Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against them that came from the war,
hmr: Chun, Ephraim thlahai laia ṭhuoitu ṭhenkhathai, Johanan naupa Azaria hai, Mesillemoth naupa Berekia hai, Sallum naupa Jehizkia hai, Hadlai naupa Amasa hai chun indonaa inthawka hunghai chu an lo dang a,

en: and said unto them, Ye shall not bring in the captives hither: for ye purpose that which will bring upon us a trespass against Jehovah, to add unto our sins and to our trespass; for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.
hmr: an kuoma chun, “Hitaka hin salhai chu in hung ṭhuoi ding a ni nawh: ei bawsietna le ei suolnahai belsa dingin, LALPA chungah baw- sietna mîn tluntir in tum a ni hi; ei bawsietnahai chu a nasa êm êm a, Israel chunga hin lunginsenna ṭium- tak chu a um a nih,” an lo tih a.

en: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the princes and all the assembly.
hmr: Chuongchun, inrâlthuomhai chun salhai le râllâk sumhai chu hotuhai hmaa le mipui inkhâwmhai hmaa chun an mâksan tah a.

en: And the men that have been mentioned by name rose up, and took the captives, and with the spoil clothed all that were naked among them, and arrayed them, and shod them, and gave them to eat and to drink, and anointed them, and carried all the feeble of them upon asses, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm-trees, unto their brethren: then they returned to Samaria.
hmr: Chun, khieng an hming hrila umhai khi an tho a, salhai chu an ṭhuoi a, râllâk thilhai chu anni laia saruoka umhai chu an insiltir a, anni chu an inthuom a, kekawk an inbun- tir a, fâk ding le dâwn ding an pêk a, hriek an nâl a, anni laia hrât nawhai po po chu sabengtung chungah an inchuongtir a, an unauhai kuomah, intûm khawpui Jerikoa chun an hung ṭhuoi tah a; chun, chutaka inthawk chun Samariaa chun an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: At that time did king Ahaz send unto the kings of Assyria to help him.
hmr: Chuong hun laia chun lal Ahaz chun Assuria lal chu ama ṭhangpui dinga fiel dingin mi a tir a.

en: For again the Edomites had come and smitten Judah, and carried away captives.
hmr: Edom mihai chu an hung nâwk a, Juda ram chu an hung rûn a, salah an ṭhuoi tâwl sih a.

en: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland, and of the South of Judah, and had taken Beth-shemesh, and Aijalon, and Gederoth, and Soco with the towns thereof, and Timnah with the towns thereof, Gimzo also and the towns thereof: and they dwelt there.
hmr: Philistin mihai khawma Juda ram Simtienga phaia khawpuihai chu an hung rûn a, Beth-semes hai, Aijalon hai, Gederoth hai, Soko hai an khawperhai leh, Timna le a khaw- perhai leh, Gimzo le a khawperhai leh an lâk a, chuongahai chun an um a.

en: For Jehovah brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel; for he had dealt wantonly in Judah, and trespassed sore against Jehovah.
hmr: Israel lal Ahaz leiin, LALPAIN Judahai chu a hung suktlâwm a; ama chu Judahai chunga nuomtâwka a khawsak lei le LALPA chunga a bawsiet nasa êm leiin.

en: And Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria came unto him, and distressed him, but strengthened him not.
hmr: Assuria lal Tiglath-pileser chu a kuomah a hung a, ama chu sukdet nêkin a sukrimsi hle a.

en: For Ahaz took away a portion out of the house of Jehovah, and out of the house of the king and of the princes, and gave it unto the king of Assyria: but it helped him not.
hmr: Ahaz chun LALPA ina chanvo le, lal nauhai in le lal ina mi chu a lâk suok a, Assuria lal chu a lo pêk a; nisienlakhawm, a ṭhangkaipui chuong nawh a.

en: And in the time of his distress did he trespass yet more against Jehovah, this same king Ahaz.
hmr: Chuongchun, hi lal Ahaz hi, a lunginzîng hun laia khawm chun LALPA chungah a bawsiet zuol det pei a.

en: For he sacrificed unto the gods of Damascus, which smote him; and he said, Because the gods of the kings of Syria helped them, therefore will I sacrifice to them, that they may help me. But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.
hmr: Damaska mihai, ama hung rûntuhai pathienhai chu a biek a, ama chun, “Suria lalhai pathien- haiin anni a ṭhangpui leiin, kei khawm an mi ṭhangpui theina dingin an kuomah inthâwi ka tih,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, ama sietna le Israel ram sûng po po sietna a ni lem tah a.

en: And Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God, and cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God, and shut up the doors of the house of Jehovah; and he made him altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Ahaz chun Pathien ina bûr le bêlhai chu a lâk khâwm a, Pathien ina bûr le bêlhai chu a vuok- nawi vawng a; LALPA in kawtkhâr- hai chu a khâr vawng tah a; chun, Jerusalem kil tina chun ama ta dingin mâichâm a siem a.

en: And in every city of Judah he made high places to burn incense unto other gods, and provoked to anger Jehovah, the God of his fathers.
hmr: Chun, Juda khawpui hmun tam- taka chun Pathien danghai kuoma riminhnik rawna dingin bâwlhmun- hai a siem a, a thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu a chawk lungsen ta deu deu a.

en: Now the rest of his acts, and all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
hmr: A thilthaw danghai chu, a nung- chang tinrênghai leh, a hmasa le nuhnung khawm chu, ngai ta, Juda le Israel lalhai lekhabua chun ziek an nih.

en: And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem; for they brought him not into the sepulchres of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Ahaz chu a thlatuhai laia chun a in tah a, khawpuiah, Jerusa- lema chun an phûm tah a; Israel lalhai thlân ina chun an sie nawh a; chun, a naupa Hezekia chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Hezekiah began to reign when he was five and twenty years old; and he reigned nine and twenty years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
hmr: Hezekia chu kum sâwmhni pangaa upa a niin ro a rêl ṭan a; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmhni pakuo sûng ro a rêl a; a nu hming chu Abija, Zekaria naunu a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that David his father had done.
hmr: A thlatu Davidin a thaw ta ang po po khan, ama khawmin LALPA mit- hmua thil indik chu a thawh a.

en: He in the first year of his reign, in the first month, opened the doors of the house of Jehovah, and repaired them.
hmr: A rorêl a kum khatna, a thla khatnaa chun LALPA in chu kawt- khârhai a hawng a, a siem ṭha tah a.

en: And he brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the broad place on the east,
hmr: Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu a hung lâklût a, saktieng panga hmun âwla chun anni chu a ko khâwm a,

en: and said unto them, Hear me, ye Levites; now sanctify yourselves, and sanctify the house of Jehovah, the God of your fathers, and carry forth the filthiness out of the holy place.
hmr: an kuomah a hril a, “Mi lo ngai ta u, nangni Levi mihai; tuhin nangni le nangni insukthieng unla, in thlatu- hai Pathien LALPA in chu sukthieng unla, hmun inthienga inthawka tirdakumna chu la suok ro.

en: For our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of Jehovah, and turned their backs.
hmr: Ei thlatuhai khan an lo bawsiet a, LALPA ei Pathien mithmuah thil suol chu an lo thaw ta sih a; an ngha hmang a; LALPA umna hmuna in- thawk chun an ngha hmang a, an hnung an innghat tah a.

en: Also they have shut up the doors of the porch, and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense nor offered burnt-offerings in the holy place unto the God of Israel.
hmr: Chun, tuolpûk kawtkhârhai chu an khâr a, khâwnvarhai chu an her- hlum tah a, riminhnik khawm an raw ta nawh a, Israel Pathien kuoma chun hmun inthiengah pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhai khawm chu an inhlân ta bawk nawh a.

en: Wherefore the wrath of Jehovah was upon Judah and Jerusalem, and he hath delivered them to be tossed to and fro, to be an astonishment, and a hissing, as ye see with your eyes.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA lunginsenna chu Jerusalem le Judahai chunga chun a um a, in mita in hmu ang hin, inhîpna ding le, makti ding le, inzak dingin a siem tah a.

en: For, lo, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ei thlatuhai chu kâwl- hnâma suktlâwm an ni tah a, ei naupasalhai, ei naunuhmeihai le ei nuhmeihai chu hi lei hin salah an um tah a.

en: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with Jehovah, the God of Israel, that his fierce anger may turn away from us.
hmr: Tuhin, einia inthawka a lungin- senna ṭiumtak chu lâk hmang a ni theina dingin Israel Pathien LALPA le chun thuthlung siem ka lungril a nih.

en: My sons, be not now negligent; for Jehovah hath chosen you to stand before him, to minister unto him, and that ye should be his ministers, and burn incense.
hmr: Ka naupasalhai, tuhin ngaitha naw ro; riminhnikhai rawh a, a rawngbâwltuhai nia, ama rawngbâwl ding le, a hmaa ngîr dingin LALPA chun a thlang ta si cheu a,” tiin.

en: Then the Levites arose, Mahath, the son of Amasai, and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites; and of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi, and Azariah the son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah, and Eden the son of Joah;
hmr: Chun, Levi mihai chu an tho tah a; Kohath naupasalhai chu: Amasai naupa Mahath le Azaria naupa Joel; Merari naupasalhai chu: Abdi naupa Kis le Jehalelel naupa Azaria; Gerson mi chu: Zimma naupa Joa le Joa naupa Eden;

en: and of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;
hmr: Elizaphan naupasalhai chu: Simri le Jeuel; Asaph naupasalhai chu: Zekaria le Mattania;

en: and of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
hmr: Heman naupasalhai chu Jehuel le Simei; Jeduthun naupasalhai chu; Semaia le Uzziel hai chu.

en: And they gathered their brethren, and sanctified themselves, and went in, according to the commandment of the king by the words of Jehovah, to cleanse the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, an unauhai chu an ko khâwm a, anni chu an insukthieng a, LALPA in chu sukfai dingin LALPA thuin lal thupêk ang tak chun an lût tah a.

en: And the priests went in unto the inner part of the house of Jehovah, to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of Jehovah into the court of the house of Jehovah. And the Levites took it, to carry it out abroad to the brook Kidron.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chu LALPA in sûngril lema chun sukfai ding chun an va lût a, LALPA biek in sûnga thil inthiengnaw an hmu po pohai chu LALPA in inhuonna tuol laia chun an hung lâk suok vawng a. Chun, Levi mihai chun Kidron vadung chena lâk hmang dingin an lâk tah a.

en: Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of Jehovah; and they sanctified the house of Jehovah in eight days: and on the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.
hmr: Chuong chun, thla khatna ni khatnaa chun inhlân thieng chu an ṭan a, chu thla ni riet ni chun LALPA tuolpûka chun an hung tlung a; chuongchun, LALPA in po po chu ni riet sûng chun an inhlân thieng a; thla hmasatak ni sâwmparuk ni chun an zo tah a.

en: Then they went in to Hezekiah the king within the palace, and said, We have cleansed all the house of Jehovah, and the altar of burnt-offering, with all the vessels thereof, and the table of showbread, with all the vessels thereof.
hmr: Chun, lal inah lal Hezekia kuoma chun an hung a, “LALPA in po po, pumrawhmang thilinhlânna mâichâm le chutaka a bûr le bêlhai po po leh, entirna bei siena dawkân le chutaka a bûr le bêlhai po po leh, kan sukthieng vawng tah a.

en: Moreover all the vessels, which king Ahaz in his reign did cast away when he trespassed, have we prepared and sanctified; and, behold, they are before the altar of Jehovah.
hmr: Chunawa chun, bûr le bêl po po, Ahaz rorêl laia a bawsiet laia a dêhâwn po pohai kha kan buotsai a, kan inhlân thieng ta bawk a; ngai ta, tuhin LALPA mâichâm hmaa chun an um a nih,” an ta.

en: Then Hezekiah the king arose early, and gathered the princes of the city, and went up to the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, lal Hezekia chu in- hmatakin a tho vak a, khuoa hotuhai chu a ko khâwm a; LALPA ina chun a hang fe tah a.

en: And they brought seven bullocks, and seven rams, and seven lambs, and seven he-goats, for a sin-offering for the kingdom and for the sanctuary and for Judah. And he commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, bâwngchal pasari, be- râmchal pasari, berâmte pasari le, kêlchal pasari Juda mihai le hmun inthieng le ram ta dinga suol thilin- hlân dingin an hung lâk a. Chuong- chun, Aron naupasal thiempuhai chu LALPA mâichâm chunga chuonghai chu inhlân dingin thu a pêk a.

en: So they killed the bullocks, and the priests received the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar: and they killed the rams, and sprinkled the blood upon the altar: they killed also the lambs, and sprinkled the blood upon the altar.
hmr: Chuongchun, bâwngchalhai chu an hang that a, thiempuhai chun a thisen chu an indawh a; mâichâm chunga chun an theh a; berâmchal khawm chu an that a, a thisen chu mâichâm chunga chun an theh a; berâmtehai khawm chu an that a, a thisen chu mâichâm chunga chun an theh a.

en: And they brought near the he-goats for the sin-offering before the king and the assembly; and they laid their hands upon them:
hmr: Chun, lal le mipuihai hmaa chun suol thilinhlâna dingin kêlchal- hai chu an hung lâk hnai a; an kuthai chu an chunga chun an in nghat a;

en: and the priests killed them, and they made a sin-offering with their blood upon the altar, to make atonement for all Israel; for the king commanded that the burnt-offering and the sin-offering should be made for all Israel.
hmr: thiempuhai chun an that a, an thisen chun mâichâm chunga chun suol thilinhlân chu an inhlân tah a, Israel mi po po ta dinga intlanna siempêk dingin pumrawhmang thil- inhlân le suol thilinhlân chu Israel mi po po ta dinga thaw ding a nih tiin lal chun thu a lo pêk ta sih a.

en: And he set the Levites in the house of Jehovah with cymbals, with psalteries, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, and of Gad the king’s seer, and Nathan the prophet; for the commandment was of Jehovah by his prophets.
hmr: Chun, zâwlnei Nathan hai, lal zâwlnei Gad hai le David thupêk ang tak khan Levi mihai chu LALPA ina chun dârbenthekhai leh, perkhuong- hai leh, ṭingṭanghai leh ân umtir a; thupêkhai chu a zâwlneihai hmanga LALPA pêk a ni sih a.

en: And the Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.
