hmr: Chun, Levi mihai chu David thil rimawi siemhai le chun an ngîr a, thiempuhai chu tawtawrâwthai leh.

en: And Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt-offering upon the altar. And when the burnt-offering began, the song of Jehovah began also, and the trumpets, together with the instruments of David king of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Hezekia chun pumraw- hmang thilinhlân chu mâichâm chunga chun inhlân dingin thu a pêk a. Chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlân chu ṭan a ni ruol chun, LALPA hlahai, tawtawrâwthai, Israel lal David thil rimawi siemhai le chun ṭan an ni ve vawng tah a.

en: And all the assembly worshipped, and the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded; all this continued until the burnt-offering was finished.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po chun Pathien chibai an bûk a, hlasaktuhaiin an sak a, tawtawrâwt puhai chun an mût a; chuong po po chu pumrawhmang thilinhlân chu zo a ni hmakhat chu thaw zing a na.

en: And when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that were present with him bowed themselves and worshipped.
hmr: Thilinhlân chu an suktâwp chun lal le a kâwla mihai po po chu an kûn a, chibai an bûk a.

en: Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praises unto Jehovah with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. And they sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshipped.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm lal Hezekia le hotuhai chun Levi mihai chu Zâwlnei Asaph le David hla phuok chun LALPA inpâkna chu sak dingin thu an pêk bawk a. Chun, lâwmtakin inpâkna hla chu an sak a, an luhai an kûn a, chibai an bûk a.

en: Then Hezekiah answered and said, Now ye have consecrated yourselves unto Jehovah; come near and bring sacrifices and thank-offerings into the house of Jehovah. And the assembly brought in sacrifices and thank-offerings; and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt-offerings.
hmr: Chun, Hezekia chun a dawn a, “Tuhin chu LALPA kuoma chun in inpêk tah a, hung hnai unla, lâwmna thilinhlânhai le inthâwinahai chu LALPA ina chun hung inhlân ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, mipuihai le inthâwi- nahai chu an hung inhlân a; chun, mi a nuom zât zât chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân khawm chu an hung lâk bawk a.

en: And the number of the burnt-offerings which the assembly brought was threescore and ten bullocks, a hundred rams, and two hundred lambs: all these were for a burnt-offering to Jehovah.
hmr: Mipuiin pumrawhmang thilin- hlân an hung lâk zât chu bâwngchal sâwmsari, berâmchal za khat, berâmte za hni an na; hienghai po po hi LALPA kuoma pumrawhmang thilinhlân dinga pêk an nih.

en: And the consecrated things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.
hmr: Chun, thil a pêka pumpêk chu bâwngchal za ruk le berâm sâng thum an nih.

en: But the priests were too few, so that they could not flay all the burnt-offerings: wherefore their brethren the Levites did help them, till the work was ended, and until the priests had sanctified themselves; for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thiempuhai chu an tlâwm leiin pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai po po chu an inhlip hman nawh a, chuleiin, an unau Levi mihai chun sin chu zo fel a ni vawng chenin, anni thiempuhai an inthien chen chu an ṭhangpui tâwl a. (Levi mihai chu thiempuhai nêk chun inthien dingin lungrila chun an khermei lem sih a.)

en: And also the burnt-offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace-offerings, and with the drink-offerings for every burnt-offering. So the service of the house of Jehovah was set in order.
hmr: Pumrawhmang thilinhlân tam tâwktak bâka chun inremna thilin- hlân thâuhai le pumrawhmang thilinhlân poa dâwnmi thilinhlânhai an um bawk a. Chuongchun, LALPA ina rawngbâwlna chu ân dawt peia siem fel chu a ni tah a.

en: And Hezekiah rejoiced, and all the people, because of that which God had prepared for the people: for the thing was done suddenly.
hmr: Chun, chuong mipuihai ta dinga Pathienin thil a buotsai ta leiin Hezekia le mipuihai khawm chu an hlim tah a; chuong thil chu inhmaw thuta thaw a ni sih a.

en: Then Solomon began to build the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem on mount Moriah, where Jehovah appeared unto David his father, which he made ready in the place that David had appointed, in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun Moria tlânga a pa David kuoma LALPA chu ân lâr a, Davidin a lo buotsaina hmun, Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla a lo thlangna hmun Jerusalema chun LALPA in bâwl chu a ṭan tah a.

en: And he began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
hmr: A rorêl a kum lina, a thla hnina, a ni hninaa chun a bâwl ṭan a.

en: Now these are the foundations which Solomon laid for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.
hmr: Pathien in bâwlna dinga Solo- monin a lungphûm a phûmhai chu hienghai hi an nih: a dungtieng chu tawnga inkhiin inkhina hmasa dâna chun tawng sâwmruk a na, a khang- tieng chu tawng sâwmhni a nih.

en: And the porch that was before the house, the length of it, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits, and the height a hundred and twenty; and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
hmr: Chun, a tuolpûk inpui hmaa mi chu, a dung chu a in khangtieng chen chie, tawng sâwmhni a na, ân sâng- tieng chu tawng za le sâwmhni a na, a sûng chu rângkachak inthiengin ân luon khum a.

en: And the greater house he ceiled with fir-wood, which he overlaid with fine gold, and wrought thereon palm-trees and chains.
hmr: A in lien lem chu fâr thingin ân khum a, rângkachak inthiengin ân luon khum a, a chunga chun intûm thinghai le khaidiet limhai a siem a.

en: And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.
hmr: Mawina dingin in chu lunghlu- haiin a cheimawi a, a rângkachakhai khawm chu Parvaim rângkachak an nih.

en: He overlaid also the house, the beams, the thresholds, and the walls thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubim on the walls.
hmr: Chutaka a kawtkhârhai, chutaka banghai le kalhai le ṭuong le chu in chu rângkachakin ân luon khum bawk a; bangahai chun cherub limhai a ker bawk a.

en: And he made the most holy house: the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits; and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthieng tak chu a siem bawk a; chu a dungtieng chu a inpui khangtieng ang chiein, tawng sâwmhni a na; a khang khawm chu tawng sâwmhni bawk a nih; chun, rângkachak inthieng talent za ruk laiin ân luon khum bawk a.

en: And the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
hmr: Chun, a kilna rikzie chu râng- kachak shekel sâwmnga tluk a nih. A pindan chunghnunghai chu rângka- chakin ân luon khum a.

en: And in the most holy house he made two cherubim of image work; and they overlaid them with gold.
hmr: In inthiengtaka chun cherub pa- hni a lima cherin a siem a; chuonghai chu rângkachakin ân luon khum a.

en: And the wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long: the wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
hmr: Cherubhai thla chu tawng sâwmhnia sei a na; cherub pakhat thla chu, a in bang va sukin tawng nga a na, a thla khing tieng chu tawng nga bawk a na; cherub dang thla kha a va suk a.

en: And the wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
hmr: Chun, cherub pakhat dang thla khawm chu bang va tâwkin tawng nga a na, a thla dang pakhat chun cherub thla dang kha va zawmin tawng nga a ni ve bawk a.

en: The wings of these cherubim spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces were toward the house.
hmr: Chuongchun, hieng cherub thlahai hin tawng sâwmhni chu an zârhlie a; an kehaiin an ngîr a; an hmaihai chu insûng tieng chu an nghah a.

en: And he made the veil of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubim thereon.
hmr: Chun, puonzâr dumpâwl le a senêm le, a senduk le puon zai inhmi a siem a, a chunga chun cherubhai ân chuon bawk a.

en: Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
hmr: Chun, in hmatienga chun sût- pui pahni tawng sâwmthum pangaa insâng ve ve a siem a, chuong a lêr- tâwpa a hmawrbâwkhai chu tawng nga ve ve an ni bawk a.

en: And he made chains in the oracle, and put them on the tops of the pillars; and he made a hundred pomegranates, and put them on the chains.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthienga chun khaidiethai a siem a, chuong sût- puihai lêra chun a thlung a; chun, theibufai za khat a siem bawk a, chuong chu khaidieta chun a khai tâwl a.

en: And he set up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.
hmr: Biekin tuola chun chuong sût- puihai chu a phun a, pakhat chu changtieng, a dang chu vawitieng; chun, chu changtienga mi chu a hmingah Jakin ân bûk a, vawitienga mi chu a hmingah Boaz ân bûk bawk a.

en: And Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of Jehovah at Jerusalem, to keep the passover unto Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Hezekia chun Israel Pathien LALPA fekân ruoiṭhe chu hmang dingin Jerusalema LALPA ina chun in hung ding a nih tiin Israel le Juda mihai po po kuomah mi a tir a, chun, Manasse le Ephraim mihai kuoma khawm lekha a ziek bawk a.

en: For the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the assembly in Jerusalem, to keep the passover in the second month.
hmr: Chun, thla hninaa fekân ruoiṭhe chu nei dingin Lal le a miṭhahai le Jerusalema mipui inkhâwmhai po po le chun an rawt a.

en: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves in sufficient number, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
hmr: A hun pângngaia chun nei khawm an nei thei naw hrim a, thiempuhai chu a tam huntâwkin an inthien thei nawh; mipuihai chu Jerusalema chun an hung khâwm bawk naw leiin.

en: And the thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.
hmr: Chun, chu thil chu lal le mipuihai ngaia chun ân dik a.

en: So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beer-sheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the passover unto Jehovah, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem: for they had not kept it in great numbers in such sort as it is written.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel Pathien LALPA fekân ruoiṭhe chu hmang dingin Jerusalemah an hung ding a nih tiin, Israel ram po po Beer-sebaa inthawka Dan chenin thupuong siem dingin thupêk ân suoh a; ziek a ni angin, chuong anga tam chun an la hmang ngai si nawh a.

en: So the posts went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, Ye children of Israel, turn again unto Jehovah, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, that he may return to the remnant that are escaped of you out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
hmr: Chuongchun, dâkpuhai chu lal thupêk ang takin lal le a hotuhaia inthawk chun lekhahai chawiin Juda le Israel ram sûng po poa chun an fe tah a; “Nangni Israel thlahai, nangni Assuria lalhai kuta inthawk a suokdawkhai a la um sun- hai tieng hi a hung ngha kîr theina dingin, Israel le, Isaak le Abraham Pathien, LALPA tieng chu hung ngha nâwk ro.

en: And be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, who trespassed against Jehovah, the God of their fathers, so that he gave them up to desolation, as ye see.
hmr: Nangni chu in thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chunga bawsetu inthlatuhai le in unauhai ang kha chu ni naw unla, chuong lei chun sietnaah anni chu a pêk suok tah a ni kha in hmuh a.

en: Now be ye not stiffnecked, as your fathers were; but yield yourselves unto Jehovah, and enter into his sanctuary, which he hath sanctified for ever, and serve Jehovah your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you.
hmr: In thlatuhai an ni angin mi kâwmâwhai ni naw unla; nangni chu LALPA kuomah inpe lem ro; kum- khuoa dinga sukthieng tah, a hmun inthienga chun lût unla, nangnia inthawka a lungsenna ṭiumtak chu ân kieng theina dingin LALPA in Pathien rawng chu bâwl ro.

en: For if ye turn again unto Jehovah, your brethren and your children shall find compassion before them that led them captive, and shall come again into this land: for Jehovah your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn away his face from you, if ye return unto him.
hmr: LALPA kuom tieng in nghakîr nâwk chun, in unauhai le in thlahaiin sala ṭhuoituhai hmaa chun lungin- sietna dawng an ta, hi rama hin hung nâwk an tih, ama kuomah in kîr phawt chun LALPA in Pathien ngilneitak le zângai theitak a na, nghatsan naw ni cheu,” tiin.

en: So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even unto Zebulun: but they laughed them to scorn, and mocked them.
hmr: Chun, dâkpuhai chu khaw tina Ephraim le Manasse ram sûng po po Zebulun chenin an fe pei a; amiruok- chu, hmusitin an lo nuisan a, an lo nuiêu a.

en: Nevertheless certain men of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Aser le Manas- se le Zebulun hnama mi ṭhenkhat chu an insukhnuoi a, Jerusalema chun an hung a.

en: Also upon Judah came the hand of God to give them one heart, to do the commandment of the king and of the princes by the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Juda rama khawm chun LALPA thua hotuhai le lal thupêk ang chu thaw dingin inthuruolna Pathienin a pêk a.

en: And there assembled at Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.
hmr: Chun, a thla hninaa chun, mi- pui nasatak el chu, chawlṭhanglo bei ruoiṭhe chu hmang dingin Jerusalema chun an inkhâwm tah a.

en: And they arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars for incense took they away, and cast them into the brook Kidron.
hmr: Chun, an tho a, Jerusalema mâichâm umhai le, riminhnik râwna mâichâmhai po po chu an lâk a, Kidron vadungtêa chun an pei tah a.

en: Then they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the second month: and the priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought burnt-offerings into the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, a thla hnina ni sâwm- palinaa chun fekân ruoiṭhena ding chu an that a; thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu an inzak a, anni chu an inhlân thieng a. LALPA ina chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân chu an hung lâk lût tah a.

en: And they stood in their place after their order, according to the law of Moses the man of God: the priests sprinkled the blood which they received of the hand of the Levites.
hmr: Pathien mi Mosie dân ang peiin an indawtzie ang peiin an hmuna chun an ngîr a; thiempuhai chun thisen Levi mihai kuta inthawka an hmuhai chu an theh a.

en: For there were many in the assembly that had not sanctified themselves: therefore the Levites had the charge of killing the passovers for every one that was not clean, to sanctify them unto Jehovah.
hmr: Mipui inkhâwmna laia chun mâni insukthieng lo mi tamtak chu an um sih a; chuleiin, Levi mihai chun, LALPA kuoma anni chu in- hlânthieng dingin ân thieng nawhai taphawt fekân ruoiṭhena ding an thatpêk a.

en: For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet did they eat the passover otherwise than it is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, The good Jehovah pardon every one
hmr: Mipui tamtak elhai, Ephraim le Manasse le Issakar le Zebulun mi tamtak elhai chu insukthieng lo an na, ziek a ni ang tho khan fekân ruoiṭhe chu an fâk a. Hezekia chun a lo ṭawngṭai pêk tah a, “LALPA ṭha chun ngaidam raw se, tukhawm

en: that setteth his heart to seek God, Jehovah, the God of his fathers, though he be not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.
hmr: hmun inthieng inthien dân anga, thieng lo khawm ni sienla, Pathien, a thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu zawng dinga a lungril a lo innghat ta phawt chu,” tiin.

en: And Jehovah hearkened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Hezekia ṭawngṭaina chu a lo ngai a, mipuihai khawm chu a lo sukdam tah a.

en: And the children of Israel that were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness; and the Levites and the priests praised Jehovah day by day, singing with loud instruments unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai Jerusalem- a umhai chun chawlṭhanglo bei ruoiṭhe chu ni sari sûng lâwmtakin an hmang tah a, chun, thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu ni tin tinin LALPA kuoma thil sutrîktheihaia hlasakin LALPA chu an inpâk a.

en: And Hezekiah spake comfortably unto all the Levites that had good understanding in the service of Jehovah. So they did eat throughout the feast for the seven days, offering sacrifices of peace-offerings, and making confession to Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: LALPA rawngbâwlna sina thiemtaka thaw Levi mihai kuoma chun Hezekia chun thlamuonna thu a hril a. Chuongchun, ni sari sûng chu inremna thilinhlânhai chu inhlânin le, LALPA an thlatuhai Pathien kuoma chun thupha chawina siemin, ruoiṭhe sûng po po chun an fâk a.

en: And the whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days; and they kept other seven days with gladness.
hmr: Chun, mipui inkhâwmhai po po chun ni dang la hmang nâwk dingin an remti a, ni sari dang chu lâwm- takin an la hmang nâwk a.

en: For Hezekiah king of Judah did give to the assembly for offerings a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the assembly a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.
hmr: Juda ram lal Hezekia chun mipui inkhâwmhai chu inhlân dingin bâwngchal sâng khat le, berâm sâng sari a pêk a; chun, hotuhai chun mipuihai chu bâwngchal sâng khat le berâm sîng khat an pêk bawk a, thiempu tam tawk tak el chu an insukthieng bawk a.

en: And all the assembly of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the assembly that came out of Israel, and the sojourners that came out of the land of Israel, and that dwelt in Judah, rejoiced.
hmr: Chun, Juda mipuihai po po, thiempuhai leh, Levi mihai leh, Israel rama inthawka mipui hunghai po po leh, Israel rama inthawka mikhuol hunghai po po leh, Juda rama umhai le chun an hlim hle tâwl a.

en: So there was great joy in Jerusalem; for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was not the like in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jerusalema chun nasataka hlimna a um a, Israel lal David naupa Solomon hun china khan chu chuong ang chu Jerusalem- ah a um ngai nawh a.

en: Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy habitation, even unto heaven.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai, Levi mihai chu an tho a, mipuihai chu mal an sâwmpêk a; an râwlhai chu hrietin a um a, an ṭawngṭainahai chu a umna inthieng vâna chun a hang tlung a.

en: Now when all this was finished, all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah, and brake in pieces the pillars, and hewed down the Asherim, and brake down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, in Ephraim also and Manasseh, until they had destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.
hmr: Chun, hieng thil po po hi zo a ni hnung chun, Israel chutaka umhai po po chu Juda khawpuiahai chun an feh a, lungphunhai chu an suknâwi a, Asera chu an phûrthlûk a; Benjamin le Juda ram po poa bâwl- hmunhai le mâichâmhai chu an vuok chim vawng a; Ephraim le Manasse rama khawm, a rênga an suksiet vawng hmakhat chun an thaw pei a. Chu, Israel thlahai chu, mi tin mâni hmun nei sengah, mâni khawpui sengah an kîr tah a.

en: And Hezekiah appointed the courses of the priests and the Levites after their courses, every man according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt-offerings and for peace-offerings, to minister, and to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the camp of Jehovah.
hmr: Hezekia chun an pâwlhai ang peiin thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu an pâwl a ruotpêk a; mi tin an sin- thaw ang peiin, thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu LALPA bûk dai kawtkhâr- haia inpâk a, lâwmthu hril a, rawngbâwl a, inremna thilinhlânhai le pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai chu thaw dingin.

en: He appointed also the king’s portion of his substance for the burnt-offerings, to wit, for the morning and evening burnt-offerings, and the burnt-offerings for the sabbaths, and for the new moons, and for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilin- hlâna lal chan ding khawm ran a ruot a, anih, LALPA dâna ziek anga zîng- tieng le zântienga pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai le, châwlnia pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhaia le, thla tharhaia le, ruoiṭhe hunbi neihaia ding chun.

en: Moreover he commanded the people that dwelt in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might give themselves to the law of Jehovah.
hmr: Chunawa khawm, LALPA dâna an hrât theina dingin Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu an chan chu pe ve dingin Jerusalema umhai chu thu a pêk bawk a.

en: And as soon as the commandment came abroad, the children of Israel gave in abundance the first-fruits of grain, new wine, and oil, and honey, and of all the increase of the field; and the tithe of all things brought they in abundantly.
hmr: Thupêk chu phuongdar a ni phing le chun Israel thlahai chun bu dâm, uoin dâm, khuoizu dâm le lo hmasuok po poa ra hmasatakhai chu tamtak el an hungpêk tâwl a; thil po poa sâwma pakhat khawm tamtak el an hung pêk tâwl a.

en: And the children of Israel and Judah, that dwelt in the cities of Judah, they also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep, and the tithe of dedicated things which were consecrated unto Jehovah their God, and laid them by heaps.
hmr: Juda ram khawpuihaia um Juda le Israel thlahai chun bâwng le berâmhaia sâwma pakhat dâm, an Pathien LALPA kuoma thilinhlân sukthieng tahai dâm chu an hung chawi a, a bûm bûmin an hung sieh a.

en: In the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps, and finished them in the seventh month.
hmr: Thla thumnaa chun thil sie- khâwm chu an ṭan a, thla sarinaa chun an zo tah a.

en: And when Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed Jehovah, and his people Israel.
hmr: Chun, Hezekia le hotuhai chu an hung a, thil siekhâwmhai chu an hmu chun LALPA le a mi Israelhai chu an inpâk a.

en: Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
hmr: Hezekia chun Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu thil siekhâwm chungthu chu ân dawn a.

en: And Azariah the chief priest, of the house of Zadok, answered him and said, Since the people began to bring the oblations into the house of Jehovah, we have eaten and had enough, and have left plenty: for Jehovah hath blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.
hmr: Zadok sûngkuoa mi, thiempu laltak Azaria chun a dawn a, “Mipui haiin LALPA ina an thilpêkhai an hung chawi china chun kan fâkin a huntâwk kan nei tah a; a chuong tamtak hman kan nei rau a; LALPA chun a mihai chu mal a sâwm sih a, hi siekhâwm nasatak hi kan fâk mahla chu a ni hi,” an ta.

en: Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of Jehovah; and they prepared them;
hmr: Chun, Hezekia chun LALPA ina chun, pindanhai buotsai dingin thu a pêk tah a; chun, an buotsai tah a.

en: and they brought in the oblations and the tithes and the dedicated things faithfully. And over them Conaniah the Levite was ruler, and Shimei his brother was second;
hmr: Chun, thilpêkhai, sâwma pa- khat pêkhai, thilinhlânhai chu ringumtakin an hung lâk a; chu chunga chun Levi mi Konania chu a rorêltu a nih; a unaupa Simei chu a dawttu a na.

en: and Jehiel, and Azaziah, and Nahath, and Asahel, and Jerimoth, and Jozabad, and Eliel, and Ismachiah, and Mahath, and Benaiah, were overseers under the hand of Conaniah and Shimei his brother, by the appointment of Hezekiah the king, and Azariah the ruler of the house of God.
hmr: Chun, Jehiel, Azazia, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismakia, Mahath le Benaia chu, Pathien in rorêltu Azaria le lal Hezekia ruotin, Konania le a unaupa Simei hnuoia enkawltuhai an nih.

en: And Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the porter at the east gate, was over the freewill-offerings of God, to distribute the oblations of Jehovah, and the most holy things.
hmr: Chun, saktieng dâi kawtkhâr vêngtu Levi mi Imna naupa Kore chu thil inthiengtakhai le, LALPA kuoma thilpêkhai chu sem dinga, Pathien kuoma mâni nuomthua thilinhlânhai chunga hotu a nih.

en: And under him were Eden, and Miniamin, and Jeshua, and Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, in the cities of the priests, in their office of trust, to give to their brethren by courses, as well to the great as to the small:
hmr: Ama hnuoia chun Eden, Miniamin, Jesua, Semaia, Amaria le Sekania hai, thiempuhai khawpui- haia an sin ruotahai chun, an unau- hai chu, a chîn le lien kuoma an chan chit chu sem dingin an um bawk a;

en: besides them that were reckoned by genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even every one that entered into the house of Jehovah, as the duty of every day required, for their service in their offices according to their courses;
hmr: pasal tienga inthla dâna suiin, kum thuma upa chin chung tienga mi, LALPA ina lût taphawt elhai kha, an pâwl ang peia an rawngbâwlnaa an sin chan an ni tin chan ang pei a fe hlakhai tiem loin;

en: and them that were reckoned by genealogy of the priests by their fathers’ houses, and the Levites from twenty years old and upward, in their offices by their courses;
hmr: Levi mihai le an pahnam ang pei a, thiempuhai inthla sâwng dâna kum sâwmhni le a chungtieng mi po po an pâwla an chan ang chun an ruot a;

en: and them that were reckoned by genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their office of trust they sanctified themselves in holiness.
hmr: chun, thiempuhai chu, an nau le têhai inthla sâwng dânah, an nu- hmeihai, an naupasalhai, an naunu- hmeihai mipui laia po po chun, an rawngbâwlna dinga ruot senga chun inthiengna dingin an inhlânthieng tâwl a;

en: Also for the sons of Aaron the priests, that were in the fields of the suburbs of their cities, in every city, there were men that were mentioned by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests, and to all that were reckoned by genealogy among the Levites.
hmr: thiempu Aron naupasalhai an khawpuihai khaw hmawr phûla umhai khawm chun, khawpui tamtak elahai chun, Levi mihai laia inthla dâna tiem sa po pohai le thiempuhai laia pasal po pohai kuoma an chanhai sempêk dingin, an hming suota ruot an um bawk a.

en: And thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah; and he wrought that which was good and right and faithful before Jehovah his God.
hmr: Chuong ang tak chun lal Hezekia chun Juda ram sûng po poa chun a thaw suok vawng a; a Pathien LALPA hmaa ringumna le, thil indik le thil ṭha chu a thaw tah a.

en: And in every work that he began in the service of the house of God, and in the law, and in the commandments, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart, and prospered.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ina rawngbâwlna sin a thaw tinrênga le, dâna le, thu- pêkahai chun, a Pathien chu zawng dingin lungril po poin a thaw hlak a; a hlawtling ngei a.

en: After these things, and this faithfulness, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fortified cities, and thought to win them for himself.
hmr: Hi ringumna le hieng thilhai thaw a ni hnunga hin Assuria lal Sennakerib chu a hung a; Juda ram a hung lût a, khawpui kulneihai chu ân huol a, ama ta dinga hne el dingin a ngaituoh a.

en: And when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib was come, and that he was purposed to fight against Jerusalem,
hmr: Chun, Hezekia chun Sennakerib chu a hung a, Jerusalem hung do a tum a nih ti a hriet chun,

en: he took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the fountains which were without the city; and they helped him.
hmr: khawpui puotienga tuikhur tui- hai chu hrukping dingin a mi thilthawtheihai le a upahai chu a rawn tah a; chun, ama chu an ṭhangpui tah a.

en: So there was gathered much people together, and they stopped all the fountains, and the brook that flowed through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui nasatak el chu an pung tah a; tuikhur po po le, ram laia tui luong vadungtêhai po po chu an hrukping ta vawng a, “Ieng- dingin am Assuria lal chu hungin, tui tamtak hung nei el a ta?” an tih a.

en: And he took courage, and built up all the wall that was broken down, and raised it up to the towers, and the other wall without, and strengthened Millo in the city of David, and made weapons and shields in abundance.
hmr: Chun, ân sukhuoi a, kul se tahai po po chu a siem ṭha a; chutaka chun kuldâi danghai le râl vêngbûkhai chu a bâwl bawk a; chun, David khawpuia Millo chu a sukdet a, hriemhai le phawhai chu tamtakin a siem a.

en: And he set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the broad place at the gate of the city, and spake comfortably to them, saying,
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chunga chun indona hotuhai chu a ruot a, khawpui dâi kawtkhâr bula hmun âwl liena chun ama kuomah a ko khâwm tâwl a; an kuoma chun thlamuongumtakin thu a hril a,

en: Be strong and of good courage, be not afraid nor dismayed for the king of Assyria, nor for all the multitude that is with him; for there is a greater with us than with him:
hmr: “Hrât unla, insukhuoi ro, Assuria lal lei chun ṭi naw unla, beidawng bawk naw ro; ama kuoma um mipui nasatakhai lei khawm chun, ama kuoma um nêk chun eini kuoma um chu a hrât lem sih a;

en: with him is an arm of flesh; but with us is Jehovah our God to help us, and to fight our battles. And the people rested themselves upon the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
hmr: ama kuoma chun tisaa sipai pâwl an na, amiruokchu, eini kuoma chu LALPA ei Pathien chu mi ṭhangpui ding le ei indona chu do dingin a um a nih,” tiin. Chun, mipui chu Juda lal Hezekia thuhrila chun an sâwldam hle a.

en: After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem (now he was before Lachish, and all his power with him), unto Hezekiah king of Judah, and unto all Judah that were at Jerusalem, saying,
hmr: Hi hnunga hin Assuria lal Sen- nakerib chun Jerusalemah a siehlaw a hung tir a (ama chu Lakis tlung hma el khan a um a, a sipaihai po po khawm ama kuoma chun an um a) Juda lal Hezekia le Jerusalema Juda umhai po po kuoma chun a hung tir a.

en: Thus saith Sennacherib king of Assyria, Whereon do ye trust, that ye abide the siege in Jerusalem?
hmr: “Assuria lal Sennakerib chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Jerusalem lâk chu ieng am a na in ring nawna?

en: Doth not Hezekiah persuade you, to give you over to die by famine and by thirst, saying, Jehovah our God will deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
hmr: Hezekia hin, Assuria lal kuta inthawk chun LALPA ei Pathien chun mi sansuok a tih, tiin dangchâr le ṭâma inthitir el ding cheuin a thlêm- thlûk cheu a ni naw am a nih?

en: Hath not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship before one altar, and upon it shall ye burn incense?
hmr: Hi Hezekia bawk hin bâwl- hmunhai le mâichâmhai chu a lâk- hmangin, Juda ram le Jerusalema mihai chu, Mâichâm pakhat hmaa chun Pathien chibai bûk in ta, a chunga chun riminhnik khawm in raw ding a nih, tia thu pe kha?

en: Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the peoples of the lands? Were the gods of the nations of the lands in any wise able to deliver their land out of my hand?
hmr: Kei le ka thlatuhai chun ram tin, hnam tin chunga chun ieng angin am kan thaw hlaka ti in hriet naw am a nih? Hieng ramhaia hnamhai pathienhai hin ka kuta inthawkin an ram ieng kawng khawmin an sanhim thei hlak am a nih?

en: Who was there among all the gods of those nations which my fathers utterly destroyed, that could deliver his people out of my hand, that your God should be able to deliver you out of my hand?
hmr: Ka puhaiin an lo sukbohmang letdêr ta hnamhai pathien po po lai chun tu am ka kuta inthawka a mi- hai sansuok thei ding a um a, in Pathien khawm chun ka kuta in- thawkin a sansuok theina bîk ding cheu chu?

en: Now therefore let not Hezekiah deceive you, nor persuade you after this manner, neither believe ye him; for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people out of my hand, and out of the hand of my fathers: how much less shall your God deliver you out of my hand?
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin Hezekia hin hlêm naw raw se cheu, hieng ang kawng hin thlêmthlu bawk naw raw se cheu, nangni khawma ring hrim hrim naw ro; ka thlatuhai le keima kuta inthawk hin, tu ram amanih, tu hnam amani pathien chun a mihai chu a sansuok thei hrim hrim ngai si nawh a; ka kuta inthawk hin in Pathien chun a va sansuok thei âwm naw cheu deh aw!’” tiin.

en: And his servants spake yet more against Jehovah God, and against his servant Hezekiah.
hmr: Chun, a siehlawhai chun LAL- PA Pathien chunga le a siehlaw Hezekia chunga chun hi nêk hman hin an la hril siet nasa det lem a.

en: He wrote also letters, to rail on Jehovah, the God of Israel, and to speak against him, saying, As the gods of the nations of the lands, which have not delivered their people out of my hand, so shall not the God of Hezekiah deliver his people out of my hand.
hmr: Israel Pathien LALPA chu hrilse dingin lekha a ziek a, ama kal zâwnga thu hril dingin, “Ram tina hnam tin pathienhai chun ka kuta inthawk hin an mihai an sansuok ngai naw angin, Hezekia Pathien khawm hin ka kuta inthawkin a mihai chu sansuok bîk naw nih,” tiin.

en: And they cried with a loud voice in the Jews’ language unto the people of Jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.
hmr: Chun, khawpui chu an lâk el theina dingin Jerusalema mi umhai, kula umhai chu suklâu ding le, sukbuoi dingin Juda ṭawngin râwl inringtakin an khêk khum a.

en: And they spake of the God of Jerusalem, as of the gods of the peoples of the earth, which are the work of men’s hands.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema Pathien chu hnuoia hnamhai pathienhai, mi- hriem kutsuokhai anga chun an hril a.

en: And Hezekiah the king, and Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz, prayed because of this, and cried to heaven.
hmr: Chun, lal Hezekia le Amoz naupa zâwlnei Isai chu hi thu lei hin an ṭawngṭai a, vân tieng nghain an khêk a.

en: And Jehovah sent an angel, who cut off all the mighty men of valor, and the leaders and captains, in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. And when he was come into the house of his god, they that came forth from his own bowels slew him there with the sword.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun vântirko a hung tir a, ama chun Assuria lal riebûka mi hrât khawkhênghai po po le ṭhuoituhai le hotuhai po po chu a sukhlum a. Chuongchun, hmai thûm- takin a ramah a kîr nâwk tah a. Chun, ama chu a pathien ina a hung lût laiin ama rîla rasuokhai ngei chun chutaka chun kâwlhnâmin an that tah a.

en: Thus Jehovah saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all others, and guided them on every side.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Hezekia le Jerusalema umhai chu Assuria lal Sennakerib le mi danghai kuta inthawk chun a sanhim tah a, an vêla mihaia inthawk chun a vêng a.

en: And many brought gifts unto Jehovah to Jerusalem, and precious things to Hezekiah king of Judah; so that he was exalted in the sight of all nations from thenceforth.
hmr: Chun, mi tamtak chun Jerusa- lemah LALPA kuomah thilpêkhai le, Juda lal Hezekia kuomah thil hluhai an hung chawi a; chuongchun, chutaka inthawk chun hnam po pohai mithmua chun chawimawiin a um tah a.

en: In those days Hezekiah was sick even unto death: and he prayed unto Jehovah; and he spake unto him, and gave him a sign.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Hezekia chu thi ngamin a na tah a, chun LALPA kuomah a ṭawngṭai a; chun, ama kuoma chun thu a hung hril a, in- chikna a hung pêk a.

en: But Hezekiah rendered not again according to the benefit done unto him; for his heart was lifted up: therefore there was wrath upon him, and upon Judah and Jerusalem.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chunga ditsakna thaw ang huin Hezekia chun a ngaisak nâwk ta nawh a; a lungril chu ân ngaisâng sih a; chulei- chun, ama chunga chun lunginsenna chu a um a, Jerusalem le Juda ram chunga khawm chun.

en: Notwithstanding Hezekiah humbled himself for the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of Jehovah came not upon them in the days of Hezekiah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Hezekia chun a lungril chapona chu ân sîr nâwk a, ân sukhnuoi a; ama le Jerusalema um- hai le chun; chuongchun, Hezekia dam sûng khan chu LALPA lungin- senna an chungah a hung tlung ta nawh a.

en: And Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honor: and he provided him treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of goodly vessels;
hmr: Hezekia chun ropuina le hausakna nasatak el chu a nei a; tangka dâm, rângkachak dâm, lung mantam dâm, riminhnik dâm, phaw- hai dâm, bûr le bêl ṭha tinrênghai ta dingin siekhâwmna inhai ama ta dingin a siem a;

en: store-houses also for the increase of grain and new wine and oil; and stalls for all manner of beasts, and flocks in folds.
hmr: hriek le uoin le bu hung punghai dinga siekhâwmna inhai dâm, ran ruolhai ta dinga inhai le, sa chi tinrêng po po ta dinga inhai a siem bawk a.

en: Moreover he provided him cities, and possessions of flocks and herds in abundance; for God had given him very much substance.
hmr: Chunawa khawm chun bâwng ruol dâm, berâm ruol dâm, khaw- puihai dâm tamtak el a nei bawk a, Pathien chun thil tamtak el ama chu a pêk sih a.

en: This same Hezekiah also stopped the upper spring of the waters of Gihon, and brought them straight down on the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all his works.
hmr: Hi Hezekia bawk hin Gihon tuikhur hnâr sakhnung lem kha a hrukping a, David khawpui thlang- tieng panga khan a lâk thlâk a. Hezekia chu a sinthaw po poa chun a hlawtling pei a.

en: Howbeit in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent unto him to inquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Babulon lal- hai, chu rama thilmakhai chu indawn suok dinga a kuoma mi hungtirhai chungthua chun, a lungrila umhai po po chu a hriet theina dingin, fie dingin Pathien chun ama chu a thlathlam a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his good deeds, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz, in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
hmr: Hezekia thilthaw danghai le, a thilthaw ṭhathai chu, ngai ta, Israel le Juda lalhai lekhabua chun, Amoz naupa zâwlnei Isai thil hmulâwkhaia chun ziek a nih.

en: And Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the ascent of the sepulchres of the sons of David: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem did him honor at his death. And Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Hezekia chu a thlatuhai lai a in tah a; David naupasalhai thlân in hang kainaa khan an phûm a; Juda mi po po le Jerusalema um po po chun a thi ni chun ropuitakin an râl a. Chun, a naupa Manasse chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem.
hmr: Manasse chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmpahnia upa a na, Jerusalema chun kum sâwmnga panga sûng ro a rêl a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, after the abominations of the nations whom Jehovah cast out before the children of Israel.
hmr: Ama chun LALPAIN Israel mi- hai hmaa a hnawt suokhai, khawhri be mihai tirdakumna ang chun LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha naw chu a thawh a.

en: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down; and he reared up altars for the Baalim, and made Asheroth, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
hmr: A pa Hezekiain a lo suksiet ta hnung bâwlhmunhai kha a siem ṭha nâwk a; Baal ta dingin mâichâmhai a dâw thar nâwk bawk a; Asera a siem a, vâna thil umhai po po chu chibai a bûk a, an rawng a bâwl bawk a.

en: And he built altars in the house of Jehovah, whereof Jehovah said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ina chun mâi- châmhai a siem a, LALPA chun a kuoma, “Jerusalema hin ka hming chu kumkhuoin um zing a tih,” a tinaa chun.

en: And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA in tuolpûk pahnia chun vâna thil umhai po po ta ding chun mâichâmhai a siem a.

en: He also made his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom; and he practised augury, and used enchantments, and practised sorcery, and dealt with them that had familiar spirits, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger.
hmr: Hinnom naupa ruoma chun a nauhai chu mei ân fêthlengtir bawk a; aisân a hmang a, zâwldiaihai a hmang a, dâwi a hmang bawk a, thlarau zâwlhai a sawr bawk a, thiemrauhai leh; LALPA mithmua chun thil suol nasatak el ama chu suklungsen dingin a thaw tah a.

en: And he set the graven image of the idol, which he had made, in the house of God, of which God said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
hmr: Chun, milim kerṭielhai, ama siem chu LALPA ina chun a sie a; chu chungthua chun Pathien chun David le a naupa Solomon kuoma chun, “Hi ina le Jerusalema khawm, Israel hnam po po laia inthawka ka thlang suoka hin, kumkhuoa dingin ka hming chu sieng ka ta,

en: neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from off the land which I have appointed for your fathers, if only they will observe to do all that I have commanded them, even all the law and the statutes and the ordinances given by Moses.
hmr: in thlatuhai ta dinga ram ka iruot taha inthawk chun Israel kepha chu sawn ta bawk naw ning a; Mosie hmanga thupêkhai, thuruothai, dân- hai po po, anni thu ka pêkhai po po chu an thaw phawt chun,” a lo tina LALPA ina chun a sie a nih.

en: And Manasseh seduced Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that they did evil more than did the nations whom Jehovah destroyed before the children of Israel.
hmr: Manasse chun Juda le Jerusa- lema umhai chu ân suksuoltir a; chuongchun, Israelhai hmaa LALPA- IN a sukbohmang hnamhai nêk hman khan thil suol an thaw nasa lem a.

en: And Jehovah spake to Manasseh, and to his people; but they gave no heed.
hmr: Chuongchun, Manasse le a mi- hai kuoma chun LALPA chun thu a hril a, nisienlakhawm, an pawisa nawh a.

en: Wherefore Jehovah brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh in chains, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPAIN Assuria lal sipai hotuhai chu a hung ṭhuoi a, Manasse chu khaidietin an khit a, thîr kawl an inbuntir a, Babulonah an fepui tah a.

en: And when he was in distress, he besought Jehovah his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
hmr: Chuongchun, rimsitaka a hung um huna chun LALPA a Pathien chu a zawng a, a thlatuhai Pathien hmaa chun ama le ama chu nasatakin ân sukhnuoi tah a.

en: And he prayed unto him; and he was entreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that Jehovah he was God.
hmr: Chun, ama kuoma chun a ṭawngṭai a, ama chu dawnsakin a um a, a hnina chu ngaiin a um a, ama ramah, Jerusalema chun hung ṭhuoi nâwkin a um tah a. Chun, Manasse chun LALPA chu Pathien a nih ti a hriet tah a.

en: Now after this he built an outer wall to the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish gate; and he compassed Ophel about with it, and raised it up to a very great height: and he put valiant captains in all the fortified cities of Judah.
hmr: Chun, hi hnunga hin Nga dai Kawtkhâr lûtna, phairuom a, Gihon sîr thlang a, David khawpui dang a puo lema chun kul a bâwl a; Ophel tieng a sukkuol a, insângtakin a suk- sâng a; chun, Juda rama khawpui kul neiahai chun hotu thilthawthei- takhai a sie tâwl a.

en: And he took away the foreign gods, and the idol out of the house of Jehovah, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of Jehovah, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
hmr: Chun, Pathien danglamhai le, milimhai chu LALPA ina inthawk chun a lâk suok a, LALPA in tlânga mâichâm a lo siem tahai po po le, Jerusalema mihai le khan a lâk hmang vawng a; khawpui puoa chun a peihâwn tah a.

en: And he built up the altar of Jehovah, and offered thereon sacrifices of peace-offerings and of thanksgiving, and commanded Judah to serve Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: LALPA mâichâm chu a buotsai a, chutaka chun inremna thilinhlân- hai, lâwmthu hrilna inthâwinahai ân hlân a, Israel Pathien LALPA rawng chu bâwl dingin Juda mihai chu thu a pêk tah a.

en: Nevertheless the people sacrificed still in the high places, but only unto Jehovah their God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mipuihai chu bâwlhmunhaiah an lân thâwi ta rawp a chu, LALPA an Pathien kuoma chun a nih an inthâwi.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel, behold, they are written among the acts of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Manasse thilthaw danghai le a Pathien kuoma a ṭawngṭaina dâm le Israel Pathien, LALPA hminga a kuoma zâwlneiin a hril thuhai dâm chu ngai ta, Israel lalhai thilthawhai lai chun ziek a nih.

en: His prayer also, and how God was entreated of him, and all his sin and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up the Asherim and the graven images, before he humbled himself, behold, they are written in the history of Hozai.
hmr: A ṭawngṭaina dâm, ama Pathienin a lo ngaisak dânhai dâm, a suolna po po le a bawsietna po po le, bâwlhmun a siemna hmunhai le, ama le ama ân sukhnuoi hmaa Asera a siem dâm le, milim ker a siemhai thu chu, ngai ta, Hozai chanchinbua chun ziek an nih.

en: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Manasse chu a thlatuhai lai a in tah a, ama ina ngei chun an phûm tah a, a naupa Amon chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Amon was twenty and two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
hmr: Amon chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pahnia upa a na; Jerusa- lema chun kum hni sûng ro a rêl a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as did Manasseh his father; and Amon sacrificed unto all the graven images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them.
hmr: A pa Manasse ang bawk khan, LALPA mithmuah thil suol chu a thawh a; Amon chu a pa Manassein milim ker a lo siem tahai po po kuoma khan ân thawi a, an rawng a bâwl a.

en: And he humbled not himself before Jehovah, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but this same Amon trespassed more and more.
hmr: A pa Manasse ân sukhnuoi ta ang khan ama hi chu LALPA hmaa chun ân sukhnuoi ve nawh a; chuong- chun, hi Amon hi chu a suol nasa deu deu tah a.

en: And his servants conspired against him, and put him to death in his own house.
hmr: Chun, a siehlawhai chun ama chu an phierrûk a, ama in sûnga ngei chun an that tah a.

en: But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
hmr: Amiruokchu, chu rama mihai chun lal Amon phierrutuhai po po an that a; chun, chu rama mipuihai chun a naupa Josia chu ama aia chun lalah an siem tah a.

en: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign; and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem.
hmr: Rorêl a ṭan chun Josia chu kum rieta upa a na, Jerusa- lema chun kum sâwmthum pakhat sûng ro a rêl a.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, and walked in the ways of David his father, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.
hmr: LALPA mithmuah thil indik chu a thawh a, a thlatu David lampuihai chu a hrawh a, changtienga manih, vawitienga manih khawm a pêthmang nawh a.

en: For in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father; and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places, and the Asherim, and the graven images, and the molten images.
hmr: Naupang a la ni laiin, a rorêl a kum rietnaa inthawk chun a thlatu David Pathien chu a zawng ṭan a; chun, kum sâwmpahninaa chun Juda ram le Jerusalem chu Asera dâm, milim a kera kerhai dâm, milim a sunga sunghai dâm le bâwlhmun po poa inthawk chun a sukthieng ṭan tah a.

en: And they brake down the altars of the Baalim in his presence; and the sun-images that were on high above them he hewed down; and the Asherim, and the graven images, and the molten images, he brake in pieces, and made dust of them, and strewed it upon the graves of them that had sacrificed unto them.
hmr: Ama hmaihmaa ngei chun Baal mâichâmhai chu a sukchim a; nisa milimhai, chuonghai chung daia um- hai chu a phûr thlûk a; Asera le milim a kera kerhai le a sunga sunghai chu a vuok nâwi vawng a, pilvutin a siem a, an kuoma lo inthâwi hlaktuhai thlân chungahai chun a phul a.

en: And he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars, and purged Judah and Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai ruhai chu an mâichâmhai chunga chun a rawh a, Juda ram le Jerusalem chu a suk- thieng a.

en: And so did he in the cities of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, even unto Naphtali, in their ruins round about.
hmr: Chun, Manasse le Ephraim le Simeon khawpuihaia, Naphtali chen- in, an sietna hmun vêlahai chun chuong ang chun a thaw bawk a.

en: And he brake down the altars, and beat the Asherim and the graven images into powder, and hewed down all the sun-images throughout all the land of Israel, and returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, mâichâmhai chu a suk- chim a, Asera chu, milim a kera kerhai le chun a vuok nâwi vawng a, Israel ram po poa inthawk chun nisa milimhai po po chu a phûr thlûk vawng a, Jerusalema chun a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of Jehovah his God.
hmr: Chun, chuonga ram le in chu a sukthieng laia a rorêlna a kum sâwm pariet kum chun, Azalia naupa Saphan hai, khawpui sûng rorêltu Maaseia hai, Joahaz naupa Joa, thil inchiktuhai chu a Pathien LALPA in chu siem ṭha dingin a tir tah a.

en: And they came to Hilkiah the high priest, and delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites, the keepers of the threshold, had gathered of the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and of all the remnant of Israel, and of all Judah and Benjamin, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Thiempu laltak Hilkia kuoma chun an hung a, Levi mi kawtkhâr vêngtuhaiin Manasse le Ephraim mihai kuta inthawk le, Israel mi a la um sun po poa inthawk dâm, Juda le Benjamin mi po poa inthawk dâm, Jerusalema chêngtuhaia inthawka an lâk khâwmhai, Pathien ina sum hung lâka umhai kha, an hung pêk a.

en: And they delivered it into the hand of the workmen that had the oversight of the house of Jehovah; and the workmen that wrought in the house of Jehovah gave it to mend and repair the house:
hmr: Chun, chu chu LALPA in en- kawlna sin thawtuhai kuta chun an pêk a; chun, LALPA ina sinthawtuhai chu in siem ṭhatna ding le bâwl ṭhatna ding chun an pêk a,

en: even to the carpenters and to the builders gave they it, to buy hewn stone, and timber for couplings, and to make beams for the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.
hmr: in bâwltuhai le thingrem siem- tuhai kuoma lung saksahai, thing a zawmna dinghai inchâwkna ding le, Juda lalin a lo suksiet tah in bâwlna dinga thingtumhai siemna dingin.

en: And the men did the work faithfully: and the overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to set it forward; and others of the Levites, all that were skilful with instruments of music.
hmr: Mihai chun sin chu ringumtak- in an thawh a; annihai enkawltuhai chu Merari naupasalhai, Levi mi Jahath le Obadia hai; Kohath mi naupasalhai Zekaria le Mesullam hai chu an nih; Levi mihai, thil ri sutna thilhaia themthiem taphawthai chu.

en: Also they were over the bearers of burdens, and set forward all that did the work in every manner of service: and of the Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters.
hmr: Chun, phurrik phurtuhai en- kawltuhai khawm an ni bawk a, rawngbâwlna sin chu kawng ieng anga khawm an enkawl pei a; chun, Levi mihai chu ziektuhai, hotuhai le kawtkhâr vêngtuahai an um a.

en: And when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah, Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law of Jehovah given by Moses.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ina tangka lâk lûta um chu an hung lâk suok chun, Hilkia chun Mosien a pêk, LALPA dân lekhabu chu a hmusuok a.

en: And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of Jehovah. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
hmr: Chun, Hilkia chun a dawn a, lekhaziektu Saphan kuoma chun, “LALPA ina chun dân lekhabu chu kan hmusuok tah,” a ta. Chuongchun, Hilkia chun lekhabu chu Saphan kuoma chun a pêk tah a.

en: And Shaphan carried the book to the king, and moreover brought back word to the king, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they are doing.
hmr: Saphan chun lekha chu lal kuoma chun a chawi a; Saphan chun lal kuoma chun thu a hung intlun nâwk a, “I siehlaw hai kuoma thaw dinga pêk ang khan an thaw a;

en: And they have emptied out the money that was found in the house of Jehovah, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and into the hand of the workmen.
hmr: LALPA ina tangka hmua um kha an bun suok a, sinthawtuhai kuta le a enkawltuhai kuta chun an pêk suok tah a,” tiin.

en: And Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read therein before the king.
hmr: Chun, ziektu Saphan chun lal kuoma chun, “Thiempu Hilkia chun lekhabu a mi lo pêk a,” a ta. Chun, chutaka chun Saphan chun lal hmaa chun a tiem tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he rent his clothes.
hmr: Chun, lal chun dân thuhai chu a hriet chun a puonhai a keithlêr a.

en: And the king commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Abdon the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king’s servant, saying,
hmr: Chun, lal chun Hilkia hai, Saphan naupa Ahikam hai, Mika naupa Abdon hai le lekhaziektu Saphan le lal siehlaw Asaia chu thu a pêk a,

en: Go ye, inquire of Jehovah for me, and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found; for great is the wrath of Jehovah that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of Jehovah, to do according unto all that is written in this book.
hmr: “Fe unla, kei le, Juda le Israel rama mâksana la umhai ta ding hin lekhabu hmu suoka um thu ang khan LALPA mi hung râwnpêk ta u; lekha- bua ziek po po, ang taka thaw dinga, ei thlatuhai chun LALPA thu chu an lo pawm ta naw lei khan, LALPA lunginsenna ei chunga bunthlâka um hi a nasa a nih,” tiin.

en: So Hilkiah, and they whom the king had commanded, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the second quarter); and they spake to her to that effect.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hilkia le lalin a tirhai po po chu, silfên vêngtu Hasra naupa Tokath naupa Sallum nuhmei, zâwlneinu Hulda kuoma chun an fe tah a, (chuong lai chun Jerusalema vêng pahninaa chun a um a nih), a kuoma chun chuong thua chun thu an hril tah a.

en: And she said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: Tell ye the man that sent you unto me,
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Ka kuoma nangni hung tirtu cheu kuoma chun hieng hin hril ro,

en: Thus saith Jehovah, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, Ngai ta u, hi hmuna le hi hmun hluotuhai chunga chun thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtir ding a nih; Juda ram lal hmaa an tiem tah lekhabua khâng ṭawngsiehai po po kha,

en: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore is my wrath poured out upon this place, and it shall not be quenched.
hmr: kei an mi lo nghatsan tah a; an kut sinthawhaia lunginsen dinga an mi chawktho theina dingin pathien danghai kuoma chun riminhnikhai an rawh a; chuleiin, ka lunginsenna chu hi hmun chunga hin bunthlâk a ni tah a, sukre el ni ta naw nih,’ tiin.

en: But unto the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of Jehovah, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel: As touching the words which thou hast heard,
hmr: Amiruokchu, Juda lal, LALPA chu thu indawn dinga tirtu cheu kuoma chun hieng hin hril in ta, Israel Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih, ‘Thu i lo hriet ta chungthua chun,

en: because thy heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before God, when thou heardest his words against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, and hast humbled thyself before me, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard thee, saith Jehovah.
hmr: hi hmun le a sûnga chênghai chungthua, thuhai chu i hriet phinga i lungril ân nêm a, nangma le nangma chu Pathien hmaa chun în sukhnuoi leiin le, i puonhai i keithlêr a, ka hmaa chun i ṭap leiin kei khawma ka hung hriet ve che a nih.

en: Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof. And they brought back word to the king.
hmr: Ngai ta, i thlatuhai kuomah infetir ka ti cheh a, i thlâna chun thlamuongtakin fêng i ta, hi hmun le a sûnga umhai chunga thil ṭha naw ka hung intlungtir dinghai po po chu i mithaiin hmu naw nih a tih,’ ti ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, lal chu, thu chu an hung intlun nâwk a.

en: Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, lal chun mi a tir a, Jerusalem le Juda rama upahai po po chu a ko khâwm tah a.

en: And the king went up to the house of Jehovah, and all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests, and the Levites, and all the people, both great and small: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, lal chu LALPA ina chun a hang feh a; Juda rama mi po pohai le Jerusalema chêngtuhai le, thiem- puhai le Levi mihai le, mi po po a chîn a lienin an hang fe veh a; LALPA ina thuthlungna lekhabu hmua um sûnga thuhai po po an na hrieta chun a tiem tah a.

en: And the king stood in his place, and made a covenant before Jehovah, to walk after Jehovah, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant that were written in this book.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a hmuna chun a ngîr a, LALPA chu zui a, a thupêkhai, a thuinhriettirhai, a thuruothai chu a lungril po po le a lungvar po poa zâwm a, lekhabua thuthlung thu zieka umhai po po chu thaw dingin LALPA hmaa chun thuthlung a siem tah a.

en: And he caused all that were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand to it. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Chun, Benjamin le Jerusalema umhai po po chu chuong anga um dingin a tih a. Jerusalema chênghai chun an thlatu Pathien, Pathien thuthlung ang chun an thawh a.

en: And Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that pertained to the children of Israel, and made all that were found in Israel to serve, even to serve Jehovah their God. All his days they departed not from following Jehovah, the God of their fathers.
hmr: Chun, Josia chun Israel thlahai ihluo ram po poa inthawk chun tirdakumna po po chu a lâk hmang a, Israel rama umhai po po LALPA an Pathien rawng chu ân bâwltir a. A dam sûng po po chun an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA zuinaa inthawk chun an pêthmang nawh a.

en: And Josiah kept a passover unto Jehovah in Jerusalem: and they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
hmr: Josia chun LALPA kuoma fekân ruoiṭhe chu Jerusalema chun a hmang a; thla hmasa tak ni sâwmpali ni chun fekân ruoiṭhena ding chu an that a.

en: And he set the priests in their offices, and encouraged them to the service of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Thiempuhai chu an sinthawahai chun a ruot a, LALPA in rawngbâwl- naa ding chun ân fui tâwl a.

en: And he said unto the Levites that taught all Israel, that were holy unto Jehovah, Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel did build; there shall no more be a burden upon your shoulders. Now serve Jehovah your God, and his people Israel;
hmr: LALPA ta dinga inthieng Israel po po inchûktir hlak Levi mihai kuom a chun, “Israel lal David naupa Solomonin in a bâwla khan Thu- thlungna bâwm inthieng chu sie ro; in liengkoahai zâwn ngâi ta naw nih a; tuhin in Pathien LALPA le a mi Israelhai rawng chu bâwl ro.

en: and prepare yourselves after your fathers’ houses by your courses, according to the writing of David king of Israel, and according to the writing of Solomon his son.
hmr: Nangni khawm Israel lal David ziek ang le, a naupa Solomon ziek ang tak khan an pahnam ang peiin in pâwl bi chu insiem unla.

en: And stand in the holy place according to the divisions of the fathers’ houses of your brethren the children of the people, and let there be for each a portion of a father’s house of the Levites.
hmr: Chun, Levi hnam inṭhe dân ang pei le, in unau mipuihai pahnam in- ṭhe dân ang pei chun hmun inthienga chun ngîr unla.

en: And kill the passover, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare for your brethren, to do according to the word of Jehovah by Moses.
hmr: Chun, fekân ruoiṭhena ding chu that unla, nangni le nangni chu in- hlân thieng ro; Mosie hmanga LALPA thu ang tak kha thaw dingin in unauhai ta ding khawm chun buotsai bawk unla,” a ta.

en: And Josiah gave to the children of the people, of the flock, lambs and kids, all of them for the passover-offerings, unto all that were present, to the number of thirty thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these were of the king’s substance.
hmr: Chun, Josia chun chu hnam thlahai, a umhai po kuoma chun ran ruol laia mi berâmte dâm, kêlte dâm sîng thum le bâwngchal sâng thum fekân ruoiṭhenaa inhlân dingin a pêk a; hi hi lal suma mi a nih.

en: And his princes gave for a freewill-offering unto the people, to the priests, and to the Levites. Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, the rulers of the house of God, gave unto the priests for the passover-offerings two thousand and six hundred small cattle, and three hundred oxen.
hmr: Chun, a hotuhai chun Levi mihai le thiempuhai le mipui kuoma chun nuom thua thilinhlân dinghai chu an pêk bawk a. Hilkia le Zekaria le Jehiel, Pathien in rorêltuhai chun thiempuhai kuoma chun fekân ruoi- ṭhena dingin ran chîn sâng hni le za ruk le, bâwngchal za thum an pêk a.

en: Conaniah also, and Shemaiah and Nethanel, his brethren, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, the chiefs of the Levites, gave unto the Levites for the passover-offerings five thousand small cattle, and five hundred oxen.
hmr: Konania le a unauhai Semaia le Nethanel le, Levi mihai hotuhai Hasabia le, Jeiel le, Jozabad chun Levi mihai kuomah fekân ruoiṭhenaa thilinhlân dingin ran ruol chîn sâng nga le bâwngchal za nga an pêk bawk a.

en: So the service was prepared, and the priests stood in their place, and the Levites by their courses, according to the king’s commandment.
hmr: Chuongchun, rawngbâwlna chu buotsai a ni tah a, lal thupêk ang tak chun thiempuhai chu an hmuna chun an ngîr a, Levi mihai chu an pâwl dân ang peiin an thaw tah a.

en: And they killed the passover, and the priests sprinkled the blood which they received of their hand, and the Levites flayed them.
hmr: Chun, fekân ruoiṭhena ding chu an that a, thiempuhai chun an kutin thisen chu an theh a, Levi mihai chun an inhlip a.

en: And they removed the burnt-offerings, that they might give them according to the divisions of the fathers’ houses of the children of the people, to offer unto Jehovah, as it is written in the book of Moses. And so did they with the oxen.
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilin- hlânhai chu an sie hmang a, Mosie lekhabua ziek anga LALPA kuoma inhlân dinga, chu hnam thlahai pahnam inṭhe dân ang peia an pêk suok theina dingin. Chuongchun, bâwngchalhai khawm chu chuong ang bawk chun an thawh a.

en: And they roasted the passover with fire according to the ordinance: and the holy offerings boiled they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and carried them quickly to all the children of the people.
hmr: Chun, fekân ruoiṭhena ding chu dân ang peiin meiah an em hmin a, chun, thilinhlân inthienghai sa kha chu bêlhai le, bêl bau ûmhai le, bêl indarhaiin an suong a, mi po pohai kuoma chun inhmâwtakin an fepui tah a.

en: And afterward they prepared for themselves, and for the priests, because the priests the sons of Aaron were busied in offering the burnt-offerings and the fat until night: therefore the Levites prepared for themselves, and for the priests the sons of Aaron.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun anni ta ding le thiempuhai ta ding chun an buotsai tah a; Aron naupasalhai thiempuhai chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân le a thâuhai chu zân chen- in an buoipui tah a; chuleiin, Levi mihai chun anni le Aron naupasal thiempuhai ta ding chun an buotsai el a nih.

en: And the singers the sons of Asaph were in their place, according to the commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun the king’s seer; and the porters were at every gate: they needed not to depart from their service; for their brethren the Levites prepared for them.
hmr: Chun, David le Asaph le Heman le lal zâwlnei Jeduthun thupêk angin hlasaktuhai, Asaph naupasalhai chu an hmuna chun an um a; chun, kawtkhâr vêngtuhai chu dâi kawt- khâr tina chun an um bawk a; an sinthawhai chu an mâksan a ṭûl nawh a, an unau Levi mihai chun an ta dingin an buotsaipêk leiin.

en: So all the service of Jehovah was prepared the same day, to keep the passover, and to offer burnt-offerings upon the altar of Jehovah, according to the commandment of king Josiah.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Josia thupêk angin, LALPA rawngbâwlna po po chu ni khat sûngin, fekân ruoiṭhe hmang ding le LALPA mâichâm chunga pumrawhmang thilinhlân inhlân ding chu, buotsai vawng a ni tah a.

en: And the children of Israel that were present kept the passover at that time, and the feast of unleavened bread seven days.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chutaka umhai chun chu nia chun fekân ruoi- ṭhe chu an hmang a, chawlṭhanglo bei ruoiṭhe chu ni sari an hmang bawk a.

en: And there was no passover like to that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did any of the kings of Israel keep such a passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel that were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
hmr: Zâwlnei Samuel hun laia inthawk ta khan chuonga fekân ruoi- ṭhe chu Israel rama lal tu khawma Josiain a hmang ang hin an hmang ngai nawh a, thiempuhai le Levi mihai le, Israel le Juda chutaka umhai po po le, Jerusalema chênghai khawma an hmang ngai nawh a.

en: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
hmr: Josia rorêl a kum sâwmpariet- naa chun a nih a hi fekân ruoiṭhe hi hmanga a um chu.

en: After all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Neco king of Egypt went up to fight against Carchemish by the Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him.
hmr: Hieng po po hnunga hin, Josia chun biekin chu a siem ṭha zo chun Aigupta lal Neko chu Euphrates vadung panga Karkemis chu rûn dingin a hang feh a; Josia chu ama tuok ding chun a fe suok tah a.

en: But he sent ambassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day, but against the house wherewith I have war; and God hath commanded me to make haste: forbear thee from meddling with God, who is with me, that he destroy thee not.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun aiâwtuhai a hung tir a, a kuomah, “Nang Juda lal, nang hi iengtin am ka thaw ding che a na? Vawisûn hi nang do ding chein ka hung nawh a, amiruokchu, indona ka neipuihai chu do dingin a ni lem ka hung; chun, Pathien chun inhmaw dingin thu a mi pêk a, Pathien chu sukbuoi lo dingin insûm hrâm la, ama chu ka kuomah a um a, sukbohmang rawi a ti che,” tiin.

en: Nevertheless Josiah would not turn his face from him, but disguised himself, that he might fight with him, and hearkened not unto the words of Neco from the mouth of God, and came to fight in the valley of Megiddo.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Josia chun ama chu a kîrsan chuong nawh a, ama chu a do ngei theina dingin, ân sukdanglam a; Pathien baua in- thawka Neko thu chu a ngaisak nawh a, ama chu Megiddo ruoma do ding chun a suok tah a.

en: And the archers shot at king Josiah; and the king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am sore wounded.
hmr: Chun, thal kâp mihai chun Josia chu an kâp a, chun, lal chun a siehlaw kuoma chun, “Ka hliem nasa hle el sih a, mi sie hmang ro khai,” a ta.

en: So his servants took him out of the chariot, and put him in the second chariot that he had, and brought him to Jerusalem; and he died, and was buried in the sepulchres of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.
hmr: Chuongchun, a siehlawhai chun sakawr tawlailîra inthawk chun an lâk suok a, a sakawr tawlailîr danga chun an sieh a, Jerusalemah an hung ṭhuoi tah a; a thih a, a thlatuhai thlân ina chun phûmin a um tah a, Juda le Jerusalem po poin Josia chu an sûn a.

en: And Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing men and singing women spake of Josiah in their lamentations unto this day; and they made them an ordinance in Israel: and, behold, they are written in the lamentations.
hmr: Chun, Jeremia khawm chun Josia chu a sûn a; vawisûn ni chen hin, hlasaktu pasal le hlasaktu nuhmeihai khawm chun Josia an sûnna hla chu an lân sam a; Israel rama chun thupêkhaiah an siem a, chuong chu, ngai ta, sûnnaa chun ziek an nih.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and his good deeds, according to that which is written in the law of Jehovah,
hmr: Josia thilthaw danghai le, a thilthaw ṭhathai chu, LALPA dâna ziek ang tak chun,

en: and his acts, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
hmr: a thilthawhai a hmasatak le a nuhnungtak chu, ngai ta, Juda le Israel ram lalhai lekhabua chun ziek a nih.

en: Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and made him king in his father’s stead in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, chu ram mipuihai chun Josia naupa Jehoahaz chu an ṭhuoi a, a pa aia chun Jerusalema lalah an siem tah a.

en: Joahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
hmr: Jehoahaz chu ro a rêl ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pathuma upa a na; Jerusalema chun thla thum sûng ro a rêl a.

en: And the king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem, and fined the land a hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
hmr: Aigupta lal chun ama chu Jeru- salema chun ân lalna a suktlâwm a, an ram chu rângkachak talent khat le tangkaruo talent za khat ân chawi- tir a.

en: And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. And Neco took Joahaz his brother, and carried him to Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta lal chun a unaupa Eliakim chu Jerusalem le Juda ram chunga chun lalah a siem a; a hming chu Jehoiakim in a thleng tah a. Chun, Neko chun a unaupa Jehoahaz chu a ṭhuoi a, Aigupta ramah a fepui tah a.

en: Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah his God.
hmr: Jehoiakim chu rorêl a ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pangaa upa a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmpakhat sûng ro a rel a; a Pathien LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha naw chu a thawh a,

en: Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
hmr: ama chu doin, Babulon lal Nebu- kadnezzar chu a hung a, thîrkawlhai- in a khuop a, Babulona ṭhuoi dingin.

en: Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of Jehovah to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon.
hmr: Nebukadnezzar chun LALPA ina bûr le bêlhai khawm chu Babulon tieng a phur hmang a, Babulona biekina chun a sie tâwl a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Jehoiakim thil thaw danghai le, thil tirdakum a thawhai le, amaa hmua umhai chu, ngai ta, Juda le Israel ram lalhai lekhabua chun ziek a nih; chun, Jehoiakin, a naupa chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
hmr: Jehoiakin chu rorêl a ṭan chun kum rieta upa a na, thla thum le ni sâwm sûng Jerusalema chun ro a rêl a. LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawhai chu a thawh a.

en: And at the return of the year king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of Jehovah, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, kum hung inlet nâwka chun Nebukadnezzar chun mi a tir a, ama chu Babulonah, LALPA ina bûr le bêl ṭhahai le chun an hung ṭhuoi a, a unaupa Zedekia chu Juda le Jerusalem chunga chun lalah a siem tah a.

en: Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem:
hmr: Zedekia chu rorêl a ṭan chun kum sâwmhni pakhata upa a na; Jerusalema chun kum sâwmpakhat sûng ro a rêl a;

en: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah his God; he humbled not himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of Jehovah.
hmr: a Pathien LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha naw chu a thawh a; LALPA baua inthawka thuhriltu Jeremia hmaa khawm chun ama le ama chu ân sukhnuoi nawh a.

en: And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart against turning unto Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Pathiena ṭawng inkhâmtirtu Nebukadnezzar chunga khawm chun a hel bawk a; Israel Pathien LALPA kuoma kîr dingin, a lungril a sukngar a, ân sukkâwmâw bawk a.

en: Moreover all the chiefs of the priests, and the people, trespassed very greatly after all the abominations of the nations; and they polluted the house of Jehovah which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun, khaw- hri be mihai tirdakumna po po angin mipuihai le thiempu lalhai khawm chun nasatakin an bawsiet a; Jerusalema LALPA in a sukthieng ta chu an sukpawrche tah a.

en: And Jehovah, the God of their fathers, sent to them by his messengers, rising up early and sending, because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling-place:
hmr: A umna hmun le a mihai chu a lunginsiet leiin, an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chun an kuoma chun a tirkohai chu a tir a,

en: but they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and scoffed at his prophets, until the wrath of Jehovah arose against his people, till there was no remedy.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, Pathien tirko- hai chu an nuisan a, a thu chu an hmusit a, a zâwlneihai chu an nuiêu a, sukṭhat nâwk theina um ta lo hiel khawpa, mipuihai chunga LALPA lungsenna chu chawkthoa a um hiel chen chun.

en: Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldeans, who slew their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young man or virgin, old man or hoary-headed: he gave them all into his hand.
hmr: Chuleichun, an chunga chun Kaldai lal a hung tir a, anni chun hmun inthienghaia chun an tlang- vâlhai dâm kâwlhnâmin an that a, tlangvâl amanih, nunghâkhai ama- nih, upa amanih, tar amani chunga khawm lunginsietna an nei nawh a, chuongchun, an rêng chun a kutah a pêk a.

en: And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of Jehovah, and the treasures of the king, and of his princes, all these he brought to Babylon.
hmr: Pathien ina bûr le bêlhai, a lien le chînhai khawm, LALPA ina ro siekhâwlhai, lal ina ro siekhâwlhai le, a hotuhai tahai chen khawm chun Babulon tieng a lâk vawng a.

en: And they burnt the house of God, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.
hmr: Chun, Pathien in chu an rawh a, Jerusalem kul chu an vuokchim a, chutaka a lal inhai po po chu meiin an rawh a, chutaka bûr le bêl ṭhahai po po chu an suksiet bawk a.

en: And them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon; and they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:
hmr: Kâwlhnâma inthawka lo suok tahai chu Babulon tieng a ṭhuoi a; Persia ram rorêl a ni chen khan anni chu a nauhai le ama siehlawhai an na;

en: to fulfil the word of Jehovah by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed its sabbaths: for as long as it lay desolate it kept sabbath, to fulfil threescore and ten years.
hmr: chu ram chun a châwlni a hmang hmakhat chu Jeremia baua LALPA thu kha sukfamkim a ni theina dingin; râusana a um sûng po chu châwlni chu a hmang a na, kum sâwmsari suktling dingin.

en: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Jehovah by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Jehovah stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
hmr: Persia lal Kura inlal kum khat- naa chun, Jeremia baua LALPA thu sukfamkim a ni theina dingin, Persia lal Kura lungril chu LALPA chun a chawktho a, thuphuong a ram sûng po poa chun a siem a, zieka ziek khawmin a sie bawk a,

en: Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath Jehovah, the God of heaven, given me; and he hath charged me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whosoever there is among you of all his people, Jehovah his God be with him, and let him go up.
