hmr: “Persia lal Kura chun hieng ang hin a tih, Vâna Pathien LALPA chun hnuoi chunga ram po po chu a mi pêk a; Juda rama Jerusalema chun in bâwlpêk dingin a mi ruot tah a. Nangni laia ama mihai taphawt kuoma chun LALPA a Pathien chu um sienla, hang fe raw se,” tiin.

en: Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the height thereof.
hmr: Chunawa khawm dârsen mâi- châm a siem bawk a, a dungtieng tawng sâwmhni, a khangtieng tawng sâwmhni; ân sângtieng chu tawng sâwm.

en: Also he made the molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass; and the height thereof was five cubits; and a line of thirty cubits compassed it round about.
hmr: Chun, dâr tuizêng inbiel a sunga sungin, a reia inthawka rei khing- tieng tawng sâwm, intie vêl vawng, ân sângtieng tawng nga chu a siem bawk a; a rei a vêlin tawng sâwm- thum vêltuok a nih.

en: And under it was the likeness of oxen, which did compass it round about, for ten cubits, compassing the sea round about. The oxen were in two rows, cast when it was cast.
hmr: Chun, a rei hnuoia chun kumûm ang a vêla vêlsuok, tawng khat pei sâwm seng, tuizêng vêla chun a siem a. Kumûm lim chu tlar hni a na, tuizêng le chun sung kawp a nih.

en: It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea was set upon them above, and all their hinder parts were inward.
hmr: Bâwngchal lim sâwmpahni chunga inṭhut a na, pathum chun hmârtieng an nghah a, pathumin simtieng, pathumin thlangtieng, pa- thum bawkin saktieng an nghah a; chu dâr tuizêng chu an chunga chun inṭhut a nih; an hnungtieng chun sûngtieng a ngha seng a.

en: And it was a handbreadth thick; and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily: it received and held three thousand baths.
hmr: Chun, kutpha bawka sa a na; a rei chu no rei anga siem a na, lili pâr angin, bath sâng thum dawng a nih.

en: He made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them; such things as belonged to the burnt-offering they washed in them; but the sea was for the priests to wash in.
hmr: Insâwpna dingin châwtawl sâwm a siem a, panga chu changtieng pang- ah a sieh a, panga dang chu vawi- tiengah; chuong thilhai chu pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhai kha sâwpnaah an hmang hlak a, tuizêng ruok chu thiempuhai ta dinga insâwpna a nih.

en: And he made the ten candlesticks of gold according to the ordinance concerning them; and he set them in the temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
hmr: Chun, anni chungthua thupek angin rângkachak sathâu khâwnvar siena sâwm a siem a, chuonghai chu biek ina chun a sieh a, panga chu changtieng pangah, panga dang chu vawitiengah.

en: He made also ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made a hundred basins of gold.
hmr: Chun, dawkân sâwm a siem a, biekina chun a sieh a, panga chu changtieng pangah, panga dang chu vawitiengah. Chun, rângkachak thlêngkûm za khat a siem bawk a.

en: Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.
hmr: Chu nawa khawm chun thiem- puhai tuolpûk le tuolpûk lien a siem a; chuong tuolpûk kawtkhârhai le chun, chuong kawtkhârhai chu dâr- senin ân luon khum a.

en: And he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward, toward the south.
hmr: Chun, maihûn chu a in pangah simsaktieng chun ân ṭhut a.

en: And Huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basins. So Huram made an end of doing the work that he wrought for king Solomon in the house of God:
hmr: Chun, Huram chun bêlhai, thlêngkûmhai le suodûrhai chu a siem a. Chun, Huram chun Pathien ina lal Solomon ta dinga a sinthaw chu a thaw zo tah a,

en: the two pillars, and the bowls, and the two capitals which were on the top of the pillars, and the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars,
hmr: sûtpui pahnihai, maihûnhai, sûtpui lêrhaia a hmawrbâwkhai, sût- pui pahnihai lêra a hmawrbâwkhai inkûm inkhumna dinga ṭiel chik chek lênhai le;

en: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the pillars.
hmr: chuong lên pahnihai ta dinga theibufai zalihai le lên pakhat sûtpui hai chunga hmawrbâwkhai inkûm inkhumna ta dinga theibufai tlar hni pei le chun.

en: He made also the bases, and the lavers made he upon the bases;
hmr: Chun, suonkuolhai a siem a, châwtawlhai chu suonkuol chunga inṭhutin a siem a;

en: one sea, and the twelve oxen under it.
hmr: tuizêng pakhat chu a hnuoia bâwngchal sawmpahni leh.

en: The pots also, and the shovels, and the flesh-hooks, and all the vessels thereof, did Huram his father make for king Solomon, for the house of Jehovah, of bright brass.
hmr: Bêlhai, suodûrhai, sakuoikim- hai le chutaka bûr le bêlhai po po chu Huram chun LALPA ina ding chun dârsen tle miin lal Solomon ta ding chun a lo siem vawng a.

en: In the plain of the Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.
hmr: Zereda le Sukkoth inkâra tlak- pil hmuna khan Jordan Phairuomah lal chun a lo sung a na.

en: Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for the weight of the brass could not be found out.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun hieng bûr le bêlhai po po hi tam tâwk takin a siem a, dârsen lem chu a bûk zât khawm hriet suok ruol a ni nawh a.

en: And Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of God, the golden altar also, and the tables whereon was the showbread;
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Pathien ina bûr le bêlhai po po chu a siem a, rângkachak mâichâm le, entirna bei siena dawkânhai;

en: and the candlesticks with their lamps, to burn according to the ordinance before the oracle, of pure gold;
hmr: sathâu khâwnvar siena le a khâwnvarhai, hmun inthieng hmaa chun thupêk anga an chawk zing theina ding, rângkachak inthiengin a siem a;

en: and the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, of gold, and that perfect gold;
hmr: a pârbâwrhai, khâwnvarhai, chaichehai, rângkachakin, rângka- chak inthiengin a siem a;

en: and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the firepans, of pure gold. And as for the entry of the house, the inner doors thereof for the most holy place, and the doors of the house, to wit, of the temple, were of gold.
hmr: khâwnvar vâm chepnahai, châwtawlhai, haihâwhai, meilâkna- hai chu rângkachak inthieng bawkin; chun, in lûtna chu, hmun inthieng- taka kawtkhâr sûngril lem le, in kawtkhârhai chu rângkachak an nih.

en: Thus all the work that Solomon wrought for the house of Jehovah was finished. And Solomon brought in the things that David his father had dedicated, even the silver, and the gold, and all the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of God.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA in dinga Solomonin sin a thaw po po chu zo a ni tah a. Chun, Solomon chun a pa Davidin thil a lo hlân tah tangka dâm, rângkachak dâm, bûr le bêl po pohai chu a hung lâk lût a, Pathien in ro siekhâwmna hmuna chun a sie tah a.

en: Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers’ houses of the children of Israel, unto Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the city of David, which is Zion.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun David khawpui Ziona LALPA thuthlungna bâwm chu hung la dingin, Israel thlahai pahnamhai laia ṭhuoituhai, hnam tin laia luhai le, Israel upahai chu Jerusalema chun a ko khâwm tâwl tah a.

en: And all the men of Israel assembled themselves unto the king at the feast, which was in the seventh month.
hmr: Israel mihai po po chu thla sarinaa ruoiṭhenaa chun lal kuoma chun an hung khâwm vawng a.

en: And all the elders of Israel came: and the Levites took up the ark;
hmr: Israel upahai po po chu an hung a, Levi mihai chun bâwm chu an zâwn tah a.

en: and they brought up the ark, and the tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; these did the priests the Levites bring up.
hmr: Chun, bâwm le, intuokna puon in le puon ina bûr le bêl inthienghai po po le chun an zu lâk tah a; hieng thilhai hi thiempu Levi mihai chun an zu lâk a nih.

en: And king Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled unto him, were before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude.
hmr: Lal Solomon le Israel mipui ama hmaa hung inkhâwmhai po po chun berâm le bâwngchal a tam tienga tiem sênglo le hril thei lo chun inthâwiin, bâwm hmaa chun an um a.

en: And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Jehovah unto its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chun LALPA thuthlungna bâwm chu, chu in hmun inthieng, hmun inthiengtaka cherub- hai thla zar hnuoia a hmun dinga chun an hung lâklût tah a.

en: For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and the staves thereof above.
hmr: Cherubhai chun an thlahai chun bâwm umna hmun chu an zârkhum a, cherubhai chun bâwm le chutaka a zâwnfunghai chu an inkhum sa sih a.

en: And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the ark before the oracle; but they were not seen without: and there it is unto this day.
hmr: Chun, a zâwnfunghai chu an sei êm a, zâwnfung hmawrhai chu hmun inthieng hmaa inthawkin ân hmu thei a; amiruokchu, puotienga in- thawk chun ân hmu thei nawh a; chutaka chun tu chen hin a um tah a.

en: There was nothing in the ark save the two tables which Moses put there at Horeb, when Jehovah made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
hmr: Chu bâwm sûnga chun, Aigupta rama inthawka an hung suok laia Israel thlahai kuoma LALPAIN thu- thlung a siem laia Mosien Horeba lungphêk pahni a sie lût chau naw kha chu ieng dang khawm a um nawh a.

en: And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place (for all the priests that were present had sanctified themselves, and did not keep their courses;
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chu hmun inthienga inthawka an hung suok chun, (thiempu chutaka um po pohai chu an pâwl hunbi nghâk kher loin sukthieng an ni hlak sih a;

en: also the Levites who were the singers, all of them, even Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, and their sons and their brethren, arrayed in fine linen, with cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them a hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets);
hmr: Levi mi chutaka hla saktuhai khawm chu an rêngin, Asaph hai, Heman hai, Jeduthun hai, an naupasalhai le an unauhai leh puon zai inhmi puona inthuomin, per- khuong leh, ṭingṭang leh dârben- thekhai leh mâichâm tâwp saktieng panga chun an ngîr a; anni lai chun thiempu za le sâwmhni tawtawrâwt mûttuhai an um bawk a):

en: it came to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking Jehovah; and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of music, and praised Jehovah, saying, For he is good; for his lovingkindness endureth for ever; that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of Jehovah,
hmr: LALPA inpâka, lâwmthu hrila, hla saktuhai le tawtawrâwt puhai chu pakhat ang el a, ri inremtaka hriet a ni hlak a; tawtawrâwthai le, dârbenthekhai le, rimawi thawna thuomhnawhai leh an râwlhai an insuo a, LALPA chu inpâka, “Ama chu a ṭha sih a; a zângaina chu kum- khuoin um zing a tih,” an ti pha chun, LALPA in chu sûmin a hung sip hlak a,

en: so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud: for the glory of Jehovah filled the house of God.
hmr: chuongchun, thiempuhai chu sûm lei chun rawngbâwl dingin an ngîr zing thei ta ngai nawh a, LALPA ropuina chun Pathien in chu a hung suksip hlak leiin.

en: Then spake Solomon, Jehovah hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun a hril a, “LALPA chun inthim sâmupa chun um ka tih a ta.

en: But I have built thee a house of habitation, and a place for thee to dwell in for ever.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, kumkhuoa chêng- na dinga hmun i ta dingin, i ta dinga umna ding in ka bâwlpêk ta che hi,” a ta.

en: And the king turned his face, and blessed all the assembly of Israel: and all the assembly of Israel stood.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a ngha kîr a, Israel inkhâwmhai po po chu mal a sâwm a; Israel mipuihai po po chu an ngîr ṭhup a.

en: And he said, Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, who spake with his mouth unto David my father, and hath with his hands fulfilled it, saying,
hmr: Chun, ama chun a hril a, “Israel- hai Pathien LALPA chu inpâkin um raw se, ka pa David kuoma a baua thu lo hril a, a bânhaia lo sukpui- tlingtu chu:

en: Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be prince over my people Israel:
hmr: ama chun, ‘Aigupta rama in- thawka ka mihai ka ṭhuoi suok nia inthawk tah, Israel hnam po po laia inthawkin, ka hming um zingna dinga in bâwlna dingin khawpui ka ruot nawh a; ka mi Israelhai chunga lala um dingin tukhawm ka thlang bawk nawh;

en: but I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there, and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
hmr: amiruokchu, ka hming umna dingin Jerusalem kha ka thlang a, chun, ka mi Israelhai chunga um dingin David chu ka lo thlang tah a,’ tiin.

en: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, ka pa David lung- rila chun Israelhai Pathien LALPA hminga in bâwl nuomna a um a.

en: But Jehovah said unto David my father, Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for my name, thou didst well that it was in thy heart:
hmr: Amiruokchu, LALPA chun ka pa David kuoma chun, ‘Ka hming dingin, in bâwl dingin lungril i nei a ni âwm a; hieng i lungrila um hi i thaw ṭha ngawt el;

en: nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
hmr: amiruokchu, in chu nang chun bâwl naw ti nih a, i naupa, i ṭhâla hung pieng ding chun, ka hmingin in chu bâwl lem a tih,’ a ta.

en: And Jehovah hath performed his word that he spake; for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and sit on the throne of Israel, as Jehovah promised, and have built the house for the name of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun thu a hril ta chu a hung puitling pei a; ka pa David hmuna chun ka hung ngîr tah a, LALPAIN a lo tiem ta angin Israel ram lal ṭhungphaa chun ka ṭhung tah a, Israelhai Pathien LALPA hming ding chun in chu ka bâwl ta a nih.

en: And there have I set the ark, wherein is the covenant of Jehovah, which he made with the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun bâwm chu kân ṭhut tah a, Israel thlahai le LALPAIN thuthlung a lo siem tahai chu chu sûnga chun a um nghe ngheh a,” tiin.

en: And he stood before the altar of Jehovah in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread forth his hands
hmr: Chun, Israel mipui inkhâwmhai po po hmaihmaah, LALPA mâichâm hmaah a ngîr a, a bânhai chu a phar a;

en: (for Solomon had made a brazen scaffold, five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court; and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the assembly of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven);
hmr: (Solomon chun dârsen ṭham tawng ngaa sei, tawng nga bawka lien, tawng thuma insâng a siem a, tuollai sûnga a laitaka a ilo daw ta chunga chun a ngîr a, Israel inkhâwmhai po po hmaa chun a dingṭhaṭhuon a, a kuthai chu vân tieng a phar a nih.) ama chun a hril a;

en: and he said, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven, or on earth; who keepest covenant and lovingkindness with thy servants, that walk before thee with all their heart;
hmr: “Aw LALPA Israelhai Pathien, an lungril po poa i hmaa khawsa hlakhai i siehlawhai chunga zângai- na le thuthlung kawl zingtu nang ang hi, hnuoi le vâna khawm Pathien dang an um dêr nawh a;

en: who hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou didst promise him: yea, thou spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thy hand, as it is this day.
hmr: i siehlaw ka pa David kuoma khawm i thutiemhai chu i sukpui- tling a; anih, i bauin i hril a, vawisûn ni ang bawk hin, i kuthai chun i sukpuitling hlak ta kha.

en: Now therefore, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only thy children take heed to their way, to walk in my law as thou hast walked before me.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin aw LALPA, Israelhai Pathien, ‘Ka hmaa i khaw- sak anga, ka dân hraw dinga i thlahaiin an pawi sa chun; ka mit- hmuah Israel lal ṭhungphaa ṭhung ding mi intlâksamtir naw ning che,’ tiha ka pa David i siehlaw kuoma i lo tiem ta kha hung hre zing rawh.

en: Now therefore, O Jehovah, the God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou spakest unto thy servant David.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, aw LALPA Israelhai Pathien, i siehlaw David kuoma i thu i lo hril ta chu sukdet ni raw se.

en: But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have builded!
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, thilthaw tin- rêngah mihriemhai lai Pathien chu a khawsa ding am a nih? Ngai ta, vân le vânhai vân khawm chun nang chu a dâwl naw che a nih; hi in ka bâwl lem hi chu a chîn nasa âwm de!

en: Yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Jehovah my God, to hearken unto the cry and to the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee;
hmr: I hmaa i siehlaw hnina, ṭawng- ṭaina le kona chu lo ngai dingin, Aw LALPA ka Pathien, a hnina le i siehlaw ṭawngṭaina chu i lo ngai- sak a;

en: that thine eyes may be open toward this house day and night, even toward the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant shall pray toward this place.
hmr: i hmun tieng nghaa i siehlaw hin a ṭawngṭai pha, ṭawngṭaina chu lo ngai dingin, ‘Chutaka chun ka hming chu sieng ka tih,’ i tina hmun tieng ngei chu, chu in tienga chun a sûn a zâna i mit chu în lên theina dingin.

en: And hearken thou to the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place: yea, hear thou from thy dwelling-place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
hmr: Hi hmun tieng hi nghaa an ṭawngṭai pha chun i mi Israelhai le i siehlaw hnina chu lo ngai la; anih, i umna vâna inthawk ngei chun lo hre la; chun, i lo hriet chun ngaidam bawk la.

en: If a man sin against his neighbor, and an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear, and he come and swear before thine altar in this house;
hmr: “Miin a tuolbâwm chungah thil a suksuol a, vânni khâm dinga inkhâmtira um ding a lo ni chun, hi ina hin a hung a, i mâichâm hmaa hin a hung inkhâm chun;

en: then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, requiting the wicked, to bring his way upon his own head; and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
hmr: nang chun vâna inthawkin lo ngai la, thaw la, mi suol chu ama lu chung ngeia a maw phura thungin, i siehlawhai chungthu chu hung rêl rawh; ân dikna ang peia pêka um dingin mi fel chu thiem hung in- changtir bawk la.

en: And if thy people Israel be smitten down before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee, and shall turn again and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
hmr: Chun, i mi Israelhai hi an hmêlmahai hmaa chun i chunga an suolna leia hnein lo um hai sienla, hung ngha kîrin, i hming an hung ṭan a, hi ina hin an ṭawngṭaia hnina an hung siem chun;

en: then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.
hmr: nangin vâna inthawk chun lo hre la, i mi Israelhai suol chu ngai- dam la, an thlatuhai le anni kuoma i pêk rama chun hung ṭhuoi nâwk rawh.

en: When the heavens are shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them:
hmr: I chungah thil an suksuol leiin, ruo sûr loin vân chu lo ping ta sienla, hi hmun tieng nghaa an ṭawngṭai a, i hming an ṭan a, anni chu i hrem laia an suol chu an nghatsan chun,

en: then hear thou in heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou teachest them the good way wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given to thy people for an inheritance.
hmr: vâna chun lo hre la, an fena ding lampui ṭha închûktir lai chun i siehlawhai le i mi Israelhai suol chu nangin lo ngaidam la; i mihai kuoma rochan dinga i pêk, chu ram chunga chun ruo insûrtir rawh.

en: If there be in the land famine, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting or mildew, locust or caterpillar; if their enemies besiege them in the land of their cities; whatsoever plague or whatsoever sickness there be;
hmr: Chun, chu rama chun ṭâm amanih a tlah a, hri amanih ân lêng a, riel amanih, ṭêk amanih, khâu amanih, tuktulung amanih an ṭuong chun; an hmêlmahai chun an khaw- puiahai chun anni chu hung inhuol hai sienla, ieng hripui khawm in- lêngin, ieng natna khawm um sienla;

en: what prayer and supplication soever be made by any man, or by all thy people Israel, who shall know every man his own plague and his own sorrow, and shall spread forth his hands toward this house:
hmr: i mi Israelhai po poin amanih, mi tukhawmin amanih hnina le ṭawngṭaina ieng ang khawm lo siem ta sienla, mi tin mâni hri ngei hretu le, mâni lungngaina ngei hretuin hi in tieng hin a bânhai a phar suok chun,

en: then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling-place, and forgive, and render unto every man according to all his ways, whose heart thou knowest (for thou, even thou only, knowest the hearts of the children of men);
hmr: i umna vâna inthawk chun nangin lo hre la, ngaidam la, mi tin chu, a lungril chu nangin i hriet a, a lampuihai ang po po ngei chun nangin inhmutir rawh; (nang chun, nang chauin mihriem nauhai lungril chu i hriet sih a;)

en: that they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.
hmr: kan thlatuhai kuoma i pêk rama an um sûng po poa i lampuihai chu hraw dinga nangma chu an ṭi theina ding chein.

en: Moreover concerning the foreigner, that is not of thy people Israel, when he shall come from a far country for thy great name’s sake, and thy mighty hand, and thine outstretched arm; when they shall come and pray toward this house:
hmr: “Chu nawah i mi Israel mi ni lo, mikhuol chungthua chun; i kut phar lei le, i kut thahrât lei le, i hming ropui leia ram hlataka inthawka a hung chun; an hung a hi in tieng nghaa an ṭawngṭai pha chun;

en: then hear thou from heaven, even from thy dwelling-place, and do according to all that the foreigner calleth to thee for; that all the peoples of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
hmr: i umna hmun vâna inthawk ngei chun lo hre la, mikhuolin a hung kona san tak ang che chu thawpêk rawh; hnuoi chunga mi po pohai chun i mi Israelhai anga, hi in ka bâwl hi i hming a put ti an hriet theina dingin le, i hming ropui chu an hriet a an ṭi theina ding chein.

en: If thy people go out to battle against their enemies, by whatsoever way thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;
hmr: I mihai chu an hmêlmahai chunga do dingin fe suok hai sienla, khaw tieng lampuia mani khawm nangin lo tir ta la, i hming dinga in ka ibâwl le, hi khawpui nangin i thlang tieng hi nghaa an ṭawngṭai chun:

en: then hear thou from heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
hmr: vâna inthawk chun an ṭawng- ṭaina le hnina chu lo ngai la, an thu chu nangin ṭan rawh.

en: If they sin against thee (for there is no man that sinneth not), and thou be angry with them, and deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive unto a land far off or near;
hmr: I chungah thil an suksuol a, (mi thil suksuol lo an um si nawh a) an chungah i lung a sen a, hmêlma kutah i pêk a, ram hlaa manih, a hnaia manih anni chun sala an ṭhuoi hmang chun:

en: yet if they shall bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn again, and make supplication unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done perversely, and have dealt wickedly;
hmr: sala ṭhuoihmanga an umna rama chun anni chu an inngaituoh a, an hung ngha kîr a, sal an nina rama chun nanga kuomah hnina an hung siem a; ‘Thil kan suk suol tah a, rilotakin kan thaw tah a, khawhlo- takin kan lo thaw tah a nih,’ tiha;

en: if they return unto thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captive, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy name:
hmr: sala an umna rama an lungril po po le an lungvar po poa nangma kuoma an hung ngha kîr a, sala ṭhuoihmang an nina hmuna chun i hming dinga in ka bâwl tieng le, nangin khawpui i thlang tieng le, an thlatuhai kuoma ram i pêkna tieng nghaa an ṭawngṭai chun;

en: then hear thou from heaven, even from thy dwelling-place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people who have sinned against thee.
hmr: i umna hmun vâna inthawk ngei chun, an hnina le an ṭawngṭaina chu lo hre la, nangin an thu chu ṭan la, i chunga thil suksuol i mihai chu nangin ngaidam rawh.

en: Now, O my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent, unto the prayer that is made in this place.
hmr: Tuhin, aw ka Pathien, ka ngên che, hi hmuna ṭawngṭaina hi, i mitin hmu sienla, i na chun lo ngai raw se.

en: Now therefore arise, O Jehovah God, into thy resting-place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O Jehovah God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.
hmr: Aw LALPA Pathien tuhin tho la, i châwlna hmuna chun nang le, i hrâtna bâwm chu; Aw LALPA Pathien, i thiempuhai chu sandam- nain inthuomhai sienla, i mi in- thienghai chu ṭhatnaah hlim raw hai se.

en: O Jehovah God, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember thy lovingkindnesses to David thy servant.
hmr: Aw LALPA Pathien, i hriek nâl hmai chu innghat hmangtir naw la, i siehlaw David thilthaw ṭhathai chu hre zing rawh,” tiin.

en: Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt-offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of Jehovah filled the house.
hmr: Solomonin ṭawngṭaina chu a suktâwp chun, vâna inthawkin mei a hung tlah a, inthâwinahai le pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai chu a kâng hmang a; LALPA ropuina chun in chu a suksip tah a.

en: And the priests could not enter into the house of Jehovah, because the glory of Jehovah filled Jehovah’s house.
hmr: LALPA in chu LALPA ropuinaa suksipa a um leiin thiempuhai chu LALPA ina chun an lût thei nawh a.

en: And all the children of Israel looked on, when the fire came down, and the glory of Jehovah was upon the house; and they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground upon the pavement, and worshipped, and gave thanks unto Jehovah, saying, For he is good; for his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
hmr: Mei a hung tla a, in chunga chun LALPA ropuina a um zing lai chu Israel thlahai chun an en zing a; tuolzâwla chun an hmaihaia hnuoi sikin an kûn a, chibai an bûk a; “Ama chu a ṭha sih a, a zângaina chu kum- khawtluonga um zing ding a nih,” tiin, LALPA chu lâwmthu an hril a.

en: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifice before Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, lal le mipuihai po po chun LALPA hmaa chun inthâwina an inhlân a.

en: And king Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty and two thousand oxen, and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun bâwng- chal sîng hni le sâng hni le, berâm nuoi khat le sîng hniin inthâwina ân hlân a. Chuongchun, lal le mipuihai po po chun Pathien in chu an inhlân tah a.

en: And the priests stood, according to their offices; the Levites also with instruments of music of Jehovah, which David the king had made to give thanks unto Jehovah (for his lovingkindness endureth for ever), when David praised by their ministry: and the priests sounded trumpets before them; and all Israel stood.
hmr: Thiempuhai chu an sinthaw ang pei chun an ngîr a; an rawngbâwlnaa Davidin ân pâk laia, “A zângaina chu kumkhawtluongin a um zing sih a,” tia, LALPA inpâkna dinga lal Davidin LALPA thil rimawi thuomhnawhai a siemhai le chun Levi mihai chu an ngîr ve a; chun, thiempuhai chun an hmaa chun tawtawrâwt an hang mût a, Israel mihai po po chu an ngîr ta ṭhuop a.

en: Moreover Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of Jehovah; for there he offered the burnt-offerings, and the fat of the peace-offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt-offering, and the meal-offering, and the fat.
hmr: Chunawa khawm, Solomon chun LALPA in tuolsûng hmun lailung chu a sukthieng bawk a; Solomonin dârsen mâichâm a ilo siem ta chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân le, bu thil- inhlân le, a thâuhai chu a keng naw leiin, chutaka chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân le inremna thilinhlân thâuhai chu ân hlân sih a.

en: So Solomon held the feast at that time seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath unto the brook of Egypt.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun Israel mihai po po, mipui pung- khâwm nasatakhai, Aigupta vadung- têa inthawka Hamath lûtna chena mihai le chun ni sari sûng chu ruoi an ṭheh a.

en: And on the eighth day they held a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.
hmr: Chun, a ni riet ni chun in- khâwmna huntâwp chu an nei a; mâichâm inhlânna chu ni sari sûng khan an nei a, ni sari sûng ma chun ruoiṭhena an nei bawk a.

en: And on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent the people away unto their tents, joyful and glad of heart for the goodness that Jehovah had showed unto David, and to Solomon, and to Israel his people.
hmr: Chuongchun, thla sarinaa ni sâwmhni pathum ni chun mipuihai chu an puon in tienghai chun, a mi Israelhai chunga le Solomon chunga le David chunga LALPAIN ṭhatna a lo inentirna lei chun lungrila lâwmtak le thafântak chun a tir kîr tah a.

en: Thus Solomon finished the house of Jehovah, and the king’s house: and all that came into Solomon’s heart to make in the house of Jehovah, and in his own house, he prosperously effected.
hmr: Chuongchun, Solomon chun lal in le LALPA in chu a zo tah a; LALPA in le ama ina thaw dinga Solomon lungrila um po pohai chu puitling takin a zo tah a.

en: And Jehovah appeared to Solomon by night, and said unto him, I have heard thy prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for a house of sacrifice.
hmr: Chun, zâna chun LALPA chu Solomon kuomah a hung inlâr a, a kuomah, “I ṭawngṭaina ka lo hriet a, ka kuoma inthâwina in dingin hi hmun hi ka thlang tah a nih.

en: If I shut up the heavens so that there is no rain, or if I command the locust to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people;
hmr: Vân chu ka sukping a, ruo a sûr naw chun amanih, khâuhai chu ram chu fa zo dinga thu ka pêkin amanih, ka mihai laia hin hripui ka hung tîrin amanih;

en: if my people, who are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
hmr: ka mihai, ka hming chawia kohai chu an insukhnuoi a, an ṭawngṭai a, an lampui rilohai chu nghatsan a ka hmêl an hung zawng chun, vâna inthawk chun lo hrieng ka ta, an suol chu ngaidam ka ta, an ram khawm chu sukhrisêl bawk ka tih.

en: Now mine eyes shall be open, and mine ears attent, unto the prayer that is made in this place.
hmr: Chuongchun, hi hmuna ṭawng- ṭaina inhlâna umhai chu, ka mithai chu meng ka ta, ka nahai chun ngai a tih.

en: For now have I chosen and hallowed this house, that my name may be there for ever; and mine eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
hmr: Kumkhawtluonga ka hming a um zing theina dingin hi in hi ka thlangin ka lo sukthieng ta sih a; chuongchun, ka mithai le ka lungril khawm chu chutaka chun um châm- chîng a tih.

en: And as for thee, if thou wilt walk before me as David thy father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and mine ordinances;
hmr: Chun, nanga chungthua chu thu ka pêk po pohai che ang peia i thaw a, i pa David khawsak anga ka hmaah i khawsa a, ka thuruothai le ka rorêlhai chu i zâwm chun;

en: then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
hmr: ‘Israel rama rorêltu ding intlâk- samtir naw ning che,’ tia i pa David kuoma thu ka lo thlung ta ang khan i lalram lalṭhungpha chu sukdet ka tih.

en: But if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;
hmr: Amiruokchu, i pêt hmang a, i hmaa thupêkhai le thuruothai ka siehai chu i nghatsan a, i fe a, pathien danghai rawng i bâwl a, anni chu chibai i bûk chun;

en: then will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and I will make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
hmr: ram ka ipêk, ka rama inthawkin a zung pumin anni chu phawidawk ka ta, chun, hi in ka hminga ka lo sukthieng ta khawm hi ka hmu phâk nawah sawn hmang ka ta, hnam tin laia chun ti-elna le ṭawngnaa hmang dingin siem ka tih.

en: And this house, which is so high, every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall say, Why hath Jehovah done thus unto this land, and to this house?
hmr: Chun, hi in hieng ang lâwma insâng hi, a fekhêltuhai taphawt chun mak la tîng an ta, ‘Hi in le hi ram hi LALPA chun ieng am a law a ni ta le?’ tiin.

en: And they shall answer, Because they forsook Jehovah, the God of their fathers, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold on other gods, and worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath he brought all this evil upon them.
hmr: Chun, anni ma chun, ‘Aigupta rama inthawka anni ṭhuoi suoktu an thlatuhai Pathien LALPA chu an nghatsan a, pathien danghai an chel a, chibai an bûk vêl a, an rawng an bâwl a, chuleiin, hieng thil ṭha naw po po hi an chungah a hung intlungtir a nih hi,’ la tîng an tih” a ta.

en: And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the house of Jehovah, and his own house,
hmr: Chun, kum sâwmhni sûng, Solomonin ama in le LALPA in a bâwl sûng chun,

en: that the cities which Huram had given to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
hmr: Huramin Solomon kuoma khaw- pui a pêkhai chu, Solomon chun a siem ṭhah a, chuonga chun Israel thlahai chu ân umtir a.

en: And Solomon went to Hamath-zobah, and prevailed against it.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu Hamath- zobaa chun a va feh a, a va hne tah a.

en: And he built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store-cities, which he built in Hamath.
hmr: Thlalêr hmuna chun Tadmor khuo chu a siem a, sie khâwmna khawpuihai po po chu Hamatha chun a bâwl a.

en: Also he built Beth-horon the upper, and Beth-horon the nether, fortified cities, with walls, gates, and bars;
hmr: Beth-horon chunghnung le, Beth-horon thlanghnung lem chu a bâwl bawk a, chuong chu khawpui kul nei, bang neia dai kawtkhâr le kalna thîrhai nei an nih;

en: and Baalath, and all the store-cities that Solomon had, and all the cities for his chariots, and the cities for his horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
hmr: chun, Baalath le siekhâwmna khawpui Solomonin a neihai po po le, sakawr tawlailîrhai ta dinga khaw- puihai po po le, sakawr chung chuong mihai ta dinga khawpuihai le, Lebanon le Jerusalem le, a rorêlna ram sûng po poah Solomonin a nuom- sip tâwlna dinga bâwl a nuomhai po po chu a nih.

en: As for all the people that were left of the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, that were not of Israel;
hmr: Chun, hnam po pohai, Hit mihai, Amor mihai, Periz mihai, Hiv mihai, Jebus mihai a la umhai Israel mi ni lohaia le,

en: of their children that were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel consumed not, of them did Solomon raise a levy of bondservants unto this day.
hmr: an thlahai chu rama an mâksana Israelhaiin an lo sukbohmang naw- hai chunga chun vawisûn ni chen hin Solomon chun suok nina sie chu ân chawitir a.

en: But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work; but they were men of war, and chief of his captains, and rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Israel thlahai chu Solomon chun a sinthawnaa chun sie- hlawah a siem nawh a; indo mi le, a hotutakhai le, a sakawr chung chuong mihai le a sakawr tawlailîr- hai chunga rorêltuhai an ni lem a.

en: And these were the chief officers of king Solomon, even two hundred and fifty, that bare rule over the people.
hmr: Chun, hienghai hi Solomon hotutakhai, za hni le sâwmnga, mi- puihai chunga ro phurtuhai chu an nih.

en: And Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David unto the house that he had built for her; for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy, whereunto the ark of Jehovah hath come.
hmr: Solomon chun Pharao naunu chu David khawpuia inthawkin a in dinga bâwla chun a zu ṭhuoi a; “Israelhai lal David ina chun ka nuhmei chu a um ding a ni nawh, a hmunhai chu LALPA bâwm hungna a nih a, ân thieng leiin,” a ti sih a.

en: Then Solomon offered burnt-offerings unto Jehovah on the altar of Jehovah, which he had built before the porch,
hmr: Chun, tuolpûk hmaa LALPA mâichâm a siema chun Solomon chun pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai chu ân hlân a,

en: even as the duty of every day required, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the set feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles.
hmr: ni tinin vawi ieng zât pei amanih, châwlniahai, thla tharahai, ruoiṭhe hunahai Mosie thupêk ang peia inhlânin; kum khat sûngah vawi thum, chawl ṭhanglo bei ruoiṭhea le, hapta kâr ruoiṭhehaia le, bâwkte ruoiṭhehaia le chun.

en: And he appointed, according to the ordinance of David his father, the courses of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their offices, to praise, and to minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required; the doorkeepers also by their courses at every gate: for so had David the man of God commanded.
hmr: Chun, a pa Davidin a lo sukdet ta angin, an rawngbâwlna dingin thiempuhai pâwl hun chu a ruotpêk a; chun, Levi mihai khawm chu sin tuk an nina, inpâk ding le thiempu- hai hmaa rawngbâwl dingin, ni tina a ṭûl ang peia an bituk angin a ruot bawk a; dai kawtkhâr tinahai chun kawtkhâr vêngtuhai chu an pâwl hun ang peiin, chuong ang chun Pathien mi David chun thu a lo pêk ta sih a.

en: And they departed not from the commandment of the king unto the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
hmr: Chun, ro siekhâwmna in chung- thu le, thu ieng kima hrim hrim Levi mihai le thiempuhai kuoma lal thupêkhai chu an ngaitha ngai dêr nawh a.

en: Now all the work of Solomon was prepared unto the day of the foundation of the house of Jehovah, and until it was finished. So the house of Jehovah was completed.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA in chu a lungphûm phûm nia inthawka zo a ni chenin Solomon sinhai po po chu thaw zing a na. Chuongchun, LALPA in chu a puitlin a nih.

en: Then went Solomon to Ezion-geber, and to Eloth, on the sea-shore in the land of Edom.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu Edom rama tuipui kama Eloth le Ezion-gebera chun a fe tah a.

en: And Huram sent him by the hands of his servants ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they came with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and fetched from thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to king Solomon.
hmr: Chun, Huram chun a sie- hlawhai kutin lawnghai le siehlawhai tuisuoriet chanchin hre mihai chu ama kuoma chun a thawn a; chuong- chun, anni chu Solomon siehlawhai le chun Ophira chun an feh a, chutaka inthawk chun rângkachak talent za li le sâwmnga an hung phur a, lal Solomon kuoma chun an hung lâk a.

en: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great train, and camels that bare spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
hmr: Seba lalnu chun Solomon chan- chin chu a lo hrietin, indawnna intak takhai le Solomon chu fie dingin rawi nasatak leh; sanghâwng- sei, riminhnik le rângkachak tamtak le lunghluhai phurtuhai le chun Jerusalema chun a hung a; chun, Solomon kuom a hung tlung chun, a lungrila umhai po po thua chun ama chu ân biekpui tah a.

en: And Solomon told her all her questions; and there was not anything hid from Solomon which he told her not.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun ân dawn- nahai po po chu a dawn a, Solomon ihriet naw thil, a dawn thei naw iengkhawm a um nawh a.

en: And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
hmr: Chun, Seba lalnu chun Solomon varzie le, in a ibâwl ta le,

en: and the food of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, his cupbearers also, and their apparel, and his ascent by which he went up unto the house of Jehovah; there was no more spirit in her.
hmr: dawkâna a bu dâm, a siehlaw inṭhunghai le a rawngbâwltuhai ngîrzie dâm le, an incheinahai le, a no chawituhai le an incheinahai le, a kailâwn LALPA in a hang fena chu a hmu chun, amaa chun lungril dang hrim a um ta nawh a.

en: And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom.
hmr: Chun, lal kuoma chun, “I varzie le i thilthawhai keia rama ka lo hriet thuthanghai hi ân dik ngei a ni hi.

en: Howbeit I believed not their words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it; and, behold, the half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me: thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
hmr: Kei ngei ka hung a, ka mit ngeia ka hung hmu hma khan chu an thuhai ka lo ring nawh a; ngai ta, i varna nasatzie chenve khawm hi hril ka lo ni naw hi tie; i hminginthangna ka lo hriet hi i khûm dai a nih.

en: Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, that stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.
hmr: I mihai chu an vângnei a nih, i siehlaw i hmaa ngîr zing zinga, i varna thu ngai hlakhai chu an va vângnei de!

en: Blessed be Jehovah thy God, who delighted in thee, to set thee on his throne, to be king for Jehovah thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do justice and righteousness.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se; ama chun LALPA i Pathien ta dinga lal ni dinga lalṭhungphaa inṭhungtir che chu a lâwm zâwng tak a na; i Pathien chun Israelhai chu kumkhuoa tungding zing chu a nuom zâwng a ni leiin, indiktaka rorêlna chu nei dingin an chunga lalah a siem che a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and spices in great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
hmr: Ama chun lal chu rângkachak talent za le sâwmhni le, riminhnik tamtak le, lunghluhai a pêk a; Seba lalnuin Solomon kuoma a pêk ang hrim hrim riminhnik a la um ngai nawh.

en: And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, that brought gold from Ophir, brought algum-trees and precious stones.
hmr: Chun, Huram siehlawhai le Solomon siehlawhai Ophira in- thawka rângkachak hung phurtuhai khan algum thing le lunghlu an hung phur a.

en: And the king made of the algum-trees terraces for the house of Jehovah, and for the king’s house, and harps and psalteries for the singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.
hmr: Chun, lal chun algum thing chu LALPA in ta ding le lal ina inhuonna ding le, hla saktuhai ta dinga per- khuong le ṭingṭanghai dingin a siem a; chuong ang hrim hrim chu Judai rama chun a hmain hmu a ni ngai nawh a.

en: And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, besides that which she had brought unto the king. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon chun Seba lalnu kuoma chun a dit taphawt, a hni phawt chu amain a hung chawi ang ni lo phawt kha chu a pêk veh a. Chun, a kîr a, ama ram ngeia chun ama le a siehlawhai chu an fe tah a.

en: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold,
hmr: Kum khat sûnga Solomon kuoma rângkachak hung lût bûk zât chu, rângkachak talent za ruk sâwmruk paruk a nih:

en: besides that which the traders and merchants brought: and all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
hmr: chu chu dâwrkaihai le sum dâwnghaiin an hung lâk lût tiemsa loin a nih; chun, Arabia rama lalhai po po le ram sûnga rorêltuhai po po chun Solomon kuomah rângkachak le tangka an hung lâk lût a.

en: And king Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one buckler.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun rângka- chak âwmphaw a suta sutin za hni a siem a, âwmphaw pakhata chun rângkachak sutphêk shekel za ruk a lût a.

en: And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
hmr: Chun, rângkachak a suta sutin phâw za thum a siem a, phaw pa- khata chun rângkachak sutphêk shekel za thum a lût a; chun, lal chun chuonghai chu Lebanon ramhnuoi inah a sieh a.

en: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
hmr: Chunawa khawm, lal chun sai- ha lalṭhungpha a siem a, rângkachak inthiengin ân luon khum a.

en: And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the stays.
hmr: Chun, lalṭhungpha hang kaina chu kailâwn paruk sirpha rângka- chak seng lalṭhungphaa zawmnghet a na; chun, ṭhungna hmun sir khing ve vea chun sakeibaknei lim pahni an ngîr bawk a.

en: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
hmr: Chun, kailâwn paruka chun sîr khatah sakeibaknei sâwm le pahni an ngîr a, a sîr khingtienga khawm chun; khâwlai rama khawm hieng anga siem hi a la um ngai nawh.

en: And all king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: silver was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
hmr: Chun, lal Solomon dâwnna nohai po po chu rângkachak an na, Lebanon ramhnuoi ina bûr le bêlhai po po khawm chu rângkachak inthieng an nih, Solomon hun lai hin tangkaruo hin hlutna a nei rak nawh.

en: For the king had ships that went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram; once every three years came the ships of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
hmr: Huram siehlawhai le Tarsisa fe hlak lal chun lawnghai inkawppui a nei sih a, kum thum dan peiah Tarsis lawnghai chu hungin rângkachak dâm, tangkaruo dâm, saiha dâm, zâwng dâm, ârawn dâm a hung phur hlak a.

en: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Solomon chun hnuoia lalhai po po chu varna le hausaknaa chun a khûm a nih.

en: And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia lalhai po po chun Pathienin a lungrila varna a sie chu ngai dingin Solomon chu an hung pan huoi huoi hlak a.

en: And they brought every man his tribute, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, armor, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
hmr: Chun, mi tin chun a thilpêk, rângkachak bûr le bêlhai, tangkaraw bûr le bêlhai,silfên dâm, râlthuom dâm, riminhnik dâm, sakawr dâm, sabengtung lien chi dâm, kum tina bituk angin an hung pêk seng hlak a.

en: And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chun sakawrhai le sakawr tawlailîrhai ta dingin in sâng li le, sakawr chung chuong mi sîng khat le sâng hni a nei a; sakawr tawlailîr khawpuihaia le lal kuoma Jerusalema a siehai chu a nih a.

en: And he ruled over all the kings from the River even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, lal po po vadungpuia inthawka Philistin mihai ram chenin, Aigupta ramri chena umhai chunga chun ro a rêl a.

en: And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycomore-trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.
hmr: Chun, lal chun a tam êm lei chun Jerusalema chun tangkaruo chu lung ang el le, Sidar thing chu phai- ruoma theichang thinghai ang elin a siem a.

en: And they brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt, and out of all lands.
hmr: Chun, Aiguptaa inthawk le ram tina inthawkin Solomon ta dingin sakawrhai chu an hung lâk a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
hmr: Solomon thilthaw danghai, a hmasa le tâwpna chenin zâwlnei Nathan ziek chanchin bua le, Silon mi Ahija hrillâwknaa le, Nebat naupa Jeroboam chungthua zâwlnei Iddo thil hmulâwkahai chun ziek a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
hmr: Solomon chun Israel po po chunga chun kum sâwmli Jerusalem- ah ro a rêl a.

en: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Solomon chu a thlatuhai kuomah a in a, a pa David khuoa chun phûm a ni tah a; a naupa Rehoboam chun ama aia chun ro a rêl tah a.
